en: Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the river Chebar, that the heavens were opened, and I saw visions of God.
hmr: Kum sâwmthumna kum, a thla linaa, ni nga ni chun, Kebar vadung panga salhai laia ka um lai chun, vânhai a hung inhawng a, chun, Pathiena thil hmulâwkhai chu ka hmu tah a.

en: In the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of king Jehoiachin’s captivity,
hmr: Chu thla ni nga ni, (chu chu lal Jehoiakin sala ân tâng a kum ngana kum a na).

en: the word of Jehovah came expressly unto Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and the hand of Jehovah was there upon him.
hmr: Kebar vadung panga Kaldaihai rama chun, Buzi naupa thiempu Ezekiel kuoma chun LALPA thu chu fietakin a hung tlung tah a; chutaka chun ama chunga chun LALPA kut chu a um a.

en: And I looked, and, behold, a stormy wind came out of the north, a great cloud, with a fire infolding itself, and a brightness round about it, and out of the midst thereof as it were glowing metal, out of the midst of the fire.
hmr: Chun, ka hang en a, ngai ta, hmârtienga inthawkin thlipui nasa- tak a hung hrâng a, sûm nasatak, meia inlap pup pup, a vêl po poa var, a mei lai tak darsen tle anga tle zur zur a um a.

en: And out of the midst thereof came the likeness of four living creatures. And this was their appearance: they had the likeness of a man;
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawk chun thilhring ang pali an hung suok a. Hi hi an inlang dân chu a nih: mihriem hawina an nei a.

en: and every one had four faces, and every one of them had four wings.
hmr: Hmai pali an nei chit a, thla pali an nei chit bawk a.

en: And their feet were straight feet; and the sole of their feet was like the sole of a calf’s foot; and they sparkled like burnished brass.
hmr: An kehai chu ke intluon ringawt hi an na; an kephahai chu bâwngtê kepha ang a nih; dârsen nâwttle angin an tleh a.

en: And they had the hands of a man under their wings on their four sides; and they four had their faces and their wings thus:
hmr: An sîr lia an thlahai hnuoia chun mihriem kuthai ang kut an nei a; chuongchun, an pali chun chuong ang chun thlahai le hmaihai chu an nei a;

en: their wings were joined one to another; they turned not when they went; they went every one straight forward.
hmr: an thlahai chu ân zawmtuo seng a, an fe pha khawmin an inher ngai nawh a; an rêng el chun hmatieng ngawt an fe el hlak a nih.

en: As for the likeness of their faces, they had the face of a man; and they four had the face of a lion on the right side; and they four had the face of an ox on the left side; they four had also the face of an eagle.
hmr: Chun, an hmaihai inangpui thua chun, mihriem hmai ang an nei a; an pali chun changtieng panga chun sakeibaknei hmai ang an nei a; an pali chun vawitieng panga chun bâwngchal hmai ang an nei a; an pali chun mupui hmai ang hi an nei chit bawk a.

en: And their faces and their wings were separate above; two wings of every one were joined one to another, and two covered their bodies.
hmr: Chun, a chungtienga chun an thlahai an zâr a; an rêng chun, an thla pahnihai chu an zâr zawm a; pahnihai chun an taksa chu ân khum a.

en: And they went every one straight forward: whither the spirit was to go, they went; they turned not when they went.
hmr: Chun, an rêng el chun, hma- tieng zâwng ngawtin an feh a; thlarau a fena tieng tienga chun an fe ve a; an fe lai chun sîrtieng an inher ngai nawh.

en: As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire, like the appearance of torches: the fire went up and down among the living creatures; and the fire was bright, and out of the fire went forth lightning.
hmr: Chuong thilhringhai laia chun thil pakhat, meiling chawklai ang, meiser ang el, thilhringhai laia asuk atunga fe a um a, mei chu a var hle a, meia inthawk chun kâwlinlep a suok a.

en: And the living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.
hmr: Chun, thilhringhai chu kâwl inlep var inkhaw ang hin an tlân a, an kîr nâwk a.

en: Now as I beheld the living creatures, behold, one wheel upon the earth beside the living creatures, for each of the four faces thereof.
hmr: Chu thilhringhai ka en zing lai chun, thilhringhai sîra chun tawlailîr ke, pakhat chutaka hmai palihai pakhat senga dingin, hnuoi chunga chun ka hmuh a.

en: The appearance of the wheels and their work was like unto a beryl: and they four had one likeness; and their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.
hmr: Chu tawlailîr ke inlang dân le an sinthaw chu berul lung zie ang a na, an pali chun inangna an nei seng a; an inlang dân le an sinthaw dân chu tawlailîr kekuol sûnga tawlailîr kekuol um ang a nih.

en: When they went, they went in their four directions: they turned not when they went.
hmr: An fe pha khawm, an sîr lia chun an feh a; an fe pha chun an inher ngai nawh.

en: As for their rims, they were high and dreadful; and they four had their rims full of eyes round about.
hmr: An kekuolhai chu, an insângin ṭi an um hle a; an pali chun kekuol mita siphai chu an nei seng a.

en: And when the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them; and when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up.
hmr: Thilhringhai chu an fe pha chun, tawlailîr kekuolhai khawm chu an sîra chun an fe ve pei a, chun, tawlailîr kekuolhai chu, thilhring- hai chu hnuoia inthawka dawm kâng an ni pha chun, an inkâng ve pei a.

en: Whithersoever the spirit was to go, they went; thither was the spirit to go: and the wheels were lifted up beside them; for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels.
hmr: Khâw tieng tieng khawm thla- rau a fena tienga chun an feh a; thlarau chu a fena tieng tienga chun tawlailîr kekuolhai khawm chu an sîra chun dawm kângin an um a; thilhringhai thlarau chu tawlailîr kekuolhaia chun a um sih a.

en: When those went, these went; and when those stood, these stood; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up beside them: for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels.
hmr: Sâwngsaw an fe pha, hieng khawm hi an feh a; sâwngsaw an ngîr pha hieng khawm hi an ngîr a; chuonghai chu hnuoia inthawka dawm kâng an ni chun, tawlailîr kekuolhai khawm chu an sîra chun dawm kâng an ni veh a, thilhringhai thlarau chu tawlailîr kekuolhaia chun a um sih a.

en: And over the head of the living creature there was the likeness of a firmament, like the terrible crystal to look upon, stretched forth over their heads above.
hmr: Thilhring lua chun vân ang el krustal lung ṭiumtak zie ang, chung- tienga an lu chunga inzâm suok hi a um a.

en: And under the firmament were their wings straight, the one toward the other: every one had two which covered on this side, and every one had two which covered on that side, their bodies.
hmr: Chun, vân ang hnuoia chun an thlahai, tuok khat chu thilhring dang tâwkin ân zâr a; tuok khat dang chun an taksa an inkhum a.

en: And when they went, I heard the noise of their wings like the noise of great waters, like the voice of the Almighty, a noise of tumult like the noise of a host: when they stood, they let down their wings.
hmr: Chun, an lâwn pha chun, an thla ri chu: tui nasatak ri ang elin, Iengkimthawthei râwl ri ang elin, sipai ruol ri ang, buoi mur mur ri ang ka hriet a. An ngîr pha chun, an thlahai chu an sie thlâk a.

en: And there was a voice above the firmament that was over their heads: when they stood, they let down their wings.
hmr: Chun, an luhai chunga vân chunga chun râwl ri a um a; an ngîr pha chun, an thlahai chu an sie thlâk a.

en: And above the firmament that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone; and upon the likeness of the throne was a likeness as the appearance of a man upon it above.
hmr: An luhai chunga, vân chunga chun, lalṭhungpha ang, sapphir lung anga inlang a um a; lalṭhungpha angtak chunga chun mihriem anga inlang a um a.

en: And I saw as it were glowing metal, as the appearance of fire within it round about, from the appearance of his loins and upward; and from the appearance of his loins and downward I saw as it were the appearance of fire, and there was brightness round about him.
hmr: Chun, a kâwng chungtienga po chun ṭhihna zie ang, a vêla a sûnga mei anga inlang ka hmu bawk a; chun, a kâwng le a hnuoitieng inlang dâna chun, mei anga inlangin ka hmuh a, ama vêla po po chun var chu a um a.

en: As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of Jehovah. And when I saw it, I fell upon my face, and I heard a voice of one that spake.
hmr: Ruo sûr nia sûma sumrisâng inlang angin, a vêla varna inlang dân chu a um a. Hi hi LALPA ro- puina angpui inlang dân chu a nih. Chun, chu chu ka hmu phing chun, bawkkhupin ka tlu a, chun, mi pakhat râwl thu hung hrilin ka hriet a.

en: Then I looked, and, behold, in the firmament that was over the head of the cherubim there appeared above them as it were a sapphire stone, as the appearance of the likeness of a throne.
hmr: Chun, ka hang en a, ngai ta, cherubhai lu chunga vâna chun sapphir lung ni âwmtak, lalṭhungpha ang hi a hung inlang a.

en: And he spake unto the man clothed in linen, and said, Go in between the whirling wheels, even under the cherub, and fill both thy hands with coals of fire from between the cherubim, and scatter them over the city. And he went in in my sight.
hmr: Chun, mi puon zai inhmia inchei kuoma chun thu a hril a, “Cherubhai hnuoia tawlailîr kekuol invirhai inkâra chun fe la, cherubhai inkâra meihawl chu i kut khinghniin suksip ve ve la, chun, khawpui chunga chun the dar rawh,” tiin. Chun, ka mithmu ngeia chun a va lût tah a.

en: Now the cherubim stood on the right side of the house, when the man went in; and the cloud filled the inner court.
hmr: Chun, mi chu a va lût lai chun cherubhai chu in changtieng panga chun an ngîr a; chun, sûm chun tuol- lai sûng ril lem chu a suksip tah a.

en: And the glory of Jehovah mounted up from the cherub, and stood over the threshold of the house; and the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was full of the brightness of Jehovah’s glory.
hmr: Chun, cheruba inthawk chun LALPA ropuina chu a tungin a kai a; in kawtkhâr bula chun a ngîr tah a; chun, in chu sûmin a hung sip a, tuollai chu LALPA ropuina var chun a hung sip tah a.

en: And the sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of God Almighty when he speaketh.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai thla ri chu Pathien Iengkimthawtheiin thu a hril laia a râwl angin, tuollai puo lema inthawk khawm chun ân hriet a.

en: And it came to pass, when he commanded the man clothed in linen, saying, Take fire from between the whirling wheels, from between the cherubim, that he went in, and stood beside a wheel.
hmr: Chun, mi puon zai inhmia inchei kuoma chun, “Tawlailîr kekuol invir zinghai inkâra inthawk chun, che- rubhai inkâra inthawk chun, mei la la,” tia thu a pêk chun, a va lût a, tawlailîr kekuol sîra chun a va ngîr tah a.

en: And the cherub stretched forth his hand from between the cherubim unto the fire that was between the cherubim, and took thereof, and put it into the hands of him that was clothed in linen, who took it and went out.
hmr: Chun, cherub pakhat chun che- rubhai inkâra inthawk chun, cherub- hai inkâra mei chu a kutin a hei ban a, a hei lâk tah a, chun, chu chu mi puon zai inhmia inchei kuthaia chun a sieh a, ama chun a lâk a, a fe suok tah a.

en: And there appeared in the cherubim the form of a man’s hand under their wings.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai thla hnuoia chun mihriem kut ang hi a hung inlang tah a.

en: And I looked, and behold, four wheels beside the cherubim, one wheel beside one cherub, and another wheel beside another cherub; and the appearance of the wheels was like unto a beryl stone.
hmr: Chun, ka hei en a, ngai ta, cherubhai sîra chun kekuol pali, cherub pakhat sîrah kekuol pakhat, cherub dang sîrah kekuol dang pakhat ka hmuh a. Chuong kekuolhai inlang dân chu berul lung ang el a nih.

en: And as for their appearance, they four had one likeness, as if a wheel had been within a wheel.
hmr: Chun, an inlang dâna chun, an pali chun inangna an nei seng a, kekuol pakhat chu kekuol dang sûnga um ang elin.

en: When they went, they went in their four directions: they turned not as they went, but to the place whither the head looked they followed it; they turned not as they went.
hmr: An lâwn pha chun, an sîr lia chun an lâwn a; an lâwn lai chun sîrzâwngin an inher ngai nawh a; amiruokchu, a hmasatak chun a nghatna tieng tienga chun an zui pei a; an lâwn lai chun sîrzâwngin an inher nawh.

en: And their whole body, and their backs, and their hands, and their wings, and the wheels, were full of eyes round about, even the wheels that they four had.
hmr: Chun, an taksa pumpui dâm, an ruongzânghai dâm, an kuthai dâm, an thlahai dâm, an kekuolhai dâm, chuong ang palia kekuol an neihai chu, mit ringawt hin a sip vawng a.

en: As for the wheels, they were called in my hearing the whirling wheels.
hmr: Chuong kekuolhai chu, ka hrieta chun kekuol invir zinghai tiha inbûk an nih.

en: And every one had four faces: the first face was the face of the cherub, and the second face was the face of a man, and the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.
hmr: Chun, cherub tin chun hmai pali an nei seng a; hmai pakhatna chu cherub hmai chu a na, hmai pahnina chu mihriem hmai a na, hmai pa- thumna chu sakeibaknei hmai a na, a palina chu mupui hmai a nih.

en: And the cherubim mounted up: this is the living creature that I saw by the river Chebar.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai chu dawm kângin an um a, hi hi a nih Kebar vadung panga thilhring ka hmu chu.

en: And when the cherubim went, the wheels went beside them; and when the cherubim lifted up their wings to mount up from the earth, the wheels also turned not from beside them.
hmr: Cherubhai chu an lâwn pha chun, kekuolhai khawm chu an sîra chun an lo lâwn veh a; cherubhai chun hnuoia inthawka inlakâng dinga an thlahai an suksâng pha chun kekuolhai khawm chu anni sîra inthawk chun an inher hmang chuong nawh a.

en: When they stood, these stood; and when they mounted up, these mounted up with them: for the spirit of the living creature was in them.
hmr: An ngîr pha chun, hieng hi an ngîr veh a, an indawm kâng pha chun hieng hi anni ruolin an indawm kâng veh a; annia chun thilhring thlarau chu a um sih a.

en: And the glory of Jehovah went forth from over the threshold of the house, and stood over the cherubim.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ropuina chu in kawtkhâr bula inthawk chun a fe suok a, cherubhai chunga chun a ngîr tah a.

en: And the cherubim lifted up their wings, and mounted up from the earth in my sight when they went forth, and the wheels beside them: and they stood at the door of the east gate of Jehovah’s house; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai chun an thla- hai chu an zâr a, an fe suok lai chun ka mithmua ngei chun hnuoia in- thawk chun an insukkâng a; kekuol- hai khawm chu an sîrhaia chun an um veh a; chun, LALPA in dâi kawtkhâr saktienga chun an ngîr a; chun, an chunga chun Israel PATHIEN ropuina chu a um a.

en: This is the living creature that I saw under the God of Israel by the river Chebar; and I knew that they were cherubim.
hmr: Kebar vadung panga, Israel Pathien hnuoia thilhring ka hmu chu hi hi a nih; chun, cherubhai an nih ti ka hriet bawk a.

en: Every one had four faces, and every one four wings; and the likeness of the hands of a man was under their wings.
hmr: Cherub tin chun hmai hran pali seng an nei a, thla pali seng leh; chun, an thlahai hnuoia chun mihriem kut angpui a um bawk a.

en: And as for the likeness of their faces, they were the faces which I saw by the river Chebar, their appearances and themselves; they went every one straight forward.
hmr: Chun, an hmêl ka hmuhai ang kha an na, an inlang dân le annihai hrim hrim chu; anni chu tlûntakin hmatieng an fe seng a.

en: Moreover the Spirit lifted me up, and brought me unto the east gate of Jehovah’s house, which looketh eastward: and behold, at the door of the gate five and twenty men; and I saw in the midst of them Jaazaniah the son of Azzur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, princes of the people.
hmr: Chu nawa chun thlarau chun a mi hang dawm kâng a. LALPA in dâi saktieng kawtkhâr, saktieng sawnga chun a mi ṭhuoi tah a; chun, ngai ta, chu dâi kawtkhâra chun mi sâwmhni panga an um a; chun, anni laia chun Azzur naupa Jaazania le Benaia naupa Pelatia, mipuihai hotuhai chu ka hmuh a.

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, these are the men that devise iniquity, and that give wicked counsel in this city;
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, “Mi- hriem naupa, hi khawpuia thurâwn rilo pea, suolna suksuoktuhai chu hieng mihai hi an nih.

en: that say, The time is not near to build houses: this city is the caldron, and we are the flesh.
hmr: Anni chun, ‘Inhai bâwlna ding hun a hnai ta a ni nâwm a nih? Hi khawpui hi sumbepui chu a na, eini hi a sahai chu ei nih,’ an tih a.

en: Therefore prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man.
hmr: Chuleiin, an chunga chun thu hrillâwk la, aw mihriem naupa, hrillâwk rawh,” a ta.

en: And the Spirit of Jehovah fell upon me, and he said unto me, Speak, Thus saith Jehovah: Thus have ye said, O house of Israel; for I know the things that come into your mind.
hmr: Chun, LALPA thlarau chu ka chungah a hung tlung a, ka kuoma chun, “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih ti hril rawh: Aw Israel sûngkuohai, chuong ang chun in hril am a ni; in lungrilhaia thil hung lûthai chu ka hriet sih a.

en: Ye have multiplied your slain in this city, and ye have filled the streets thereof with the slain.
hmr: Hi khawpuia hin in mi thathai chu in sukpung a, chutaka kawtthlêr- hai chu mi thathaiin in suksip a.

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Your slain whom ye have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh, and this city is the caldron; but ye shall be brought forth out of the midst of it.
hmr: “Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih: In ithathai a sûnga in inzâltirhai hi, sa chu an nih; khawpui chu sumbepui chu a nih; nisienlakhawm, a sûnga inthawk chun lâk suokin um a tih.

en: Ye have feared the sword; and I will bring the sword upon you, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm chu in ṭih a; in chung- ah kâwlhnâm chu hung intlungtir ka tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: And I will bring you forth out of the midst thereof, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and will execute judgments among you.
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawk chun la suok ka ti cheu a, hmêlhrietlohai kutah pêng ka ti cheu a, chun, nang- ni lai chun rorêlna chu tirsuok ka tih.

en: Ye shall fall by the sword; I will judge you in the border of Israel; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Kâwlhnâmah tlûng in ta, Israel ramria chun ro rêlpêk ka ti cheu a; chun, LALPA chu ka ni ti hre tâng in tih.

en: This city shall not be your caldron, neither shall ye be the flesh in the midst thereof; I will judge you in the border of Israel;
hmr: Hi khawpui hi in sumbepui chu ni naw nih a, nangni khawm a sûnga sa chu ni nâwng in tih; Israel ramria chun ro ka rêlpêk ding cheu a nih;

en: and ye shall know that I am Jehovah: for ye have not walked in my statutes, neither have ye executed mine ordinances, but have done after the ordinances of the nations that are round about you.
hmr: chun, LALPA chu ka ni ti hre tâng in tih; ka thuruothaia chun in fe nawh a, ka rorêlhai khawm in zâwm si nawh a; amiruokchu, in vêla hnam- hai dân ang chun in thaw ta lem a,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass, when I prophesied, that Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then fell I down upon my face, and cried with a loud voice, and said, Ah Lord Jehovah! wilt thou make a full end of the remnant of Israel?
hmr: Chun, thu ka hril lai chun Benaia naupa Pelatia chu a thi tah a. Chun, ka hmaia hnuoi sikin ka bawk- khup a, râwl inringtakin ka khêk a, “A khai, Lalpa PATHIEN! Israel la um sunhai hi i suktâwp el ding am a nih?” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuom- ah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, thy brethren, even thy brethren, the men of thy kindred, and all the house of Israel, all of them, are they unto whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, Get you far from Jehovah; unto us is this land given for a possession.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, i unauhai, i unauhai ngei, i chipuihai, Israel sûngkuo po po chu, an rêngin, an kuoma chun Jerusalem hluotuhai chun, ‘LALPAA inthawk chun fe hmang unla, keini kuomah hi ram hi nei dinga pêk a ni tah,’ an tih a;

en: Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Whereas I have removed them far off among the nations, and whereas I have scattered them among the countries, yet will I be to them a sanctuary for a little while in the countries where they are come.
hmr: chuleiin, hril la, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; ‘Hnamhai laia inthawka hlataka chun ka lo sawn ta deh a, ramhai laia chun anni chu ka lo sukdar ta deha chu, an va fena ramhaia chun hun sâwt nawtê sûnga ding chun an ta dingin hmun inthieng la ni ta fan ka tih’ tiin.

en: Therefore say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will gather you from the peoples, and assemble you out of the countries where ye have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.
hmr: Chuleiin, ‘Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih, hnamhai laia inthawk chun la khâwm ka ti cheu a, sukdara in umna ramhaia inthawk chun kei khâwm ka ti cheu a, Israel ram chu pêng ka ti cheu,’ ti rawh.

en: And they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things thereof and all the abominations thereof from thence.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun hung an ta, chutaka inthawk chun thil tirdakum- hai po po le thil pawrchehai po po chu la hmang an ta.

en: And I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you; and I will take the stony heart out of their flesh, and will give them a heart of flesh;
hmr: Anni chu lungril hmunkhat pêng ka ta; nangmaa chun lungril thar sie bawk ka tih; chun, an tisaa lungril lung anga ngar chu lâng ka ta, an kuoma chun tisa lungril innêm pêng ka tih.

en: that they may walk in my statutes, and keep mine ordinances, and do them: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God.
hmr: Ka thuruothaia an fe theina ding le, ka dânhai chu an kawl a, an thaw theina dingin; chun, ka mihai hung nîng an ta, kei khawm an Pathien nîng ka tih.

en: But as for them whose heart walketh after the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will bring their way upon their own heads, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an lungrilhaia an tirdakumna le an pawrchenahai zâwmtuhai chu, an lu chunghaia ngei chun an suol maw chu innghat ka tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Then did the cherubim lift up their wings, and the wheels were beside them; and the glory of the God of Israel was over them above.
hmr: Chun, cherubhai chun an thla- hai chu an zâr a, kekuolhai chu an sirahai chun a um a; chungtienga chun Israel ropuina chu an chungah a um a.

en: And the glory of Jehovah went up from the midst of the city, and stood upon the mountain which is on the east side of the city.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ropuina chu khawpui laia inthawk chun a hung suok a, khawpui saktieng sîra um tlâng chunga chun a hang ngîr tah a.

en: And the Spirit lifted me up, and brought me in the vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to them of the captivity. So the vision that I had seen went up from me.
hmr: Chun, thlarau chun a mi dawm- kâng a, Pathien thlaraua thilhmu- lâwknaa chun Kaldaia sal intânghai kuoma chun a mi ṭhuoi tah a. Chuongchun, ka thilhmulâwk hmu chun chungtieng a mi fesan tah a.

en: Then I spake unto them of the captivity all the things that Jehovah had showed me.
hmr: Chun, sal intânghai kuoma chun LALPAIN ka kuoma a lo inentir tah thilhai po po chu ka hril tah a.

en: The word of Jehovah also came unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung nâwk a.

en: Son of man, thou dwellest in the midst of the rebellious house, that have eyes to see, and see not, that have ears to hear, and hear not; for they are a rebellious house.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, nang sûngkaw hel hmang, hmûna dinga mithai nei sih a, hmu lohai, hrietna dinga nahai nei sih a, hre lohai laia chêng, sûng- kaw hel hmang an ni sih a.

en: Therefore, thou son of man, prepare thee stuff for removing, and remove by day in their sight; and thou shalt remove from thy place to another place in their sight: it may be they will consider, though they are a rebellious house.
hmr: Chuleiin, nang mihriem naupa, sal intâng ding angin thuomhnaw intêl la, sûnah an mithmu ngeiah fe suok rawh; chun, an mithmua chun i hmuna inthawkin hmun dangah insawn rawh; sûngkaw hel hmang an ni nâka chu an ngaituo thei rawi mawh.

en: And thou shalt bring forth thy stuff by day in their sight, as stuff for removing; and thou shalt go forth thyself at even in their sight, as when men go forth into exile.
hmr: Chun, i thuomhnaw chu sûnah an mithmuah hung la suok i ta, sal intâng ding angin; chun, sal intânga fe dinghai thaw angin zântieng hun- ah an mithmuah nang ngei chu fe suok i ta.

en: Dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.
hmr: An mithmua chun bang chu ver âwng la, chutaka chun i thuomhnaw chu la suok rawh.

en: In their sight shalt thou bear it upon thy shoulder, and carry it forth in the dark; thou shalt cover thy face, that thou see not the land: for I have set thee for a sign unto the house of Israel.
hmr: An mithmua chun i liengkoah phur i ta, inthima chun phur pei i ta; i hmai khawm hnuoi hmu lo dingin în khum ding a nih; Israel sûngkuohai dinga inchiknaah ka sie ta si cheh a,” tiin.

en: And I did so as I was commanded: I brought forth my stuff by day, as stuff for removing, and in the even I digged through the wall with my hand; I brought it forth in the dark, and bare it upon my shoulder in their sight.
hmr: Chun, chuonga thu pêka ka um ang tak chun ka thaw tah a; ka thuomhnaw chu sûnah ka hung lâk suok a, sal intâng ding ang tak chun; chun, zântieng chun ka kutin bang chu ka ver âwng a; thuomhnaw chu inthima chun ka hung lâk suok a, an mithmua chun ka liengkoah ka phur tah a.

en: And in the morning came the word of Jehovah unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr chun LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, hath not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said unto thee, What doest thou?
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Israel sûngkuo, sûngkaw hel hmang chun i kuomah, ‘Ieng am i thawh a?’ an ti che a ni naw maw?

en: Say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: This burden concerneth the prince in Jerusalem, and all the house of Israel among whom they are.
hmr: an kuoma chun hril la, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih, ti rawh, Hi chungrikna hin Jerusalema lal le Israel sûngkuohai po po an umnahai chu a kâwk a nih.

en: Say, I am your sign: like as I have done, so shall it be done unto them; they shall go into exile, into captivity.
hmr: Hril la, in ta dinga inchikna ka na, ka thaw ta angin an kuoma chun hung tlung a tih, hnawt suoknaa chun, salah an fe ding a nih.

en: And the prince that is among them shall bear upon his shoulder in the dark, and shall go forth: they shall dig through the wall to carry out thereby: he shall cover his face, because he shall not see the land with his eyes.
hmr: Anni laia lal um chun inthim hnuoia chun a liengkoin phur a ta, fe suok a tih; chutaka phursuok- na ding chun bang chu ver âwng an tih; a mithaia hnuoi a hmu nawna dingin a hmai chu inkhum tlat a tih.

en: My net also will I spread upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare; and I will bring him to Babylon to the land of the Chaldeans; yet shall he not see it, though he shall die there.
hmr: Chun, ka lên khawm chu a chunga chun dêngkhum ka ta, ka chânga chun âwk a tih; chun, Kaldai- hai ram Babulona chun ṭhuoi ka ta; chutaka chun thi ding ni sien khawm, hmu chu hmu naw ni.

en: And I will scatter toward every wind all that are round about him to help him, and all his bands; and I will draw out the sword after them.
hmr: Chun, a pâwlhai po po le, ama vêla ama ṭhangpuituhai ding po po chu kil tinah the dar ka ta; an hnunga kâwlhnâm chu phawi ka tih.

en: And they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I shall disperse them among the nations, and scatter them through the countries.
hmr: Chun, ramhaia ka hnawt dar pha le, hnamhai laia ka sukdar pha chu LALPA kha ka ni ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: But I will leave a few men of them from the sword, from the famine, and from the pestilence; that they may declare all their abominations among the nations whither they come; and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, anni laia mi tlâwmte chu kâwlhnâma manih, hri- puia manih, ṭâmnaa inthawkin amani chun hlâng ka ta; an fena tieng tienga hnamhai kâwla chun an tirdakumna po po chu an phuongdar theina dingin; chun, LALPA chu ka ni ti mi hre tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: Moreover the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
hmr: Chu nawa khawm LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, eat thy bread with quaking, and drink thy water with trembling and with fearfulness;
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, i bei kha inthin pumin fa la, i tui khawm kha inthin pum le ṭitak pumin dâwn rawh;

en: and say unto the people of the land, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the land of Israel: They shall eat their bread with fearfulness, and drink their water in dismay, that her land may be desolate, and despoiled of all that is therein, because of the violence of all them that dwell therein.
hmr: chun, kha rama mipuihai kuoma chun, Israel ram le Jerusalem hluotuhai chungthua chun Lalpa PATHIENIN hieng ang hin a tih; an bei chu ṭitumna leh fâng an ta, an tui chu maktina leh dâwn bawk an tih, chutaka chêngtuhai po po pâwng- nêkna leiin, chutaka umhai po pohaia inthawka chu ram chu râusan a ni theina dingin.

en: And the cities that are inhabited shall be laid waste, and the land shall be a desolation; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, khawpui, hluoa umhai chu suksiet nîng a ta, ram chu râusan nîng a tih; chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng in tih,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuom- ah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, what is this proverb that ye have in the land of Israel, saying, The days are prolonged, and every vision faileth?
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, hi thuvar Israel rama in inei, ‘Nihai chu sukseiin a um a, thilhmulâwkhai tin chu a puitling ta nawh,’ ti hi ieng tina am a na?

en: Tell them therefore, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will make this proverb to cease, and they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel; but say unto them, The days are at hand, and the fulfilment of every vision.
hmr: Chuleiin, an kuoma chun hril la, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih, ‘Hi thuvar hi suktâwp ka ta, Israel rama chun thuvarah hmang ta naw ni hai; amiruokchu, an kuoma chun hril la; thilhmulâwk thu tin tlungna chu a hnai tah,’ tiin.

en: For there shall be no more any false vision nor flattering divination within the house of Israel.
hmr: Israel sûngkaw sûnga chun thilhmulâwk teplo amanih, aiena inhlêmna hrim hrim a um ta naw ding a ni sih a.

en: For I am Jehovah; I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall be performed; it shall be no more deferred: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I speak the word, and will perform it, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chu ka ni sih a: thu hril ka ta, chu ka thuhril chu thawin a um ngei ding a nih; sukbahla ni ta ngai naw ni; aw sûngkaw hel hmang, in nihaia chun thu hril ka ta, thaw ni bawk a tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Again the word of Jehovah came to me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung nâwk a,

en: Son of man, behold, they of the house of Israel say, The vision that he seeth is for many days to come, and he prophesieth of times that are far off.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, ngai ta, Israel sûngkuohai chun hieng hin an ta, ‘Thil hmulâwk a hmuhai hi ni sâwttak la hung tlung dinghaia mi ding chu a na, hun la hlataka mi dinghai chu a lo hril a nih,’ tiin.

en: Therefore say unto them, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: There shall none of my words be deferred any more, but the word which I shall speak shall be performed, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, an kuoma chun, ‘Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; ka thu hrim hrim chu sukbahla ni ta naw nih a, amiruokchu, thu ka ihril chu thawin a um lem ding a nih,’ Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel that prophesy, and say thou unto them that prophesy out of their own heart, Hear ye the word of Jehovah:
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Israel rama zâwlnei, anni lungrila inthawk ela thuhrillâwkhai hril hlaktuhai kuoma chun thu hril la, ‘LALPA thu chu lo ngai ta u,’ ti rawh.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah, Woe unto the foolish prophets, that follow their own spirit, and have seen nothing!
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: zâwlnei invêt, iengkhawm hmu si loa mâni ngaidân ngawt zâwmtu chu a chung a rik!

en: O Israel, thy prophets have been like foxes in the waste places.
hmr: Aw Israel, i zâwlneihai chu hmun ṭâwpa sihalhai ang an ni tah a.

en: Ye have not gone up into the gaps, neither built up the wall for the house of Israel, to stand in the battle in the day of Jehovah.
hmr: A âwnga chun in hang fe nawh a, LALPA nia indonaa ngîrna dingin Israel sûngkaw ta ding chun paldâi in siem bawk nawh a.

en: They have seen falsehood and lying divination, that say, Jehovah saith; but Jehovah hath not sent them: and they have made men to hope that the word would be confirmed.
hmr: Anni chun teplo mei mei le vân tieng thil khêl thu an hmu a, LALPA- IN anni chu a tir naw sain, ‘LALPAIN a tih’ tiin an thu chu sukdet ni ngei dingin mihai an inbeiseitir a.

en: Have ye not seen a false vision, and have ye not spoken a lying divination, in that ye say, Jehovah saith; albeit I have not spoken?
hmr: Keiin ka hril nawh a, ‘LALPA chun a hril a nih,’ in ti hin thilhmulâwk teplo chu in hmuin vântieng thil inkhêl chu in hril a ni nâwm a nih?” tiin.

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because ye have spoken falsehood, and seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: “Teplo mei mei in hril a, khêlhai chu in hmu leiin, ngai ta u, nangni chu ka dodâl cheu a nih. Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: And my hand shall be against the prophets that see false visions, and that divine lies: they shall not be in the council of my people, neither shall they be written in the writing of the house of Israel, neither shall they enter into the land of Israel; and ye shall know that I am the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Vântieng thukhêl le, zâwlnei teplo mei mei hmutuhai chunga chun ka kut chu um a ta; ka mihai in- khâwmnaa chun ṭhang ve naw ni hai a, Israel sûngkaw chanchin inziek- naa chun ziek ni bawk naw nih a; Israel rama chun lût bawk naw ni hai a; chun, Lalpa PATHIEN chu ka ni ti mi hre tâng in tih.

en: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there is no peace; and when one buildeth up a wall, behold, they daub it with untempered mortar:
hmr: ‘Inremna,’ tiin ka mihai chu an ṭhuoi suol a; inremna chu a um nawh a, chun, miin bang a siem lai chun, ngai ta, chirhak inhnâk loin an bel a;

en: say unto them that daub it with untempered mortar, that it shall fall: there shall be an overflowing shower; and ye, O great hailstones, shall fall; and a stormy wind shall rend it.
hmr: chuong chirhak inhnâk loa beltuhai kuoma chun, a tla nâwk el ding a nih ti hril rawh, ruo a hrâta hrât hung sûr a ta, riel nasatak tlâng a ta, thlipui nasatakin nuoi a tih.

en: Lo, when the wall is fallen, shall it not be said unto you, Where is the daubing wherewith ye have daubed it?
hmr: Ngai ta u, bang chu a tla pha chun in kuomah, ‘In ibelna chu khâwlai am a um leh?’ an ti naw ding cheu maw?

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will even rend it with a stormy wind in my wrath; and there shall be an overflowing shower in mine anger, and great hailstones in wrath to consume it.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih; Ka lunginsenin thlipui hrângin suksieng ka tih; ka lunginsennaa chun ruo a hrâta hrâta sûr um a ta, a sukbohmang ding lunginsena riel nasatak leh.

en: So will I break down the wall that ye have daubed with untempered mortar, and bring it down to the ground, so that the foundation thereof shall be uncovered; and it shall fall, and ye shall be consumed in the midst thereof: and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, bang chirhak in- hnâk loa in bel kha suksieng ka ta, hnuoiah hung la thlâng ka tih; chuongchun, a lung phûm chu inlang tâng a ta, tlûng a ta, chu sûnga chun sukbohmangin um in tih; chun, LALPA ka ni mi hre tâng in tih.

en: Thus will I accomplish my wrath upon the wall, and upon them that have daubed it with untempered mortar; and I will say unto you, The wall is no more, neither they that daubed it;
hmr: Chuong ang chun ka lungin- senna chu bang chunga le chirhak inhnâk loa beltuhai chunga chun sukpuitling ka ta; in kuoma chun, ‘Bang chu a um ta nawh a, a beltuhai khawm,’ tîng an tih.

en: to wit, the prophets of Israel that prophesy concerning Jerusalem, and that see visions of peace for her, and there is no peace, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Zâwlneihai Jerusalem chung- thu hrillâwktu le inremna um silo inremna dinga thilhmulâwk hmuhai chunga chun, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: And thou, son of man, set thy face against the daughters of thy people, that prophesy out of their own heart; and prophesy thou against them,
hmr: “Chun, nang mihriem naupa, an lungrila inthawka thu hriltuhai, i mihai naunuhai tieng chu ngha rawh; anni kalin thu hril la,

en: and say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Woe to the women that sew pillows upon all elbows, and make kerchiefs for the head of persons of every stature to hunt souls! Will ye hunt the souls of my people, and save souls alive for yourselves?
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun, ‘Nu- hmei, kutrîng tina inbuntir ding ṭhuitu le, thlahai pêl dinga mi saput ieng ang po el lua dinga rawmawl siem chu a chung a rik de! a tih,’ ti rawh. Ka mihai thlahai chu pêlin nangni ta ding chauin thla chu in sandam ding maw?

en: And ye have profaned me among my people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, to slay the souls that should not die, and to save the souls alive that should not live, by your lying to my people that hearken unto lies.
hmr: Buṭei vei khat le bei hlek hmu dingin ka mihai lai chun, mi thi lo dinghai chu that ding le, mi hring lo dinghai chu sandam dingin, thu khêl ngai hlak ka mihai chu hlêmin, ka mihai lai chun i mi lo sukhmingsiet tah a.

en: Wherefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against your pillows, wherewith ye there hunt the souls to make them fly, and I will tear them from your arms; and I will let the souls go, even the souls that ye hunt to make them fly.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih, Ngai ta u, vate anga manna dinga in thil inbuntirhai chu ka dodâl a nih; in kuthaia inthawkin ka keithlêr ding a nih; in man tumhai chu infetir ka ta, vate anga in ipêlhai ngei chu.

en: Your kerchiefs also will I tear, and deliver my people out of your hand, and they shall be no more in your hand to be hunted; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: In rawmawlhai chu keithlêr ka ta, ka mihai chu in kuta inthawkin sansuok ka tih; chun, pêl dingin in kuta chun um ta naw ni hai; chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng in tih.

en: Because with lies ye have grieved the heart of the righteous, whom I have not made sad, and strengthened the hands of the wicked, that he should not return from his wicked way, and be saved alive;
hmr: Mi fel lungril ka suklungngai naw chu thukhêla in suklungzîng tâk leiin mi rilo kuthai khawm in lo suk- hrât tah a, a lampui riloa inthawka a kîr nâwk nawna dingin hringna thu in tiem a;

en: Therefore ye shall no more see false visions, nor divine divinations: and I will deliver my people out of your hand; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: chuleichun, teplo chu hmu nâwk ta naw ti niu a, vântieng thil- hmulâwkhai khawm chu; chun, ka mihai chu in kuta inthawkin sansuok ka ta, LALPA chu ka ni ti mi hre tâng in tih,” tiin.

en: Then came certain of the elders of Israel unto me, and sat before me.
hmr: Chun, Israel upa ṭhenkhat ka kuomah an hung a, ka hmaa chun an ṭhung a.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, these men have taken their idols into their heart, and put the stumblingblock of their iniquity before their face: should I be inquired of at all by them?
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, hieng mihai hin an milimhai chu an lungrilhaia chun an lâk tlat a, an hmaihmaa chun an suolna tlûkna lunghai chu an sie tah a; annihai thu indawn hin ka la um rawp ding am a nih?

en: Therefore speak unto them, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Every man of the house of Israel that taketh his idols into his heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to the prophet; I Jehovah will answer him therein according to the multitude of his idols;
hmr: Chuleiin, an kuoma chun thu hril la, an kuomah, ‘Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih, Israel sûngkuo laia mi tukhawm a milimhai chu a lungril sûnga la tlat a, a hmaihmaa a suolna tlûkna lung sietu zâwlnei kuoma hung si chu, keima LALPA ngeiin a milimhai tamzie ang peiin dawn ka tih;

en: that I may take the house of Israel in their own heart, because they are all estranged from me through their idols.
hmr: an milimhai leia keimaa in- thawka an invâkhmang vawng tâk leiin, Israel sûngkuo chu an lungril- hai ka lâk theina dingin’ tiin.

en: Therefore say unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Return ye, and turn yourselves from your idols; and turn away your faces from all your abominations.
hmr: Chuleiin, Israel sûngkuo kuoma chun hril la, ‘Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Hung kîr unla, in milimhaia inthawkin fe hmang ro; chuongchun, in tirdakumnahai po poa inthawk chun in hmai chu ngha hmang ro.

en: For every one of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that separateth himself from me, and taketh his idols into his heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of his iniquity before his face, and cometh to the prophet to inquire for himself of me; I Jehovah will answer him by myself:
hmr: Israel sûngkuoa mi tin amanih, Israel rama mikhuol inzin mikhuol amanih khawm keimaa inthawka pêthrana, a milimhai chu lungrila la tlata, a hmaihmaa a suolna tlûkna lung sie a, ama ta dinga ka kuoma thu indawn dinga zâwlnei kuoma hung si chu; kei LALPA ngeiin, keiin dawn ka tih;

en: and I will set my face against that man, and will make him an astonishment, for a sign and a proverb, and I will cut him off from the midst of my people; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: chu mipa chunga chun ka hmai innghat ka ta, thuvara inchikna ding- in thilmakah siem ka ta, ka mihaia inthawk chun ama chu sât thlâng ka tih; chun, LALPA chu ka ni ti mi hre tâng in tih.

en: And if the prophet be deceived and speak a word, I, Jehovah, have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand upon him, and will destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei chu hlêmin a um a, thu a hril chun, kei LALPA hin chu zâwlnei chu ka hlêm a na, ama chunga chun ka kut inlet ka ta, ka mi Israelhai laia inthawkin ama chu sukbohmang ka tih.

en: And they shall bear their iniquity: the iniquity of the prophet shall be even as the iniquity of him that seeketh unto him;
hmr: Chun, an suol maw chu phur an ta; zâwlnei suolna chu mi ama kuom- ah zawngtu suolna ang ngei chu nîng a tih;

en: that the house of Israel may go no more astray from me, neither defile themselves any more with all their transgressions; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Israel sûngkuo chu keimaa inthawka an fe pêt ta nawna ding le, an bawsietnahai po po leia anni an insukpawrche ta nawna dingin; ami- ruokchu, ka mihai an hung ni theia, an Pathien ka ni theina dingin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuom- ah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, when a land sinneth against me by committing a trespass, and I stretch out my hand upon it, and break the staff of the bread thereof, and send famine upon it, and cut off from it man and beast;
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, bawsietna thil chu thawin ram chu ka chungah lo suol ta sienla, chun, keiin a chungah ka kut inletin, bei a ringsan chu suksein, a chunga chun ṭâmna tirin, amaa inthawk chun ramsa le mi- hriemhai khawm lo sât thla ta lang;

en: though these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they should deliver but their own souls by their righteousness, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: hi mi pathumhai Noa, Daniel le Job hai meu khawm hi a sûnga chun umhai sien, an felna chun anni hringna chau chu an sanhim ding a nih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: If I cause evil beasts to pass through the land, and they ravage it, and it be made desolate, so that no man may pass through because of the beasts;
hmr: Chun, chu ram chu ramsa tuorhlaumhai chun fe thlengin, sukse hai sien, râusana umin, ramsahai lei chun mi fe paw ngam loin umhai sien;

en: though these three men were in it, as I live, saith the Lord Jehovah, they should deliver neither sons nor daughters; they only should be delivered, but the land should be desolate.
hmr: a sûnga chun hieng mi pathum- hai hi um hai sienkhawm, Lalpa PATHIEN chun, ‘kei ka hring angin, naupa amanih, naunu amani khawm sanhim naw ni hai a, anni le anni chau insanhim an ta; ram chu râusan nîng a tih’, a tih.

en: Or if I bring a sword upon that land, and say, Sword, go through the land; so that I cut off from it man and beast;
hmr: Annawleh, chu ram chunga chun kâwlhnâm ka hung intlungtir a, ‘Kâwlhnâm, ram chu fe thleng rawh’, tia, amaa inthawka ramsa le mi- hriemhai ka sât thlâk chun,

en: though these three men were in it, as I live, saith the Lord Jehovah, they should deliver neither sons nor daughters, but they only should be delivered themselves.
hmr: hieng mi pathumhai hi a sûnga chun um sienkhawm, Lalpa PATHIEN chun, ‘kei ka hring angin, naupa amanih, naunu amanih sanhim naw ni hai a, anni le anni chau insanhim an tih,’ a tih.

en: Or if I send a pestilence into that land, and pour out my wrath upon it in blood, to cut off from it man and beast;
hmr: Annawleh, rama chun hripui ka tir a, a chunga chun, ramsa le mi- hriemhai chu sât thla dinga, thisenin ka lunginsenna ka bunthlâk chun,

en: though Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, as I live, saith the Lord Jehovah, they should deliver neither son nor daughter; they should but deliver their own souls by their righteousness.
hmr: Noa le Daniel le Job chu a sûnga chun um hai sienkhawm, Lalpa PATHIEN chun, ‘kei ka hring angin, naupa amanih, naunu amanih chu sanhim naw ni hai a, an felnain anni le anni chau chu in sanhim an tih,’ a tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: How much more when I send my four sore judgments upon Jerusalem, the sword, and the famine, and the evil beasts, and the pestilence, to cut off from it man and beast!
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti sih a; ‘Ka rorêlna natak palihai kâwlhnâm, ṭâmna, ramsa tuor- hlaumhai le hripuihai hi Jerusalem chunga, amaa inthawka ramsa mi- hriemhai râwthmang dinga ka tir pha chun ieng ang lâwma nasa zuol am a ni ding chu?

en: Yet, behold, therein shall be left a remnant that shall be carried forth, both sons and daughters: behold, they shall come forth unto you, and ye shall see their way and their doings; and ye shall be comforted concerning the evil that I have brought upon Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought upon it.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ngai ta, chutaka chun a mahla lâksuok la ni rawp an ta, an naupasalhai le an naunu- hmeihai chu; ngai ta, in kuoma chun hung suok an ta, an umdân le an thilthawhai chu lo hmûng in tih, chun, Jerusalem chunga thil ṭha naw ka hung intlungtir thua le a chunga ka hung intlungtir po po thua chun sukthlamuongin um in tih.

en: And they shall comfort you, when ye see their way and their doings; and ye shall know that I have not done without cause all that I have done in it, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: An um dânhai le an thilthawhai i hmu pha chun sukthlamuong an ti cheh a, a sûnga ka ithaw tahai po po chu a san um loin ka thaw nawh ti hre tâng in tih,’ Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a.

en: Son of man, what is the vine-tree more than any tree, the vine-branch which is among the trees of the forest?
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, grêphrui kûng, grêp hrui kâu ramhnuoi thing laia um ve bawk chu, thing dang nêkin ieng am a danglam bikna?

en: Shall wood be taken thereof to make any work? or will men take a pin of it to hang any vessel thereon?
hmr: Sin ieng ang khawm thawna dingin chutaka inthawk chun thing lâk suok thei a ni ding am a nih? Annawleh, mihaiin bûr le bêl, khaina dingin a kâute an lâk ding am a nih?

en: Behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel; the fire hath devoured both the ends of it, and the midst of it is burned: is it profitable for any work?
hmr: Ngai ta, thing tiha hmang dingin meia peilût a nih, a hmawr ve ve chu mei chun a kâng hmang a, a lai chu a hung kâng a; sin ieng ding khawma a ṭhahnem am a nih?

en: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less, when the fire hath devoured it, and it is burned, shall it yet be meet for any work!
hmr: Ngai ta, a pumpuia a um lai khawma ieng sina ding khawma a tlâktlai naw a, meiin a kâng hmang zo hnung lem chun a va tlâktlai naw nasa âwmin, a kâng hnung chun sin ieng dingin am tlâktlai tâng a ta!

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: As the vine-tree among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so will I give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Grêphrui thing chu ramhnuoia thing danghai laia meia ti dinga ka pêk angin; chuong ang bawk chun Jerusalem hluotuhai chu pêng ka tih.

en: And I will set my face against them; they shall go forth from the fire, but the fire shall devour them; and ye shall know that I am Jehovah, when I set my face against them.
hmr: An chunga chun ka hmai innghat ka ta; meia inthawk chun fe suok sienkhawm mei bawkin anni chu kânghmang a tih; chun, chuonga anni chu ka hmai kân nghat pha chun LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: And I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, bawsietna thil chu an thaw leiin, ram chu râusanah siem ka tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Again the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung nâwk a,

en: Son of man, cause Jerusalem to know her abominations;
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Jerusalem chu a tirdakumna chu hre dingin siem la,

en: and say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah unto Jerusalem: Thy birth and thy nativity is of the land of the Canaanite; the Amorite was thy father, and thy mother was a Hittite.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun Jerusalem kuomah hieng ang hin a tih, ti rawh; ‘I piengna le i hnam ram chu Kanaan mihai ram a na; Amor mi chu i pa a na; Hit mi chu i nu a nih.

en: And as for thy nativity, in the day thou wast born thy navel was not cut, neither wast thou washed in water to cleanse thee; thou wast not salted at all, nor swaddled at all.
hmr: I pieng dâna chun, i pieng ni chun i laihrui chu ât a ni nawh a, nang chu sukfai ding chein tuia sâwp khawm i ni bawk nawh a; chia saw hrim khawm i ni nawh a, dawm khawm i ni bawk nawh a.

en: No eye pitied thee, to do any of these things unto thee, to have compassion upon thee; but thou wast cast out in the open field, for that thy person was abhorred, in the day that thou wast born.
hmr: I chunga lunginsietna nei dingin le, hieng thilhai hi thawpêk ding chein, tu mit khawma a lunginsiet naw cheh a; amiruokchu, khaw- hnâwmah hnawt suok i ni ta lem a; chuong ang chun i pieng ni chun i mi nina chu tenin a lo um tah a.

en: And when I passed by thee, and saw thee weltering in thy blood, I said unto thee, Though thou art in thy blood, live; yea, I said unto thee, Though thou art in thy blood, live.
hmr: Chun, i sîra ka khêl lai a, i thi- sena insukpawrche vawnga ka hmu chein, i kuoma chun, “I thisena khânga um kha ni la khawm, dam rawh,” ka tih a.

en: I caused thee to multiply as that which groweth in the field, and thou didst increase and wax great, and thou attainedst to excellent ornament; thy breasts were fashioned, and thy hair was grown; yet thou wast naked and bare.
hmr: Ramhnuoi hnader anga pung dingin ka siem cheh a, i hung pung ngei a, i hung ropui a, incheina ṭha bîktak ang chu i hung ni tah a; i nênehai a hung in siem a, i sam dâm khawm a hung ṭo a, amiruokchu, saruok le ruok i la ni tlat el a.

en: Now when I passed by thee, and looked upon thee, behold, thy time was the time of love; and I spread my skirt over thee, and covered thy nakedness: yea, I sware unto thee, and entered into a covenant with thee, saith the Lord Jehovah, and thou becamest mine.
hmr: Chun, i sîr ka hung khêl a, ka hung en che chun, ngai ta, i hun chu hmangaina hun a ni tah a; ka puon chu i chunga chun ka keiphar a, i saruokna chu kân khum tah a; anih, i kuoma chun kân khâm a, nangma le chun thuthlung ka lo siem tah a, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih; chun, ka ta i hung ni tah a.

en: Then washed I thee with water; yea, I thoroughly washed away thy blood from thee, and I anointed thee with oil.
hmr: Chun, tuiin kân sil cheh a; anih, i thisen chu nangmaa inthawk chun ka sâwpfai vawng a, hriek ka nâl cheh a.

en: I clothed thee also with broidered work, and shod thee with sealskin, and I girded thee about with fine linen, and covered thee with silk.
hmr: Puon cheimawiin kân thuom cheh a, seal vun kekawk kân buntir cheh a, puon zai inhmiin ka hrên cheh a, tuktulungêk puonin ka tuom che kha.

en: And I decked thee with ornaments, and I put bracelets upon thy hands, and a chain on thy neck.
hmr: Incheina thuomhaiin ka chei cheh a, i kuta chun bânbunhai kân buntir cheh a, i rîngah khaidiet leh.

en: And I put a ring upon thy nose, and ear-rings in thine ears, and a beautiful crown upon thy head.
hmr: Chun, i hnârah hnârbê le, i na- haia chun nabêhai le, i lu chungah lukhum mawitak ka sieh a.

en: Thus wast thou decked with gold and silver; and thy raiment was of fine linen, and silk, and broidered work; thou didst eat fine flour, and honey, and oil; and thou wast exceeding beautiful, and thou didst prosper unto royal estate.
hmr: Chuongchun, rângkachak le tangkaruoa cheiin i um a; i silfênhai khawm, puon zai inhmi dâm, tuktu- lungêk puon dâm le puon cheimawi dâm an nih; beiphit indîtak le khuoizu le hriek chu i fâk a; i hung hmêlṭha êm êm el a; chun, lalnu khawm chu i hung tling pei tah a.

en: And thy renown went forth among the nations for thy beauty; for it was perfect, through my majesty which I had put upon thee, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: I mawina leiin i hming chu hnamhai laia chun ân darsuok a; kân lalna leia i chunga ka lo sie ta chu, ṭhat famkimna a ni sih a.’ Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: But thou didst trust in thy beauty, and playedst the harlot because of thy renown, and pouredst out thy whoredoms on every one that passed by; his it was.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, i hmêl ṭhatna chu i ring a, i hming inthangna lei chun nawchizawrah i um tah a; nang- ma hung khêltu taphawthai chunga chun i châkna chu i phal a; ama ta a ni tah a.

en: And thou didst take of thy garments, and madest for thee high places decked with divers colors, and playedst the harlot upon them: the like things shall not come, neither shall it be so.
hmr: I silfênhai chu i lâk a, i bâwl- hmunhai chu ze dang dangin i chei a; a chunga chun nawchizawrna thil chu i thaw tah a; chuong ang thil chu um nâwk ta ngai naw nih a, chuong ang chu a la ni ngai bawk nawh.

en: Thou didst also take thy fair jewels of my gold and of my silver, which I had given thee, and madest for thee images of men, and didst play the harlot with them;
hmr: Ka rângkachak le ka tangka în cheina hluhai ka pêkhai che chu i lâk a, mihriemhai limhaia chun i siem a, anni le chun nawchizawrna thil chu i thaw tah a;

en: and thou tookest thy broidered garments, and coveredst them, and didst set mine oil and mine incense before them.
hmr: i puon cheimawihai chu i lâk a, anni chu în khum a; an hmaa chun ka sahriekhai le riminhnikhai chu în tung a;

en: My bread also which I gave thee, fine flour, and oil, and honey, wherewith I fed thee, thou didst even set it before them for a sweet savor; and thus it was, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: ka bei ka ipêk che, beiphit indî- tak, hriek le khuoizu leh, ka châwm- na che chu, an hmaa chun riminhnika dingin i sie ve bawk a, chuong chu a nih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: Moreover thou hast taken thy sons and thy daughters, whom thou hast borne unto me, and these hast thou sacrificed unto them to be devoured. Were thy whoredoms a small matter,
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun, naunu- hmeihai le naupasalhai i mi nei- pêkhai chu i lâk a, an kuomahai chun fâkzoa um dingin inthâwinain i hmang a.

en: that thou hast slain my children, and delivered them up, in causing them to pass through the fire unto them?
hmr: I nawchizawrna chu thil chîn tham a ni ding maw? Ka nauhai i that a, meia infethlengtir dinga an kuoma i pêk hi!

en: And in all thine abominations and thy whoredoms thou hast not remembered the days of thy youth, when thou wast naked and bare, and wast weltering in thy blood.
hmr: I nawchizawrna le i tirdakum- nahai poa hin i tleirâwl lai nihai, saruok le ruoka i um a, i thisena în sukpawrche lai kha i hriet zing ta naw a nih.

en: And it is come to pass after all thy wickedness (woe, woe unto thee! saith the Lord Jehovah),
hmr: “Chun, i rîtlona po po hnunga chun (i chung a rik, i chung a rik! Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih),

en: that thou hast built unto thee a vaulted place, and hast made thee a lofty place in every street.
hmr: hmun langsârtak takhai chu i ta dingin i bâwl a, kawtthlêr tinahai chun hmun insângtakhai chu i ta dingin i siem tah a.

en: Thou hast built thy lofty place at the head of every way, and hast made thy beauty an abomination, and hast opened thy feet to every one that passed by, and multiplied thy whoredom.
hmr: Lam tluongpui tinahai chun i hmun insânghai chu i bâwl a, i mawi- na chu tirdakumnain în changtir a, mi a hung khêl taphawt che kuoma chun în hlîm a, i hurna chu i sukpung tah a.

en: Thou hast also committed fornication with the Egyptians, thy neighbors, great of flesh; and hast multiplied thy whoredom, to provoke me to anger.
hmr: I tuolbâwm, tisa ropuina, Aigupta mi le khawm chun i lo uire tah a; lunginsennaa mi chophâwk dingin i hurna chu i sukpung tah a.

en: Behold therefore, I have stretched out my hand over thee, and have diminished thine ordinary food, and delivered thee unto the will of them that hate thee, the daughters of the Philistines, that are ashamed of thy lewd way.
hmr: Chuleichun, ngai ta, i chungah ka kut kân let a, i bu pângngai chu ka suktlâwm ding a nih, chun, Philistin naunuhai, i lampui tirdakum inza- puituhai, nangma theidatuhai duthu- sâmah pe suok ka ti che.

en: Thou hast played the harlot also with the Assyrians, because thou wast insatiable; yea, thou hast played the harlot with them, and yet thou wast not satisfied.
hmr: Mumal boa i um lei khan Assuria mihai kuoma khawm naw- chizawrah i lo insiem tah a; anih, an kuoma chun nawchizawr thil chu i lo thawa chu i lungawi tâwk si nawh a.

en: Thou hast moreover multiplied thy whoredom unto the land of traffic, unto Chaldea; and yet thou wast not satisfied herewith.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun Kanaan rama chun, Kaldai ram chenin i hurna chu i sukpung a; anâhlakchu chu khawm chun i la lungawi tâwk nawh a.

en: How weak is thy heart, saith the Lord Jehovah, seeing thou doest all these things, the work of an impudent harlot;
hmr: Hieng thil, nuhmei châk tawm tawmhai sin i thaw hi hmuin, ‘I lungril chu a va khawhlo de!’ Lalpa PATHIEN chun a ti a nih.

en: in that thou buildest thy vaulted place at the head of every way, and makest thy lofty place in every street, and hast not been as a harlot, in that thou scornest hire.
hmr: Lampui tluong tinahai chun i hmun langsârhai chu i bâwl a, kawt- thlêr tinahai chun i hmun insânghai chu i siem bawk a; hawman khawm i lâk nawnaa hin nawchizawr el ang khawm i ni nawh.

en: A wife that committeth adultery! that taketh strangers instead of her husband!
hmr: Nuhmei uirenu, mâni pasal nêka mikhuolhai la lemtu!

en: They give gifts to all harlots; but thou givest thy gifts to all thy lovers, and bribest them, that they may come unto thee on every side for thy whoredoms.
hmr: Nawchizawrhai po po kuoma chun miin thilpêkhai an pêk hlak a, nang ruok chu i hmangaihai po po chu thilpêkhai i pêk a, anni chu i tham a, i châknaa ding chun sîr tina nangma kuoma an hung theina dingin.

en: And thou art different from other women in thy whoredoms, in that none followeth thee to play the harlot; and whereas thou givest hire, and no hire is given unto thee, therefore thou art different.
hmr: I châknaa hin nuhmei danghai nêka danglamna a um a, nang chu mi tukhawma châkna ang thaw dingin an hung zui naw chea hin; nang chun hâwman chu i pêk lem a, nangma kuoma chun hawman chu pêk a ni nawh a, chuleiin, i danglam a nih.

en: Wherefore, O harlot, hear the word of Jehovah:
hmr: “Chuleiin, aw nang nawchi- zawr, LALPA thu chu lo hre rawh:

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah, Because thy filthiness was poured out, and thy nakedness uncovered through thy whoredoms with thy lovers; and because of all the idols of thy abominations, and for the blood of thy children, that thou didst give unto them;
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng ang hin a tih; i hmangaituhai kuoma i châkna zâra chun i saruokna chu hmusuok a na, i tirdakumna chu bunsuok a ni bawk lei le; i pawrchena milimhai po po le, an kuoma i lo pêk tah i nauhai thisen po po lei chun,

en: therefore behold, I will gather all thy lovers, with whom thou hast taken pleasure, and all them that thou hast loved, with all them that thou hast hated; I will even gather them against thee on every side, and will uncover thy nakedness unto them, that they may see all thy nakedness.
hmr: ngai ta, chuleichun, i hmangai- hai po po chu ko khâwm ka ta, inhawi i lo chênpuihai po po le, i lo hmangai tahai po po le, i lo theida tahai po po le chun, kil tina inthawkin, i chungah hung ṭhuoi khâwm ka ta, i saruokna po pohai chu an hmu theina dingin an kuoma chun i saruokna chu hâwk ka tih.

en: And I will judge thee, as women that break wedlock and shed blood are judged; and I will bring upon thee the blood of wrath and jealousy.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei inneina dân baw- se le, mâni nau thisen insuo chunga rorêl angin i chungah rorêl ka tih; i chunga chun îtthîkna le lunginsenna thisen chu hung intlungtir ka tih.

en: I will also give thee into their hand, and they shall throw down thy vaulted place, and break down thy lofty places; and they shall strip thee of thy clothes, and take thy fair jewels; and they shall leave thee naked and bare.
hmr: Chun, anni kuta chun pe bawk ka ti cheh a, i hmun langsârhai chu peisieng an ta, i hmun insânghai chu sukchim an tih; i puon sil chu hlîppêk an ti cheh a, în cheina thil hluhai chu lâng an tih; chuongchun, saruok le ruokin mâksan an ti che.

en: They shall also bring up a company against thee, and they shall stone thee with stones, and thrust thee through with their swords.
hmr: Nangma chunga chun in- khâwmpuina nei bawk an ta, lung- haiin dêng an ti cheh a, an kâwl- hnâmhaiin sunthleng bawk an ti che.

en: And they shall burn thy houses with fire, and execute judgments upon thee in the sight of many women; and I will cause thee to cease from playing the harlot, and thou shalt also give no hire any more.
hmr: I inhai chu meiin râwng an ta, nuhmei tamtak mithmua chun i chunga rorêlna chu sukthlûng an ta; chun, nawchizawr anga um chu ma dingin siem ka ti cheh a, chun, hawman khawm pe ta ngai hrim hrim naw ti ni.

en: So will I cause my wrath toward thee to rest, and my jealousy shall depart from thee, and I will be quiet, and will be no more angry.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka lunginthakna chu i chungah hrîtthlâng ka ta, ka îtthîkna chu nangmaa inthawk chun fe hmang tâng a ta, to ṭawk ṭawk ka ta, lunginsen nâwk ta naw ningah.

en: Because thou hast not remembered the days of thy youth, but hast raged against me in all these things; therefore, behold, I also will bring thy way upon thy head, saith the Lord Jehovah: and thou shalt not commit this lewdness with all thine abominations.
hmr: I tleirâwl lai nihai kha i hriet zing ta nawh a, amiruokchu, hieng thilhaia hin i mi suklungsen a; chuleiin, ngai ta, kei khawma i nun suol maw chu i lu chungah hung intlungtir ka tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih; chun, pawrchenahai po po belsain hi khawhlona hi thaw ta naw ti nih.

en: Behold, every one that useth proverbs shall use this proverb against thee, saying, As is the mother, so is her daughter.
hmr: “Ngai ta, mi tukhawm thuvar- hai hmangtu chun hi thuvar hi i chungah hung hmang an tih, ‘A naunu khawm a nu ang bawk,’ ti hi.

en: Thou art the daughter of thy mother, that loatheth her husband and her children; and thou art the sister of thy sisters, who loathed their husbands and their children: your mother was a Hittite, and your father an Amorite.
hmr: Nang chu i nu naunu, a nauhai le a pasal khawm dawnsaklo naunu chu i na, nang chu i zuorpuihai, mâni nauhai le pasalhai khawm dawn- saklohai unaunu chu i na; in nu chu Hit mi a na, in pa khawm Amor mi a nih.

en: And thine elder sister is Samaria, that dwelleth at thy left hand, she and her daughters; and thy younger sister, that dwelleth at thy right hand, is Sodom and her daughters.
hmr: I zuorpui upa lem le a naunu- hmeihai chu i vawitienga chêng Samaria hi a na; chun, i zuorpui naupang lem i changtienga chêng chu Sodom le a naunuhmeihai hi an nih.

en: Yet hast thou not walked in their ways, nor done after their abominations; but, as if that were a very little thing, thou wast more corrupt than they in all thy ways.
hmr: An lampuihai chu i hrawin, an tirdakumnahaia chun i lungawi tâwk nawh a; amiruokchu, hun sâwt nawtê sûngin i um dân po poah anni nêk hmanin i se lem a.

en: As I live, saith the Lord Jehovah, Sodom thy sister hath not done, she nor her daughters, as thou hast done, thou and thy daughters.
hmr: Ka hring zing angin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih, ‘nang le i nau- nuhaiin, nangin i thaw angin i zuor- pui Sodom chun amanih, a naunu khawmin amani khawm a thaw nawh a.

en: Behold, this was the iniquity of thy sister Sodom: pride, fulness of bread, and prosperous ease was in her and in her daughters; neither did she strengthen the hand of the poor and needy.
hmr: Ngai ta, hi hi i zuorpui Sodom suolna chu a nih; ama le a naunuhaia chun chapona, bei ditkhawp, hausaka inhawitirna a um a, mi tlasamhai le mi rimsihai chu a ṭhangpui chuong nawh.

en: And they were haughty, and committed abomination before me: therefore I took them away as I saw good.
hmr: An chapo a, ka hmaa chun tirdakumna an thawh a, chuleiin, ṭha ka ti ang peiin anni chu ka lâk hmang tah a.

en: Neither hath Samaria committed half of thy sins; but thou hast multiplied thine abominations more than they, and hast justified thy sisters by all thine abominations which thou hast done.
hmr: Samaria khawm chun i suol zâtve khawm a thaw nawh a, nang ruok chun anni nêkin i tirdakumna chu i sukpung nasa lem a, chuleiin, tirdakumna i thawhai po po chun i zuorpuihai chu felah în langtir tah a nih.

en: Thou also, bear thou thine own shame, in that thou hast given judgment for thy sisters; through thy sins that thou hast committed more abominable than they, they are more righteous than thou: yea, be thou also confounded, and bear thy shame, in that thou hast justified thy sisters.
hmr: I zuorpuihai fel lema în lang- tirna hin nang ngeiin i muolphona chu phur rawh, anni nêka tirdakum- na nasa lem thawha i suolnahai leiin anni chu nanga nêkin an fel lem a nih, i zuorpuihai chu fel lema în langtir leiin.

en: And I will turn again their captivity, the captivity of Sodom and her daughters, and the captivity of Samaria and her daughters, and the captivity of thy captives in the midst of them;
hmr: “An sal nina chu inlet ka ta, Sodom le a naunuhmeihai sal nina, Samaria le a naunuhmeihai sal nina le, anni laia i salhai sal nina khawm inlet ka tih,

en: that thou mayest bear thine own shame, and mayest be ashamed because of all that thou hast done, in that thou art a comfort unto them.
hmr: an ta dinga thlamuongtu nia i thil lo thaw tahai po poa khan în zak a, i muolphona chu i phur theina dingin.

en: And thy sisters, Sodom and her daughters, shall return to their former estate; and Samaria and her daughters shall return to their former estate; and thou and thy daughters shall return to your former estate.
hmr: I zuorpuihai Sodom le a nau- nuhmeihai le Samaria le a naunu- hmeihai chu an um dân hmasaa bawk kîr nâwk an ta, nang le i naunu- hmeihai khawm in um dân hmasaa bawk kîr nâwk in tih.

en: For thy sister Sodom was not mentioned by thy mouth in the day of thy pride,
hmr: I chapo ni khan i zuorpuinu Sodom chu i ṭawngse hnâwkna ni lo am a nih,

en: before thy wickedness was uncovered, as at the time of the reproach of the daughters of Syria, and of all that are round about her, the daughters of the Philistines, that do despite unto thee round about.
hmr: i rîtlona suklang a ni hma khan? Tuhin amanu angin Suria naunu- hmeihai le a vêla umhai po po le, Philistin naunuhai i kîmvêla hmu- sittuhai che hrilsiet i hung ni ta hi.

en: Thou hast borne thy lewdness and thine abominations, saith Jehovah.
hmr: I hurna le i tirdakumna hremna chu i phur a nih, LALPAIN a tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will also deal with thee as thou hast done, who hast despised the oath in breaking the covenant.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: thuthlung bawsea, inkhâm- na hmusita nangin i lo thaw ta ang khan nanga chunga khawm thâwng ka tih.

en: Nevertheless I will remember my covenant with thee in the days of thy youth, and I will establish unto thee an everlasting covenant.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, i tleirâwl lai nihaia nang le ka thuthlung chu hre zing ka ta; chun, nang le chun cha- tuon thuthlung indin ka tih.

en: Then shalt thou remember thy ways, and be ashamed, when thou shalt receive thy sisters, thine elder sisters and thy younger; and I will give them unto thee for daughters, but not by thy covenant.
hmr: I unauhai, i unu le i sangnu i pawmlût pha chun naunuhmeihai dingin anni chu i kuomah pêng ka tih, i thuthlung lei ruok chu ni loin.

en: And I will establish my covenant with thee; and thou shalt know that I am Jehovah;
hmr: Chun, ka thuthlung chu nang leh sukdet ka tih, chun LALPA ka nih ti mi hre tâng i tih.

en: that thou mayest remember, and be confounded, and never open thy mouth any more, because of thy shame, when I have forgiven thee all that thou hast done, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Thil i lo thawtahai po poa ka ngaidam pha che chun i hriet zing a, i hmai a mâwk a, în zak leia i bau i kâk dêr ta nawna dingin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable unto the house of Israel;
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, thukhirkhân sie suok la, Israel sûngkuohai kuoma chun tekhithu hril rawh;

en: and say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: A great eagle with great wings and long pinions, full of feathers, which had divers colors, came unto Lebanon, and took the top of the cedar:
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih a, Mupui ropuitak, thla ropuitak le chang seitakhai nei, hmula sip, ze hran hran nei chu Lebanona chun a hung a, sidar thing zîka chun a hung a;

en: he cropped off the topmost of the young twigs thereof, and carried it unto a land of traffic; he set it in a city of merchants.
hmr: a zîk insâng tak chu a chuk tan a, Kanaan rama chun a put hmang tah a; sumdâwng mihai khawpuia chun ân thlâk tah a.

en: He took also of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fruitful soil; he placed it beside many waters; he set it as a willow-tree.
hmr: Chun, chu ram thlai chi chu a lâk bawk a, leihnuoi ṭhataka chun a phun tah a; tui tamtak kâwla chun a sieh a; phahrâm thing angin a sieh a.

en: And it grew, and became a spreading vine of low stature, whose branches turned toward him, and the roots thereof were under him: so it became a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs.
hmr: Chun, a hung inṭhang chun, grêphrui inhnuoitaka inzâm mi a hung na, a kâuhai chu ama tieng chun ân zâm lêt a, a zunghai chu ama hnuoia chun an um a; chuong- chun, grêphrui a hung na, kâuhai a hung nei a; dâwnhai a hung insuo tah a.

en: There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and, behold, this vine did bend its roots toward him, and shot forth its branches toward him, from the beds of its plantation, that he might water it.
hmr: Chun, mupui dang ropuitak thla ropuitakhai le hmul tamtak nei a um bawk a; chun, ngai ta, grêphrui chun a zunghai chu ama tieng chun ân kawmtir a, a kâuhai khawm chu ama tienga bawk chun ân dâwn suoktir a, tui a buok zing theina dingin. A phunna hmuna inthawk chun,

en: It was planted in a good soil by many waters, that it might bring forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a goodly vine.
hmr: tui tamtakhai sîrah hnuoi ṭhatna hmuna chun phunsawn a ni tah a, kâuhai a hung insuoh a, ra a hung nei a, grêphrui ṭhatak a hung ni theina dingin.

en: Say thou, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Shall it prosper? shall he not pull up the roots thereof, and cut off the fruit thereof, that it may wither; that all its fresh springing leaves may wither? and not by a strong arm or much people can it be raised from the roots thereof.
hmr: Hril rawh, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih; a puitling ding am a nih? A hna inder tharhai po po chu a vuoi theina dingin a zunghai chu a phâwi dawkin, a rahai chu a sât thlâk naw ding am a nih? A zung- haia phâwi dawktu ding mi tam rak le thilthawtheina nasatak khawm ngai chuong naw nih.

en: Yea, behold, being planted, shall it prosper? shall it not utterly wither, when the east wind toucheth it? it shall wither in the beds where it grew.
hmr: Anih, ngai ta, phunin um de sienkhawm a puitling ding am a nih? Sak thliin a hung mût pha chun, a vuoi vawng el naw ding am a nih? A ṭona hmuna inthawk ngei chun vuoi a tih,” tiin.

en: Moreover the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a;

en: Say now to the rebellious house, Know ye not what these things mean? tell them, Behold, the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and took the king thereof, and the princes thereof, and brought them to him to Babylon.
hmr: “Sûngkaw hel hmanghai kuoma chun thu hril la, ‘Hieng thilhai hi ieng tina am a na ti in hriet naw maw?’ tiin, hril rawh, ngai ta, Babulon lal chu Jerusalema chun a hung a, chutaka lal le, chutaka lal nauhai chu a ṭhuoi a, ama kuomah Babulona chun a fepui tah a;

en: And he took of the seed royal, and made a covenant with him; he also brought him under an oath, and took away the mighty of the land;
hmr: chun, lal chi khawm chu a ṭhuoi a, ama le chun thuthlung a siem tah a, chun, ama khawm chun inkhâmna hnuoiah a hung ṭhuoi a, rama mi thilthawtheihai chu a lâk hmang a;

en: that the kingdom might be base, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping his covenant it might stand.
hmr: lalram chu a hung inhnuoi a, ama khâta ân dawm kâng thei nawna dingin, chu a thuthlung chu a zâwm lei chaua a ngîr theina dingin.

en: But he rebelled against him in sending his ambassadors into Egypt, that they might give him horses and much people. Shall he prosper? shall he escape that doeth such things? shall he break the covenant, and yet escape?
hmr: Amiruokchu, mi tamtak le sakawrhai an pêk theina dingin, ama aiawtu chu Aigupta rama tirin, ama chunga chun a hel tah a. A hlawtling ding am a nih? Chuong ang thil- thawtu chun a pumpel ding am a nih? Thuthlung chu bawse siin a pumpel ding am a nih?

en: As I live, saith the Lord Jehovah, surely in the place where the king dwelleth that made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he brake, even with him in the midst of Babylon he shall die.
hmr: Ka hring zing angin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih; ama chu lala siemtu, a inkhâmna a hmusit le, a thuthlung a bawsietpêk lal umna hmun, ama kuomah Babulon sûng ngeia chun thîng a tih.

en: Neither shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company help him in the war, when they cast up mounds and build forts, to cut off many persons.
hmr: Mi tamtak chu sât thla dinga kulhai bâwla, tlângpâwnghai siema an um pha chun, Pharao le a sipai pâwl thilthawtheitakhai le, a pâwl ropuitakhai chun indonaa dingin iengkhawm thawpêk naw ni hai.

en: For he hath despised the oath by breaking the covenant; and behold, he had given his hand, and yet hath done all these things; he shall not escape.
hmr: Thuthlung chu bawsein, in- khâmna chu a lo pêk tah a, amiruok- chu, hieng thilhai po po hi a la thaw ta rawp sih a; pumpel naw hrim hrim a tih.

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: As I live, surely mine oath that he hath despised, and my covenant that he hath broken, I will even bring it upon his own head.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng ang hin a tih; Ka hring zing angin ka inkhâmna a hmusit le, ka thuthlung a bawsiet ta chu ama lu chunga ngei chun hung intlungtir ngei ngei ka tih.

en: And I will spread my net upon him, and he shall be taken in my snare, and I will bring him to Babylon, and will enter into judgment with him there for his trespass that he hath trespassed against me.
hmr: Chun, a chunga chun ka lên chu keiphar ka ta, ka chânga chun ama chu âwk a ta, ama chu Babulonah hung ṭhuoi ka ta, chutaka chun a bawsietna, ka chunga a lo bawsietna chu a kuomah phût ka tih.

en: And all his fugitives in all his bands shall fall by the sword, and they that remain shall be scattered toward every wind: and ye shall know that I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
hmr: Chun, a pâwlhai po po laia a tlân hmanghai po po chu kâwlhnâm- ah tlûng an ta, chun, a la um zinghai khawm chu kil tinah sukdar ni bawk an tih; chun, kei LALPA hin ka lo hril ta a nih ti hre tâng i tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will also take of the lofty top of the cedar, and will set it; I will crop off from the topmost of its young twigs a tender one, and I will plant it upon a high and lofty mountain:
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; sidar lêr zîk insâng chu lâng ka ta, phun ka tih; a lêr zîktaka inthawk chun a kâu dâwng chu ektliek ka ta, tlâng insângtak le lang- sârtak chungah phun ka tih;

en: in the mountain of the height of Israel will I plant it; and it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a goodly cedar: and under it shall dwell all birds of every wing; in the shade of the branches thereof shall they dwell.
hmr: Israel insângna tlânga chun phun ka ta; kâuhai hung insuong a ta, ra hung nei a ta, sidar thing ṭhatak hung nîng a ta; a hnuoia chun vate tinrênghai chu chêng an ta; chutaka a kâuhai hlima chun chêng an tih.
