en: and say unto the children of Ammon, Hear the word of the Lord Jehovah: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah, Because thou saidst, Aha, against my sanctuary, when it was profaned; and against the land of Israel, when it was made desolate; and against the house of Judah, when they went into captivity:
hmr: Ammon thlahai kuoma chun hieng hin hril la, Lalpa PATHIEN thu chu lo ngai unla, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih: Ka hmun inthieng chu sukhmingsiet a ni laiin le, Israel ram chu râusan a ni laiin le, Juda sûngkuo chu sala an intâng lai khan, ‘I hih,’ i lo ti tâk lei khan;

en: therefore, behold, I will deliver thee to the children of the east for a possession, and they shall set their encampments in thee, and make their dwellings in thee; they shall eat thy fruit, and they shall drink thy milk.
hmr: ngai ta, an nei ding chein khaw- sak mi thlahai kuoma chun ka pêk ding che a nih; an chêngna hmunhai chu i sûnga chun siem an ta, an umna hmunhai chu innghat an tih; chun, i tui chu dâwnin i nênetui khawm chu dâwn bawk an tih.

en: And I will make Rabbah a stable for camels, and the children of Ammon a couching-place for flocks: and ye shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Rabba chu sanghâwngseihai ta dinga inah siem ka ta, Ammon thlahai hmun chu berâmhai ta dinga bawk khâwmna hmunah siem ka tih; chun, LALPA ka nih ti mi hre tâng in tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because thou hast clapped thy hands, and stamped with the feet, and rejoiced with all the despite of thy soul against the land of Israel;
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti sih a; Israel ram chunga hin i lungrila hmusitna po po leh i lo lâwm tah a, i kehai i lo tet a, i kuthai i lo ben tâk leiin;

en: therefore, behold, I have stretched out my hand upon thee, and will deliver thee for a spoil to the nations; and I will cut thee off from the peoples, and I will cause thee to perish out of the countries: I will destroy thee; and thou shalt know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: ngai ta, ka kut chu i chungah kân let tah a, hnamhai kuoma chun râllâk sum dingin ka pêk ding che a nih; chun, hnamhai laia inthawkin sât- thlâng ka ti cheh a; ramhaia in- thawka bohmang dingin siem ka ti che; chun, sukbohmang ka ti cheh a, chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng i tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because that Moab and Seir do say, Behold, the house of Judah is like unto all the nations;
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Moab le Seir chun, ‘Ngai ta u, Juda sûngkuo hi hnam dang po pohai ang bawk a nih,’ an ti leiin,

en: therefore, behold, I will open the side of Moab from the cities, from his cities which are on his frontiers, the glory of the country, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim,
hmr: Ngai ta, Moab sîr khat, khawpui hmawrtâwnghaia inthawkin, a ram ropuina Beth-jesimoth, Baal-meon le Kiriathaim tieng chu ka hawng ding a nih;

en: unto the children of the east, to go against the children of Ammon; and I will give them for a possession, that the children of Ammon may not be remembered among the nations:
hmr: saktieng mihai thlahai kuoma chun an nei dingin Ammon thlahai leh pêng ka tih; Ammon thlahai chu hnamhai laia hriet zing a ni ta nawna dingin.

en: and I will execute judgments upon Moab; and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Moab chunga chun rorêl- na chu sukthlûng ka ta; chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because that Edom hath dealt against the house of Judah by taking vengeance, and hath greatly offended, and revenged himself upon them;
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Edom hi Juda sûngkuo chungah phuba lain le, maw nasatak inphurtirin le, an chunga thungin a lo sawisak tâk leiin,

en: therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah, I will stretch out my hand upon Edom, and will cut off man and beast from it; and I will make it desolate from Teman; even unto Dedan shall they fall by the sword.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Edom chunga chun ka kut inlet ka ta, amaa inthawk chun ramsa le mihriem khawm sât thlâng ka tih, Temana inthawkin râusanah siem ka ta; Dedan chenin kâwlhnâmah tlûng an tih.

en: And I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel; and they shall do in Edom according to mine anger and according to my wrath; and they shall know my vengeance, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ka mi Israelhai kut hmangin Edom chunga chun ka phuba lâkna chu sieng ka ta, ka ṭitumna ang pei le ka lunginsenna ang peiin Edoma chun thâwng an tih; chuongchun, ka phuba lâk chu hre tâng an tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because the Philistines have dealt by revenge, and have taken vengeance with despite of soul to destroy with perpetual enmity;
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Philistin mihai chu phuba lâk angin an lo sawisakin, theida zing zinga sukse dingin lungrila hmusit pumin phuba an lo lâk a,

en: therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah, Behold, I will stretch out my hand upon the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites, and destroy the remnant of the sea coast.
hmr: chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, Philistin mihai chunga chun ka kut inlet ka ta, Kereth mihai chu sât thlâng ka ta, tuipui panga mi um sun hai chu sukbohmang ka tih.

en: And I will execute great vengeance upon them with wrathful rebukes; and they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I shall lay my vengeance upon them.
hmr: Chun, kâwkna ṭiumtak leh phubalâkna nasatak chu intlungtir ka ta; chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih; ka phubalâkna chu an chunga kân nghat pha chun,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwm pakhatna, chu thlaa ni khat ni chun LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, because that Tyre hath said against Jerusalem, Aha, she is broken that was the gate of the peoples; she is turned unto me; I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste:
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Tura chun Jerusalem chunga chun, E he, hnam tinhai dâi kawtkhâr chu a tliek a ni ta hi; tuhin keia kuom tieng a hung inher tah a, kei chu hluosip nâwkin um ka ta; tuhin ama chu suksiet a ni hi, a ti leiin,

en: therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah, Behold, I am against thee, O Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against thee, as the sea causeth its waves to come up.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, aw Tura, nang ka dodâl che a nih; tuipuiin a fâwnhai chu a hung insuoktir angin, hnam tam- takhai chu nangma do ding chein ka siem ding a nih.

en: And they shall destroy the walls of Tyre, and break down her towers: I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her a bare rock.
hmr: Chun, anni chun Tura kul bang- hai chu suksieng an ta, a in insânghai chu sukchim an tih; kei khawma a pilvut chu amaa inthawkin ziet- thlâng ka ta, ama chu lungpui fil ruouah siem ka tih.

en: She shall be a place for the spreading of nets in the midst of the sea; for I have spoken it, saith the Lord Jehovah; and she shall become a spoil to the nations.
hmr: Tuisuorieta lênhai keimarna hmun hung nîng a ta, Lalpa PATHIEN chun, ka hril ta sih a, a tih; chuongchun, hnamhai ta ding chun râllâk sum hung nîng a tih.

en: And her daughters that are in the field shall be slain with the sword: and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: A naunuhmeihai rama umhai chu kâwl hnâma sukhlum nîng an ta, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I will bring upon Tyre Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, from the north, with horses, and with chariots, and with horsemen, and a company, and much people.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti sih a: Ngai ta, hmartienga in- thawkin, lalhai lal Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chu, sakawr taw- lailîrhai leh, pâwl ruol le mi tam- tak leh Tura chunga hin hung ṭhuoi ka ta.

en: He shall slay with the sword thy daughters in the field; and he shall make forts against thee, and cast up a mound against thee, and raise up the buckler against thee.
hmr: Rama i naunuhmei umhai chu ama chun kâwlhnâmin that a ta; kul bâwl khum a ti cheh a; hnuoi dêngpâwng khum a ti cheh a, phaw chawihai inhuol khumtir a ti che.

en: And he shall set his battering engines against thy walls, and with his axes he shall break down thy towers.
hmr: I kul chu epin a kâpna khâwlhai chu rem a ta; i in insânghai chu a hreipuihaiin sukchim a tih.

en: By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover thee: thy walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the wagons, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into thy gates, as men enter into a city wherein is made a breach.
hmr: A sakawrhai tam lei chun pilvut chun hung inkhum an ti cheh a; khawpuia lûtna siema uma, mihai an lût anga, i dâi kawtkhârhaia chun a hung lût pha chun sakawr taw- lailîrhai, tawlailîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai ri chun i kul bang chu inhnîng a ta.

en: With the hoofs of his horses shall he tread down all thy streets; he shall slay thy people with the sword; and the pillars of thy strength shall go down to the ground.
hmr: A sakawrhai ketinhai chun i kawtthlêrhai po po hung chîl a ta; i mihai chu kâwlhnâmin that a ta, i hrâtna bulpui lungphunhai khawm chu hnuoi chungah tlûng an tih.

en: And they shall make a spoil of thy riches, and make a prey of thy merchandise; and they shall break down thy walls, and destroy thy pleasant houses; and they shall lay thy stones and thy timber and thy dust in the midst of the waters.
hmr: I hausaknahai chu râllâk sum- ah siem an ta, i sumdâwngna thilhai khawm chu lâng an tih; i kulhai chu hung suksieng an ta, i in inhawitak takhai chu sukse bawk an ta, i lung- hai, i thinghai i thil nawihai chenin tuihai laia chun sieng an tih.

en: And I will cause the noise of thy songs to cease; and the sound of thy harps shall be no more heard.
hmr: Chun, i hlahai ri chu intâwptir ka ta: i ṭingṭang rihai khawm chu hriet ni ta naw nih.

en: And I will make thee a bare rock; thou shalt be a place for the spreading of nets; thou shalt be built no more: for I Jehovah have spoken it, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, lungpui fil ruouah siem ka ti cheu a, lênhai keimarna hmun hung nîng i tih; chun, bâwl khawm ni nâwk ta naw ti ni; kei LALPA hin ka lo hril ta sih a, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah to Tyre: shall not the isles shake at the sound of thy fall, when the wounded groan, when the slaughter is made in the midst of thee?
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun Tura kuomah hieng hin a tih; I sûnga chun thatna chu siem a ni pha, hliem chu an inrûm pha chun, i tlûkna ria chun thlierkârhai chu an inthin naw ding am a nih?

en: Then all the princes of the sea shall come down from their thrones, and lay aside their robes, and strip off their broidered garments: they shall clothe themselves with trembling; they shall sit upon the ground, and shall tremble every moment, and be astonished at thee.
hmr: Tuisuorieta lalhai po po chu an lalṭhungphahaia inthawk chun ṭhung thlâng an ta, an lal puonhai chu sieng an ta, an silfên cheimawihai chu hlîp an ta, anni chu inthinnain inthuom tâng an tih; leihnuoi chungah ṭhung an ta, ieng lai khawmin inthin an ta, nangma chu maktîng an ti che.

en: And they shall take up a lamentation over thee, and say to thee, How art thou destroyed, that wast inhabited by seafaring men, the renowned city, that was strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, that caused their terror to be on all that dwelt there!
hmr: Chun, nangmaa chun sûnna hla phuok an ta, i kuoma chun, ‘Khawpui hmingthang, tuisuorieta chêng mihai ihluo, Ama le a hluotuhai khawm tuisuorieta hrât, A hluotuhai po po chunga an ṭiumna inumtir thei hiel chu, Iengtiziea suksieta um el am i ni ta leh!

en: Now shall the isles tremble in the day of thy fall; yea, the isles that are in the sea shall be dismayed at thy departure.
hmr: I tlûkna nia chun thlierkârhai chu inthin ngei an tih, Anih, i fe hmang tâk lei chun tuisuorieta thlierkârhai chu beidawng an tih,’ tîng an tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: When I shall make thee a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited; when I shall bring up the deep upon thee, and the great waters shall cover thee;
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti sih a: khawpui hluo loa umhai anga, khawpui râusana uma ka siem pha che chun; li inthûk chu i chunga chun ka hung lâka, tui nasatakhai chun ân khum pha che.

en: then will I bring thee down with them that descend into the pit, to the people of old time, and will make thee to dwell in the nether parts of the earth, in the places that are desolate of old, with them that go down to the pit, that thou be not inhabited; and I will set glory in the land of the living.
hmr: Chun, tienlaia mihai vânsama ṭumhai kuoma chun ṭhuoi ka ti che a, vânsama lo fe thla tahai lai, tienlaia inthawka râusana um tah hmuna hai, leihnuoi hnuoi tieng panga chêng dingin siem ka ti che a; hluo ni ta ngai hrim hrim naw ti ni; chun, mi hring rama chun i ropuina chu sie bawk ta naw ning;

en: I will make thee a terror, and thou shalt no more have any being; though thou be sought for, yet shalt thou never be found again, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: nang chu ṭiumah siem lem ka ti cheh a, um ta naw ti ni; zawngin um hlak la khawm, hmu hrim hrim ni ta naw ti nih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: The word of Jehovah came again unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung nâwk a;

en: And thou, son of man, take up a lamentation over Tyre;
hmr: “Nang mihriem naupa, Tura ta dingin sûnna hla siem la,

en: and say unto Tyre, O thou that dwellest at the entry of the sea, that art the merchant of the peoples unto many isles, thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Thou, O Tyre, hast said, I am perfect in beauty.
hmr: Tura kuoma chun, Aw nang tuisuoriet lûtnaa chênga, thlierkâr tamtakhai kuoma hnamhai dâwr- kaitu, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Nang aw Tura, ‘Mâwinaa chun ka famkim an nâwm,’ i tih a.

en: Thy borders are in the heart of the seas; thy builders have perfected thy beauty.
hmr: I ramrihai chu tuisuoriethai rila chun a um a, Nanga lo bâwltuhai che chun i mâwina an lo sukfamkim ngei el che,

en: They have made all thy planks of fir-trees from Senir; they have taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for thee.
hmr: I thingphêkhai chu an siem, Senir fâr thing vawngin, I lawngngulhai dingin Lebanon sidar thinghai an lâk a.

en: Of the oaks of Bashan have they made thine oars; they have made thy benches of ivory inlaid in boxwood, from the isles of Kittim.
hmr: I lawngzâpna an siem Basan thingsaisuohaiin, I ṭuong chu Kittima thing tlo chi saihaa tuomkhumin.

en: Of fine linen with broidered work from Egypt was thy sail, that it might be to thee for an ensign; blue and purple from the isles of Elishah was thine awning.
hmr: Nangma inchikna bîk a nina dingin I puonzâr chu Aigupta mi puon zai inhmi ṭiel a nih. I inchung chu Elisa thlierkâra inthawka dumpâwl le sendukin.

en: The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were thy rowers: thy wise men, O Tyre, were in thee, they were thy pilots.
hmr: Zidon le Arvada chênghai chu i lawngkartu an na, I mi varhai chu, aw Tura, i sûnga chun an um a,

en: The old men of Gebal and the wise men thereof were in thee thy calkers: all the ships of the sea with their mariners were in thee to deal in thy merchandise.
hmr: I Lawngpuhai an nih. Gebala upahai le mi varhai chu, I sûnga chun i lawng siemtu an na, Tuisuoriet lawng lienhai po po le an lawngpuhai chu I sûngah an um, i sumdâwngna thilhai thleng vêl dingin.

en: Persia and Lud and Put were in thine army, thy men of war: they hanged the shield and helmet in thee; they set forth thy comeliness.
hmr: “Persia le Lud le Put mihai chu, i sipai pâwl indo mihai chu an nih; anni chun nangmaa chun thîrlukhum le phaw chu an khai a, i ngainobeina chu an târlang a nih.

en: The men of Arvad with thine army were upon thy walls round about, and valorous men were in thy towers; they hanged their shields upon thy walls round about; they have perfected thy beauty.
hmr: Arvad mihai chu i sipai pâwlhai le chun a vêlin i kula chun an um a; Gammadim mihai chu i in insânghaia chun an um bawk a. I kul vêl po poa chun phawhai an khai a, i mawina an sukfamkim bawk a.

en: Tarshish was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of all kinds of riches; with silver, iron, tin, and lead, they traded for thy wares.
hmr: Hausakna tinrêng tam leiin Tarsis chu i sumdâwngtu a na; tang- karuo le, thîr le rângva le, suonin i chan dingin an sumdâwng a.

en: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech, they were thy traffickers; they traded the persons of men and vessels of brass for thy merchandise.
hmr: Javan, Tubal le Mesek chu i sumdâwngtu an na, mihriemahai le, dârsen bûr le bêlhaiin i sum dingin an sumdâwng a.

en: They of the house of Togarmah traded for thy wares with horses and war-horses and mules.
hmr: Togarma sûngkuohai chu i chan dingin sakawrhai, indona sakawrhai le sabengtung lien chi haiin an sumdâwng a.

en: The men of Dedan were thy traffickers; many isles were the mart of thy hand: they brought thee in exchange horns of ivory and ebony.
hmr: Dedan mihai chu i sumdâwng- tuhai an ni bawk a; thlierkâr tamtakhai chu i kuta sumdâwngna thilhai chu an na; thalhrit le saiha kihai chu an hung thlengpêk cheh a.

en: Syria was thy merchant by reason of the multitude of thy handiworks: they traded for thy wares with emeralds, purple, and broidered work, and fine linen, and coral, and rubies.
hmr: I kutsuok thil tam leiin Suria chu i sumdâwngtu a na, lunghluhai, puon dum pâwl hai, ṭhuimawi hai, puon zai inhmi hai, lungmantam- hai le, tuihuom lunghaiin an sum- dâwng a.

en: Judah, and the land of Israel, they were thy traffickers: they traded for thy merchandise wheat of Minnith, and pannag, and honey, and oil, and balm.
hmr: Juda le Israel ram chu i sum- dâwngtuhai an na, i thuomhnaw dingin, Minnith bu le, pannag leh, khuoizu le hriek le, thinghnai dam- dawiin an sumdâwng a.

en: Damascus was thy merchant for the multitude of thy handiworks, by reason of the multitude of all kinds of riches, with the wine of Helbon, and white wool.
hmr: I kut sinthaw tam lei le, hau- sakna chi tinrêng tam leiin, Damaska khawm chu i sumdâwngtu a na; sahmul var chi le Helbon uoin chun a sumdâwng a.

en: Vedan and Javan traded with yarn for thy wares: bright iron, cassia, and calamus, were among thy merchandise.
hmr: Vedan le Javan khawm chu i thuomhnaw dingin Uzal uoinin an sumdâwng a, i sumdâwngna thuom- hnaw lai chun thîr tle mi dâm, thingzungthak dâm, mafu dâm an ṭhang a.

en: Dedan was thy trafficker in precious cloths for riding.
hmr: Dedan chu chuongpha puon hlutak takhaia i sumdâwngtu a nih.

en: Arabia, and all the princes of Kedar, they were the merchants of thy hand; in lambs, and rams, and goats, in these were they thy merchants.
hmr: Arabia le Kedar lalhai po po chu i kuta sumdâwngtuhai an na; berâm- tehai, berâmhai, kêlhaiin, hienghaia hin i sumdâwngtuhai an nih.

en: The traffickers of Sheba and Raamah, they were thy traffickers; they traded for thy wares with the chief of all spices, and with all precious stones, and gold.
hmr: Seba le Raama sumdâwngtuhai chu i sumdâwngtuhai an na; i thuom- hnaw dingin rângkachak dâm, lung hluhai po po dâmin, riminhnik bîk taktakhai dâmin an sumdâwng a.

en: Haran and Canneh and Eden, the traffickers of Sheba, Asshur and Chilmad, were thy traffickers.
hmr: Haran le, Kanne le Eden, Seba sumdâwngtuhai chu, Assur le Kilmad leh i sumdâwngtuhai an nih.

en: These were thy traffickers in choice wares, in wrappings of blue and broidered work, and in chests of rich apparel, bound with cords and made of cedar, among thy merchandise.
hmr: Hienghai hi thuomhnaw dittui- hai a dumpâwl fûn le, cheimawihai le, sidara siem, hruihaia khuop sil- fên hlu bâwmhai le, i sumdâwngna thilhai laia sumdâwngtuhai chu an na.

en: The ships of Tarshish were thy caravans for thy merchandise: and thou wast replenished, and made very glorious in the heart of the seas.
hmr: Tarsis lawnglienhai chu i dâwr thuomhnaw phurtuhai an nih: Nang chu hluosip nâwka umin tuisuoriethai lairila chun ropuitaka siemin i um a,

en: Thy rowers have brought thee into great waters: the east wind hath broken thee in the heart of the seas.
hmr: I lawngkartuhai chun tui nasataka chun an hung ṭhuoi cheh a, Sak thli chun tuisuoriethai lairila chun a suksiet cheh a.

en: Thy riches, and thy wares, thy merchandise, thy mariners, and thy pilots, thy calkers, and the dealers in thy merchandise, and all thy men of war, that are in thee, with all thy company which is in the midst of thee, shall fall into the heart of the seas in the day of thy ruin.
hmr: I hausaknahai, i thuomhnaw- hai, i dâwrsumhai, i lawng- puhai, I ṭhuoituhai, i lawng remtuhai, i dâwrsum thleng vêltuhai, I indo mihai i sûnga um po pohai, I sûnga i pâwlhai um po pohai le chun, I sietna nia chun Tuisuoriet lairila chun tlâng in tih.

en: At the sound of the cry of thy pilots the suburbs shall shake.
hmr: I lawngpuhai khêk ri chun a vêl mihai inthin an tih.

en: And all that handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea, shall come down from their ships; they shall stand upon the land,
hmr: Lawngkarna cheltuhai po po le lawngpuhai le Tuisuorieta lawng puhai po po chu, An lawnghaia inthawk hung thlâng an ta, hnuoiah hung ngîr an ta;

en: and shall cause their voice to be heard over thee, and shall cry bitterly, and shall cast up dust upon their heads; they shall wallow themselves in the ashes:
hmr: An râwlhai chu i chunga hriet dingin siem an ta, Lungna takin ṭap an tih. Chun, an lu chunga chun pilvutin inthêkhum an ta, Vuta chun anni chu inbuol an tih.

en: and they shall make themselves bald for thee, and gird them with sackcloth, and they shall weep for thee in bitterness of soul with bitter mourning.
hmr: I ta dingin invâwkawl an ta, saiip puonin inthuom an ta, Rinumtitaka sûna, lungrila natitakin ṭâng an ti che!

en: And in their wailing they shall take up a lamentation for thee, and lament over thee, saying, Who is there like Tyre, like her that is brought to silence in the midst of the sea?
hmr: An ṭapinrûm chun ṭap hla insamin Nangma chu sûn an ti cheh a, ‘Tura anga tuisuorieta to ṭawka um dinga siem hi tu am an um a?

en: When thy wares went forth out of the seas, thou filledst many peoples; thou didst enrich the kings of the earth with the multitude of thy riches and of thy merchandise.
hmr: I thuomhnawhai chu tuisuorieta inthawka a fe suok lai chun Hnam tamtakhai chu i suksip a; I dâwrsum le i hausaknahai chun hnuoia lalhai chu i sukhausa tah a,

en: In the time that thou wast broken by the seas in the depths of the waters, thy merchandise and all thy company did fall in the midst of thee.
hmr: Tui inthûkhaia tuisuoriethaiin a suksiet lai che khan, I dâwrsumhai, i pâwlhai po po i sûnga mi chu nangma leh an tlum tah a.

en: All the inhabitants of the isles are astonished at thee, and their kings are horribly afraid; they are troubled in their countenance.
hmr: Thlierkâr hluotuhai po po chu nangmaa chun mak an tih a, An lalhai chu nasatakin an ṭih a, an hmêl khawm a buoi zo a.

en: The merchants among the peoples hiss at thee; thou art become a terror, and thou shalt nevermore have any being.
hmr: Hnamhai laia dâwrkaihai chun an sisi khum che a, Nangma chu ṭium i lo ni tah a, iengtika khawm um nâwk ta naw ti nih,’” tiin.

en: The word of Jehovah came again unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung nâwk a;

en: Son of man, say unto the prince of Tyre, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because thy heart is lifted up, and thou hast said, I am a god, I sit in the seat of God, in the midst of the seas; yet thou art man, and not God, though thou didst set thy heart as the heart of God;—
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Tura lal kuoma chun hril la, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih; i lungril chu chawisângin a um a, Pathien ka na, Pathien ṭhungphaa chun ka ṭhung a, tuisuoriethai lairila chun i ti leiin i lungril chu Pathien lungrilah ngai la khawm, mihriem i ni si a, Pathien ni loin;

en: behold, thou art wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that is hidden from thee;
hmr: ngai ta, Daniel nêkin i var lem a nih; nangmaa inthawka thup thei ding thurûk hrim hrim a um nawh a,

en: by thy wisdom and by thine understanding thou hast gotten thee riches, and hast gotten gold and silver into thy treasures;
hmr: i varna lei le i hrietthiemna leiin hausaknahai în siempêk a, i ro inhaia chun rângkachak le tangkahai i nei a,

en: by thy great wisdom and by thy traffic hast thou increased thy riches, and thy heart is lifted up because of thy riches;—
hmr: I varna nasatak le i sumdâwng- naa chun i hausaknahai chu i suk- pung a, i hausakna lei chun i lungril chu a lo insâng tah a,

en: therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Because thou hast set thy heart as the heart of God,
hmr: chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih; I lungril chu Pathien lungril anga i siem tâk leiin,

en: therefore, behold, I will bring strangers upon thee, the terrible of the nations; and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of thy wisdom, and they shall defile thy brightness.
hmr: chuleiin, ngai ta, i chungah mikhuolhai ka hung ṭhuoi ding a nih, hnamhai ṭisimtak el chu; i varna mawina chunga chun an kâwlhnâm- hai chu phawi an ta; i tlêtna chu sukpawrchêng an tih.

en: They shall bring thee down to the pit; and thou shalt die the death of them that are slain, in the heart of the seas.
hmr: Khur sûnga chun la thlâng an ti cheh a, thata um tahai thîna anga chun, tuisuoriet lairila chun thîng i tih.

en: Wilt thou yet say before him that slayeth thee, I am God? but thou art man, and not God, in the hand of him that woundeth thee.
hmr: Nangma sukhlumtu che hmaa chun, ‘Pathien chu ka nih,’ i la ti rawp ding am a nih? Mihriem chau i ni sih a, Pathien ni lo, nangma inhliemtu che kuta chun.

en: Thou shalt die the death of the uncircumcised by the hand of strangers: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Mikhuolhai kuta chun sertan- lohai thi angin thîng i ta, keiin ka lo hril ta sih a, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Moreover the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a:

en: Son of man, take up a lamentation over the king of Tyre, and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Thou sealest up the sum, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Tura lal ta dingin sûnna hla siem la, a kuoma chun, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih: Ṭha famkim, varnaa sip le mawinaa famkim i na,

en: Thou wast in Eden, the garden of God; every precious stone was thy covering, the sardius, the topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the onyx, and the jasper, the sapphire, the emerald, and the carbuncle, and gold: the workmanship of thy tabrets and of thy pipes was in thee; in the day that thou wast created they were prepared.
hmr: Pathien huon Edena chun i lo um tah a; Lunghlu tinrênghai chu i în khumna a na, Hieng sardion dâm, topaz dâm, rubi lung dâm, onik dâm, jaspi dâm, Sapphir dâm, karbankle dâm, lunghlu dang dang le, Rângkachakhai, an inṭhutna le ziek kermawihai, Kut themthiema siemhai chu i sûnga chun an um a. Nang chu siema i um ni chun chuonghai chu buotsai an ni veh a.

en: Thou wast the anointed cherub that covereth: and I set thee, so that thou wast upon the holy mountain of God; thou hast walked up and down in the midst of the stones of fire.
hmr: Cherub hrieknâla um, zârkhumtu chu i na, Kân umtir cheh a, Pathien tlâng inthienga chun i um a, Mei lunghai laia chun a suk a tungin i lo inlawn tah a:

en: Thou wast perfect in thy ways from the day that thou wast created, till unrighteousness was found in thee.
hmr: Felnâwna nangmaa hmu suok a ni hmakhat khan chu, Siema i um nia inthawk khan i lampuia chun i ṭhafamkim hlak a.

en: By the abundance of thy traffic they filled the midst of thee with violence, and thou hast sinned: therefore have I cast thee as profane out of the mountain of God; and I have destroyed thee, O covering cherub, from the midst of the stones of fire.
hmr: I sumdâwngna thil tam taluot leiin, I sûng chu inpâwngnêknain an suksip tah a; Thil i suksuol a, chuleiin, sukpawrchea um angin, Pathien tlânga inthawk chun ka hnawt suok ta cheh a, Ka suksiet ta che a nih, aw inkhumtu cherub, Mei lunghai laia chun ka suksiet che a nih.

en: Thy heart was lifted up because of thy beauty; thou hast corrupted thy wisdom by reason of thy brightness: I have cast thee to the ground; I have laid thee before kings, that they may behold thee.
hmr: I mâwina leiin i lungril a lo insâng tah a, I tlêtna lei chun i varna chu i lo suksiet tah a, Hnuoiah ka pei thlawr cheh a, An hmu theina ding chein lalhai hmaa chun kân zâltir che a nih.

en: By the multitude of thine iniquities, in the unrighteousness of thy traffic, thou hast profaned thy sanctuaries; therefore have I brought forth a fire from the midst of thee; it hath devoured thee, and I have turned thee to ashes upon the earth in the sight of all them that behold thee.
hmr: I sumdâwngnaa fel nâwnaa suolna tam leiin, I hmun inthienghai chu i lo sukpawrche tah a; Chuleiin, i sûnga inthawk mei ka hung lâk suok a, A kâng hmang cheh a, hnuoia pilvutah kân changtir cheh a, Nangma entuhai po po che mithmua chun,

en: All they that know thee among the peoples shall be astonished at thee: thou art become a terror, and thou shalt nevermore have any being.
hmr: Hnamhai laia nanga hretuhai po po che chun maktîng an ta, Nang chu mi ṭîsim i ni tah a, um khawm um nâwk ta naw ti nih,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuom- ah a hung tlung a:

en: Son of man, set thy face toward Sidon, and prophesy against it,
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Sidon tieng chun i hmai innghat la, a chungah thu hril rawh,

en: and say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, O Sidon; and I will be glorified in the midst of thee; and they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I shall have executed judgments in her, and shall be sanctified in her.
hmr: hieng hin ti la, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, aw Sidon, ka dodâl che a nih, I sûnga chun ka ropuina suklang ka tih: Chuongchun, LALPA ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih, Amaa ka rorêlnahai chu ka sukpuitling a, Ama ka sukthieng pha chun;

en: For I will send pestilence into her, and blood into her streets; and the wounded shall fall in the midst of her, with the sword upon her on every side; and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: A kawtthlêrhaia chun thisen le hripuihai ka hung tir ding a ni sih a, Chun, a hliemhai chu sîr tinah an chunga kâwlhnâmhai leh tlûng an tih. Chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti hre tâng an tih.

en: And there shall be no more a pricking brier unto the house of Israel, nor a hurting thorn of any that are round about them, that did despite unto them; and they shall know that I am the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: “Chun, Israel sûngkuoa chun a suntu hling um ta naw nih a, an sîr vêla hling buoipuiumhai anni suk- hmingse dinghai chu um ta naw nih a, chun, Lalpa PATHIEN chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then shall they dwell in their own land which I gave to my servant Jacob.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng ang hin a tih; Israel sûngkuohai chu sukdara an umna hnamhai laia inthawka ka lâk khâwm a, hnamhai mithmu ngeia annia sukthienga ka um pha chun, ka siehlaw Jakob kuoma ka lo pêk tah, anni rama ngei khan chêng tâng an tih.

en: And they shall dwell securely therein; yea, they shall build houses, and plant vineyards, and shall dwell securely, when I have executed judgments upon all those that do them despite round about them; and they shall know that I am Jehovah their God.
hmr: Chutaka chun himtakin chêng an ta; anih, inhai bâwl an ta, grêp huonhai siem an ta, himtakin chêng an tih; anni sîr vêla anni sukpawr- chetuhai chunga ka rorêlna ka suk- puitling pha chun, LALPA an Pathien chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the month, the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwmna, thla sâwmna, chu thlaa ni sâwmpahni ni chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, set thy face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and against all Egypt;
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Aigupta lal Pharao tieng chun i hmai innghat la, Aigupta ram po po le, ama chunga chun thu hril la,

en: speak, and say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against thee, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lieth in the midst of his rivers, that hath said, My river is mine own, and I have made it for myself.
hmr: hieng hin ti rawh; Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: ‘Ngai ta, Aigupta lal Pharao, Rûlpui a vadungpuihai laia bawk a, Ka vadungpui hi keia ta bîk a na, Keima ta dingin ka siem tah,’ titu, ka dodâl che a nih.

en: And I will put hooks in thy jaws, and I will cause the fish of thy rivers to stick unto thy scales; and I will bring thee up out of the midst of thy rivers, with all the fish of thy rivers which stick unto thy scales.
hmr: I khâka chun ngakuoihaiin inkuoitir ka ta, I vadungpuia ngahai chu i phuhlipa chun inkawptir tâwl ka tih; Chuongchun, i phuhlipa kawp i vadungpuia i ngahai po po le chun, I vadungpuia inthawk chun hung la suok ka ti cheh a.

en: And I will cast thee forth into the wilderness, thee and all the fish of thy rivers: thou shalt fall upon the open field; thou shalt not be brought together, nor gathered; I have given thee for food to the beasts of the earth and to the birds of the heavens.
hmr: Thlalêra chun peihâwna umin mâksan ka ti che, Nang le i vadungpuia ngahai po po le chun; Ram hmun âwng chunga chun tlâng i ta, Lâk khâwm ni ta naw ti nih a, phûm khawm ni ta naw ti nih. Hnuoia ramsahai le chunglêng vatehai ta dingin, Bu dingin ka pêk ta che a nih.

en: And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am Jehovah, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.
hmr: “Chun, Aigupta ram hluotuhai po po chun, Israel sûngkuo phairuong kuonghai an ni ve leiin, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: When they took hold of thee by thy hand, thou didst break, and didst rend all their shoulders; and when they leaned upon thee, thou brakest, and madest all their loins to be at a stand.
hmr: I kuta an chel lai che chu în tleng dawk a, an liengkohai po po i suk- thlêrpêk a; chun, an innghai pha che khawma, în tâwl hmang a, an kâwng- hai chu ngîr ṭâwk dingin i siem a.

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I will bring a sword upon thee, and will cut off from thee man and beast.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, i chungah kâwlhnâm hung inlet ka ta, nangmaa inthawkin sahai le mihriemhai chu sât thlâng ka tih.

en: And the land of Egypt shall be a desolation and a waste; and they shall know that I am Jehovah. Because he hath said, The river is mine, and I have made it;
hmr: Chun, Aigupta ram chu ram sie le râusan hung ni tâng a ta; ama chun, Vadungpui chu ka ta a na, keia siem a nih, a ti tâk lei khan, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: therefore, behold, I am against thee, and against thy rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from the tower of Seveneh even unto the border of Ethiopia.
hmr: Chuleiin, ngai ta, ka dodâl che a nih; i vadungpuihai khawm chu; Aigupta ram chu se letdêr le râusan- ah Suene in insânga inthawka Ethio- pia ramri chenin ka siem ding a nih.

en: No foot of man shall pass through it, nor foot of beast shall pass through it, neither shall it be inhabited forty years.
hmr: Mihriem ke chun fethleng ta naw nih a, sa ke khawm chu fethleng ta bawk naw ni; chun, kum sâwmli sûng chu hluoin um bawk ta naw nih.

en: And I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and her cities among the cities that are laid waste shall be a desolation forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
hmr: Aigupta ram chu ram râusana umhai laia chun râusanah siem ka ta, a khawpuihai khawm chu suksieta um khawpuiahai kum sâwmli sûng chu râusanin um a tih; chun, Aigupta mihai chu hnamhai laia chun sukdar ka ta, rambunghaia chun anni chu sukdar ka tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: At the end of forty years will I gather the Egyptians from the peoples whither they were scattered;
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti sih a. Kum sâwmli tâwpa chun Aigupta mihai chu sukdara an umna hnamhai laia inthawk chu kei khâwm ka ta;

en: and I will bring back the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their birth; and they shall be there a base kingdom.
hmr: chun, Aigupta sal nina chu hung intlungtir nâwk ka ta, an pieng- na Pathros rama chun inkîrtir nâwk ka ta; chutaka chun lalram inhnuoi nîng an tih.

en: It shall be the basest of the kingdoms; neither shall it any more lift itself up above the nations: and I will diminish them, that they shall no more rule over the nations.
hmr: Lalrama chun ân hnuoi tak nîng a ta; hnamhai chunga chun ama le ama chu indawm sâng ngai ta naw nih a; hnamhai chunga ro an rêl nâwk ta nawna dingin anni chu suktlâwm ka tih.

en: And it shall be no more the confidence of the house of Israel, bringing iniquity to remembrance, when they turn to look after them: and they shall know that I am the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Anni chu enkawl dinga an hung kîr pha, suolna chu hriet zing dinga siemin, Israel sûngkuoa chun ringumna hrim um ta naw nih a; chun, Lalpa PATHIEN chu ka ni ti mi hre tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwmhni pasarina, thla hmasatakah, chu thlaa ni khat ni chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyre: every head was made bald, and every shoulder was worn; yet had he no wages, nor his army, from Tyre, for the service that he had served against it.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar chun Tura dodâlin a sipai pâwlhai chu rawngbâwlna nasa- takin sin ân thawtir a; lusîp tin chu a kawl a, liengko tin chu ân khawk bawk a; ama dodâla a sinthawnaah Turaa inthawkin, ama le a sipaihai khawm chun hlaw iengkhawm an hmu nawh a;

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I will give the land of Egypt unto Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall carry off her multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shall be the wages for his army.
hmr: chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta, Aigupta ram chu Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar kuomah ka pêk ding a nih; a mipuihai chu ṭhuoi hmang a ta, a râllâk sumhai chu lâng a ta, a râlman chu lâng a ta; a sipaihai ta dinga hlaw ding nîng a tih.

en: I have given him the land of Egypt as his recompense for which he served, because they wrought for me, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Keia ta dinga sin an lo thaw ta leiin, a sinthaw mana thungna ding chun Aigupta ram chu ka pêk tah a nih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: In that day will I cause a horn to bud forth unto the house of Israel, and I will give thee the opening of the mouth in the midst of them; and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: “Chu nia chun Israel sûngkuoa chun ki hung inder suok dingin thâwng ka ta, anni laia chun bau kâkna chu pêng ka ti cheh a; chun, LALPA ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, eat that which thou findest; eat this roll, and go, speak unto the house of Israel.
hmr: Chun, ka kuoma chun, “Mihriem naupa, i hmu kha fa la, hi lekhabu zuol hi fa la, chun, fe la, Israel sûngkuohai lai chun thu va hril rawh,” a mi ta.

en: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat the roll.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka bau chu ka kah a, lekhabu zuol chu a mîn fâktir tah a.

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, cause thy belly to eat, and fill thy bowels with this roll that I give thee. Then did I eat it; and it was in my mouth as honey for sweetness.
hmr: Chun, ka kuoma chun, “Mihriem naupa, i phîng kha infâktir la, hi lekhabu zuol ka pêk che hin i phîng kha sukkhawp rawh,” a ta. Chuong- chun, ka fâk tah a; ka baua chun ân hnik dân chu khuoizu ang el a nih.

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah a hril a, “Mihriem naupa, fe la, Israel sûngkuohai kuomah va fe ta, an kuoma chun ka thu hi va hril rawh.

en: For thou art not sent to a people of a strange speech and of a hard language, but to the house of Israel;
hmr: Mi ṭawng danglam le ṭawng intakhai kuoma tir i ni nawh a, Israel sûngkuohai kuoma tir i ni lem;

en: not to many peoples of a strange speech and of a hard language, whose words thou canst not understand. Surely, if I sent thee to them, they would hearken unto thee.
hmr: hnam tamtak ṭawng danglam le ṭawng harsatakhai, an ṭawnghai i hriet thei nawhai kuoma tir i ni nawh. Matheiloin, an kuomah ka tir che chun, i thu chu ngai ding chu an nih a.

en: But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel are of a hard forehead and of a stiff heart.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Israel sûngkuohai chun i thu ngai naw ni hai a, keia thu an ngai naw ding leiin; Israel sûngkuohai po po chu chal changtak, lungril ngartak ruok an ni leiin.

en: Behold, I have made thy face hard against their faces, and thy forehead hard against their foreheads.
hmr: Ngai ta, i hmêl chu an hmaisana chun ka sukngar tah a, an chalhai hmaihmaa chun i chal chu ka sukchang ta bawk a nih.

en: As an adamant harder than flint have I made thy forehead: fear them not, neither be dismayed at their looks, though they are a rebellious house.
hmr: Lungrâl chu meitâwklung nêka a chang lem angin, i chal ka siem tah a; anni chu ṭi dêr naw rawh, anni hei hmua chun beidawng bawk naw la, sûngkaw hel hmangtak ni hai sien- khawm” tiin.

en: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thy heart, and hear with thine ears.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm ka kuoma chun, “Mihriem naupa, i kuoma thu ka hril ding po pohai chu i nahai chun ngai la, i lungrila chun pawm rawh.

en: And go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of thy people, and speak unto them, and tell them, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.
hmr: Chun, fe la, an sal intângnaa chun, i mihai thlahai kuoma chun fe la, an kuomah thu hril la, anni chu hril rawh; an ngai khawmin, an ngaisak naw khawma, ‘Lalpa Pathien chun hieng hin a tih,’ ti rawh,” tiin.

en: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me the voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of Jehovah from his place.
hmr: Chun, thlarau chun a mi dawm kâng a, ka hnungtieng chun râwl ri nasatak ang ka hriet a, “Ama hmuna inthawka suok LALPA ropuina chu inpâkin um raw se,” tiin.

en: And I heard the noise of the wings of the living creatures as they touched one another, and the noise of the wheels beside them, even the noise of a great rushing.
hmr: Thilhringhai thlahai intawk ri le, an sîra tawlailîr kekuolhai tlân khâwm ri nasatak chu a nih ka hriet chu.

en: So the Spirit lifted me up, and took me away; and I went in bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; and the hand of Jehovah was strong upon me.
hmr: Chuongchun, thlarau chun a mi dawm kâng a, a mi lâk hmang tah a; lungawilotak le lunginsen êm êmin ka fe tah a; chun, LALPA kut chu ka chunga chun a hrât hle a.

en: Then I came to them of the captivity at Tel-abib, that dwelt by the river Chebar, and to where they dwelt; and I sat there overwhelmed among them seven days.
hmr: Chun, sal intânghai, Kebar vadung panga Tel-abiba umhai, an umna hmun ngeia chun ka va feh a; chun, an kuomah chutaka chun maktiin ni sari sûng ka ṭhung tah a.

en: And it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Chun, ni sarihai tâwpa chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung a,

en: Son of man, I have made thee a watchman unto the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Israel sûng- kuo vêngtu dingin ka siem che a nih: chuleiin, ka baua thu chu ngai la, keimaa inthawkin vaulâwkna chu pe rawh.

en: When I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; and thou givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wicked from his wicked way, to save his life; the same wicked man shall die in his iniquity; but his blood will I require at thy hand.
hmr: Mi rilo kuomah thu ka hril a, ‘Nang chu matheiloin i thi ngei ding a nih,’ ka tih a, ama chu vaulâwkna khawm i lo pêk nawh a, a hringna chu sanhimna dinga mi rilo chu a lampui riloa inthawk hung kîr dinga vau- lâwkna i lo hril si naw chun; chu mi rilo chu ama suol ngeia chun thîng a tih, amiruokchu, a thisen maw chu nangmaa chun ka hung phût ding a nih.

en: Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mi rilo chu i vaulâwk a, a rîtlonaa inthawkin amanih, a lampui riloa inthawkin amanih a kîr naw chun a suola chun thîng a tih; nisienlakhawm, nang chun i thla chu sansuok i tih.

en: Again, when a righteous man doth turn from his righteousness, and commit iniquity, and I lay a stumblingblock before him, he shall die: because thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in his sin, and his righteous deeds which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his blood will I require at thy hand.
hmr: Chu bâkah mi fel chu a felnaa inthawka ân herhmang a, suol a thaw pha chun, ama hmaa chun tlûkna lung ka sieh a, ama chu thi ngei a tih; ama chu vaulâwkna chu i lo pêk naw leiin, a suolnaa chun thîng a ta; chun, a thil fel thawhai chu hriet zing ni ta naw ni; amiruokchu, a thisen maw chu nangma kutah hung phût ka tih.

en: Nevertheless if thou warn the righteous man, that the righteous sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall surely live, because he took warning; and thou hast delivered thy soul.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mi fel chu vau- lâwkna i nei a, mi fel chu a lo suol nawh a, suol a thaw naw chun, ama chu hring ngei a tih; vaulâwkna chu a pawisak lei chun, nang khawma i thla chu sanhim i tih.

en: And the hand of Jehovah was there upon me; and he said unto me, Arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.
hmr: Chun, LALPA kut chu chutaka chun ka chungah a um a, ka kuoma chun, “Tho la, phai tieng fe suok la, chutaka chun inbiekpui ka ti che,” a ta.

en: Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of Jehovah stood there, as the glory which I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell on my face.
hmr: Chun, ka tho a, phaia chun ka fe tah a, chun, ngai ta, Kebar vadung sîra ropuina ka hmu ang el khan, chutaka chun LALPA ropuina chu a ngîr a; chuongchun, bawkkhupin ka tlu tah a.

en: Then the Spirit entered into me, and set me upon my feet; and he spake with me, and said unto me, Go, shut thyself within thy house.
hmr: Chun, thlarau chu keimaa chun a hung lût a, ka kehai chun a mîn ngîrtir tah a; chun, a mîn biekpui a, ka kuomah, “Fe la, i inah inkhâr khum rawh.

en: But thou, son of man, behold, they shall lay bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:
hmr: Chun, nang mihriem naupa, ngai ta, i chunga chun khuopnahai sieng an ta, chuonghai chun khuop an ti cheh a, anni lai chu fe suok naw ti ni:

en: and I will make thy tongue cleave to the roof of thy mouth, that thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover; for they are a rebellious house.
hmr: chun, i lei chu i dang chungah inkawptir tlat ka ta, ṭawng thei loin um i ta, an kuoma chun kâwktu ni nâwng i tih, anni chu sûngkaw hel hmang an ni sih a.

en: But when I speak with thee, I will open thy mouth, and thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nanga kuoma thu ka hung hril pha chun, i bau chu hawng ka ta, an kuoma chun, ‘Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih,’ tîng i tih. A hre taphawt chun lo ngai raw se; a ngaisak naw taphawt chu ngaisak loin um raw se; sûngkaw hel hmang an ni sih a.

en: The word of Jehovah came again unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung nâwk a:

en: Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Wail ye, Alas for the day!
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, hril la, hieng hin hril rawh, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Ṭapinrûm unla, chungrikna ni chu!

en: For the day is near, even the day of Jehovah is near; it shall be a day of clouds, a time of the nations.
hmr: Ni chu a hnai a, LALPA ni chu a hnai ta si a; Sûm zingna ni, Hnamhai sietna ni chu nîng a tih.

en: And a sword shall come upon Egypt, and anguish shall be in Ethiopia, when the slain shall fall in Egypt; and they shall take away her multitude, and her foundations shall be broken down.
hmr: Aigupta chunga chun kâwlhnâm chu hung a ta, Ethiopiaa chun tuorna nasatak um a tih; Aiguptaa mi thata umhai an tlûk pha chun, A mipuihai chu la hmang an ta, A lungphûmhai khawm chu sukchim nîng a tih.

en: Ethiopia, and Put, and Lud, and all the mingled people, and Cub, and the children of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.
hmr: Ethiopia, Put le Lud mi chi inpawlhai chu, Kus mihai leh, ram ṭhangruolhai mihai chu anni le chun kâwlhnâmin tlûng an tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah: They also that uphold Egypt shall fall; and the pride of her power shall come down: from the tower of Seveneh shall they fall in it by the sword, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Aigupta chelngirtuhai khawm chu tlûng an ta; A thilthawtheina chapona khawm hung inhnuoi a tih; Migdola inthawka Suene chenin kâwlhnâmin tlûng an tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a ti a nih.

en: And they shall be desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and her cities shall be in the midst of the cities that are wasted.
hmr: Ram râusana umhai sûnga chun râusanin um vêng an ta, A khawpuihai khawm chu khawpui suksieta umhai laia chun ṭhang vêng a tih.

en: And they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I have set a fire in Egypt, and all her helpers are destroyed.
hmr: Aigupta rama chun mei ka sêm a, A ṭhangpuituhai po po sukbohmanga an um vawng pha chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: In that day shall messengers go forth from before me in ships to make the careless Ethiopians afraid; and there shall be anguish upon them, as in the day of Egypt; for, lo, it cometh.
hmr: Chu nia chun Ethiopia mi pawisakna neilotuhai chu sukṭi dingin ka hmaa inthawkin mitirhai chu lawnghaiin suok an ta; an chunga chun tuorna nasatak, Aigupta nia ang khan um an tih, en ta, a hung mêk sih a.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will also make the multitude of Egypt to cease, by the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar kut hmangin Aigupta mipuihai chu sukrêm ka tih;

en: He and his people with him, the terrible of the nations, shall be brought in to destroy the land; and they shall draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.
hmr: Ama le, a kuoma a mihai, hnamhai ṭisim chu ram sukse dinga hung ṭhuoilût nîng an ta, Aigupta chu doin an kâwlhnâmhai phawi an ta, ram chu mi thatin suksip an tih.

en: And I will make the rivers dry, and will sell the land into the hand of evil men; and I will make the land desolate, and all that is therein, by the hand of strangers: I, Jehovah, have spoken it.
hmr: Chun, vadungpuihai khawm chu sukkangchat ka ta, ram chu mi rilohai kutah zawr ka tih; mikhuolhai kut hmangin ram le a sûnga umhai po po chu râusanah siem ka tih, kei LALPA ngeiin ka lo hril tah a nih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will also destroy the idols, and I will cause the images to cease from Memphis; and there shall be no more a prince from the land of Egypt: and I will put a fear in the land of Egypt.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Milimhai chu suksieng ka ta, Nopha inthawkin milimhai chu intâwptir bawk ka tih; chun, Aigupta rama inthawk hin lal um nâwk ta naw ni hai a; Aigupta rama hin ṭiumna ka sie ding a nih.

en: And I will make Pathros desolate, and will set a fire in Zoan, and will execute judgments upon No.
hmr: Pathros chu râusanah siem ka ta, Zoana chun mei hung sêm ka ta, Noa rorêlnahai chu sukpuitling ka tih.

en: And I will pour my wrath upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt; and I will cut off the multitude of No.
hmr: Chun, ka lunginsenna chu Sin chunga chun hung bunthlâng ka ta, Aigupta kul dettak chu; Noa mihai chu sât thlâng ka tih.

en: And I will set a fire in Egypt: Sin shall be in great anguish, and No shall be broken up; and Memphis shall have adversaries in the day-time.
hmr: Aigupta rama chun mei hung tîng ka ta, Sin chu rinum nasatakin um a ta; Noa chu suksietin um a tih; chun, Noph chu lunginzîngtakin ni tin um a tih.

en: The young men of Aven and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword; and these cities shall go into captivity.
hmr: Aven le Pi-beseth tlangvâlhai chu kâwlhnâmin tlûng an ta, chun, hieng khawpuihai hi sala ṭhuoiin um an tih.

en: At Tehaphnehes also the day shall withdraw itself, when I shall break there the yokes of Egypt, and the pride of her power shall cease in her: as for her, a cloud shall cover her, and her daughters shall go into captivity.
hmr: Tehaphnehesa chun ni chu hung inthim a ta, chu pha chun Aigupta rîngkawlhai chu suktliek ka ta, amaa chun a thilthawtheina cha- pona chu tâwp tâng a tih; ama chu sûmpuiin hung inkhum a ta, a naunuhmeihai chu salah fêng an tih.

en: Thus will I execute judgments upon Egypt; and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chuong ang tak chun Aiguptaa chun rorêlna chu sukpuitling ka ta; chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwmpakhatna, thla khat- na, chu thla a ni sarinaa chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and, lo, it hath not been bound up, to apply healing medicines, to put a bandage to bind it, that it be strong to hold the sword.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Aigupta lal Pharao bân chu ka suktliek tah a; ngai ta, kâwlhnâm chawi ding tâwka hrât dingin, ngar khuoa tuom dingin, sukdamna damdawihai nâl dinga tuom a ni nawh a.

en: Therefore thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, the strong arm, and that which was broken; and I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
hmr: Chuleiin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Ngai ta, Aigupta lal Pharao chu ka dodâl a, a tliek ta hnung a kut hrâthai chu suktliek ka tih;

en: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
hmr: chun, kâwlhnâm chu a kuta inthawkin intlâktir bawk ka tih. Chun, Aigupta mihai chu hnamhai laia chun sukdar ka ta, rambunghaia chun hnawt dar ka tih.

en: And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand: but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he shall groan before him with the groanings of a deadly wounded man.
hmr: Babulon lal kuthai chu sukhrât ka ta, ka kâwlhnâm chu a kutah sieng ka tih; nisienlakhawm, Pharao bânhai chu suktliek ka ta, ama hmaa chun mi thi khawp raua hliem inrûm- in inrûm a tih.

en: And I will hold up the arms of the king of Babylon; and the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down; and they shall know that I am Jehovah, when I shall put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall stretch it out upon the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Babulon lal bânhai chu chelngîrpêk ka ta, Pharao bânhai ruok chu tlahnuoi a tih; Babulon lal kutah ka kâwlhnâm ka sieh a, Aigupta ram chungah ama chun ân let pha chun LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them through the countries; and they shall know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mihai chu hnam- hai laia chun sukdar ka ta, rambung- haia chun hnawt dar ka tih; chun, LALPA chu ka nih, ti mi hre tâng an tih,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwmpakhatna, thla thumna, chu thlaa ni khat ni chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, say unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his multitude: Whom art thou like in thy greatness?
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Aigupta lal Pharao le a mipuihai kuoma chun hi hi hril rawh; I ropuinaa hin tu ang am i na?

en: Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches, and with a forest-like shade, and of high stature; and its top was among the thick boughs.
hmr: Ngai ta, Assuria chu Lebanona thingkau ṭha tak nei, Buk hlim nei, dung tieng insâng tak a na; A lêrzîk khawm chu kâu inbuk tak laia chun a um a.

en: The waters nourished it, the deep made it to grow: the rivers thereof ran round about its plantation; and it sent out its channels unto all the trees of the field.
hmr: Tuihai chun ama chu a châwm a, li inthûk chun ân ṭhang- tir a, A phunna sîr vêla chun a vadunghai chu a luong a, A tui luongnahai chu loa thing tin kuoma chun a tir a.

en: Therefore its stature was exalted above all the trees of the field; and its boughs were multiplied, and its branches became long by reason of many waters, when it shot them forth.
hmr: Chuongchun, ân sângzie chu loa thing po pohai chunga chawisângin a um a, A kauhai chu a tam a, a zârhai chu tui tam lei chun, An hung inzar suok sei tâwl a.

en: All the birds of the heavens made their nests in its boughs; and under its branches did all the beasts of the field bring forth their young; and under its shadow dwelt all great nations.
hmr: A kâuhaiah chunglêng vatehai po poin buhai an sep a, A zârhai hnuoia chun rama ramsahai po po chun têhai an nei a, A hlim hnuoiah hnam ropuihai po po chu an chêng tah a.

en: Thus was it fair in its greatness, in the length of its branches; for its root was by many waters.
hmr: A kâuhai seizie le a ropuinaa chun chuong anga mâwi chu a na, A zung chu tui tamtaka chun a um sih a.

en: The cedars in the garden of God could not hide it; the fir-trees were not like its boughs, and the plane-trees were not as its branches; nor was any tree in the garden of God like unto it in its beauty.
hmr: Pathien huona sidarhai chun ama chu tluk thei naw nih a, Fâr thinghaiin a kau khawm an tluk nawh, Insethingin a zâr khawm a tluk nawh a, A mâwinaa chun ama ang Pathien huonah thing hrim a um nawh.

en: I made it fair by the multitude of its branches, so that all the trees of Eden, that were in the garden of God, envied it.
hmr: A zârhai tam lei chun ka siem mawi a, Chu lei chun, Pathien huona um Edena thing po pohai chun ama an îtthîk a.

en: Therefore thus said the Lord Jehovah: Because thou art exalted in stature, and he hath set his top among the thick boughs, and his heart is lifted up in his height;
hmr: “Chuleichun, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Insâng tienga chun chawisângin i um a; a lêrzîk chu kâubuk sataka chun ân umtir a, ân sâng lei chun a lungril chu suksângin a um a;

en: I will even deliver him into the hand of the mighty one of the nations; he shall surely deal with him; I have driven him out for his wickedness.
hmr: hnamhai laia mi thilthawthei- tak kutah ama chu pe suok ka ta; ama chu sawisa ngei a ta, a rîtlona lei chun ama chu ka hnawt suok tah a nih.

en: And strangers, the terrible of the nations, have cut him off, and have left him: upon the mountains and in all the valleys his branches are fallen, and his boughs are broken by all the watercourses of the land; and all the peoples of the earth are gone down from his shadow, and have left him.
hmr: Ram dang mi hnamhai ṭisimhai chun, ama chu an sât thlâk a, ama chu an mâksan tah a; tlâng chungahai le phairuom po poahai chun a kâuhai chu an tlah a, a kâuhai po po chu rama tui luongnahai chun an suktliek bawk a; hnuoia hnam tinhai chu a hlima inthawk chun an fe thla a, an mâksan tah a.

en: Upon his ruin all the birds of the heavens shall dwell, and all the beasts of the field shall be upon his branches;
hmr: Suksieta a umnaa chun chung- lêng vatehai po po chu chêng an ta, ram hnuoia sahai po po khawm chu a kâuhai chunga chun um an tih;

en: to the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves in their stature, neither set their top among the thick boughs, nor that their mighty ones stand up in their height, even all that drink water: for they are all delivered unto death, to the nether parts of the earth, in the midst of the children of men, with them that go down to the pit.
hmr: a tâwpa chun tuihai kâwla thinghai po po chun an insâng leiin anni le anni inchawimawi ta ngai naw ni hai a, a kâubuk satak laia chun an lêrzîk khawm chu sie ta bawk naw ni hai a, tui dâwn ta po po chu, an thilthawtheihai chu an in- sâng ang chun ngîr ta naw bawk an tih; vânsama fe thla tahai, mihriem nauhai laia chun, leihnuoi hnuoi tienga chun anni chu thina kuoma pêk an ni ta sih a.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: In the day when he went down to Sheol I caused a mourning: I covered the deep for him, and I restrained the rivers thereof; and the great waters were stayed; and I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and all the trees of the field fainted for him.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Hremhmuna a fe thlâk ni chun, sûnna ka siem a; ama ta dingin li inthûk chu kân khum a, chutaka vadungpuihai chu ka sukchâwl a, tui nasatakhai khawm chu an châwl tah a; chun, Lebanon chu ama sûn dingin ka siem a, chun, rama thinghai po po chu ama lei chun an thidang a.

en: I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall, when I cast him down to Sheol with them that descend into the pit; and all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the nether parts of the earth.
hmr: Vânsama ṭum tahai laia, hrem- hmuna ka pei thlâk lai chun, a tlûkna ria chun hnamhai chu ka sukthin a; Eden thing po po Lebanona thing ṭhatak le ditumhai, tui lo dâwn tahai po po chu hnuoi khingtieng panga chun sukhlimin an um a.

en: They also went down into Sheol with him unto them that are slain by the sword; yea, they that were his arm, that dwelt under his shadow in the midst of the nations.
hmr: Kâwlhnâma thata lo um tahai kuomah, ama ruolin hremhmuna chun an fe thla ve a; anih, a bân lo ni taha, hnamhai laia a buk hlim hnuoia lo chêng tahai chu.

en: To whom art thou thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? yet shalt thou be brought down with the trees of Eden unto the nether parts of the earth: thou shalt lie in the midst of the uncircumcised, with them that are slain by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: “Edena thinghai laia hin ro- puina le mawinaah ieng le hin am in inang a? Hnuoi khingtieng panga chun Eden thinghai le chun nang chu sukhnuoi i la ni ding a nih; kâwl- hnâma thata lo um tah, sertan lohai laia chun i zâl ve ding a nih; Hi hi Pharao le a mipuihai chu an nih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, in the first day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwmpahnina, thla sâwm- pahnina, chu thlaa ni khat ni chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, take up a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say unto him, Thou wast likened unto a young lion of the nations: yet art thou as a monster in the seas; and thou didst break forth with thy rivers, and troubledst the waters with thy feet, and fouledst their rivers.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Aigupta lal Pharao ta dingin sûnna hla siem la, a kuoma chun hril rawh; Nang chu hnamhai lai chun sakeibaknei vânglaiah în ngai a, Amiruokchu, tuisuorieta rûlpui ang chu i nih; I vadungpuihaia chun i hung inper a, I kehaiin tuihai chu i hung chawkvir a, An vadungpuihai chu i hung suksiet tah a.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: I will spread out my net upon thee with a company of many peoples; and they shall bring thee up in my net.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih: Hnam tamtakhai pâwlhai le chun i chungah ka lên hung keiphar kan ta, Ka lêna chun hung fûn dawk kan ti che.

en: And I will leave thee upon the land, I will cast thee forth upon the open field, and will cause all the birds of the heavens to settle upon thee, and I will satisfy the beasts of the whole earth with thee.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi chungah mâksan ka ti cheh a, Ram palailakah peihâwn ka ti cheh a; Chunglêng vatehai po po chu i chungah in umtir ka ta, Nangmaa chun hnuoi pumpuia ramsahai chu suktlai ka tih.

en: And I will lay thy flesh upon the mountains, and fill the valleys with thy height.
hmr: Tlânghaia chun i sa chu sieng ka ta, Phairuomhai chu i nge in suksip ka tih.

en: I will also water with thy blood the land wherein thou swimmest, even to the mountains; and the watercourses shall be full of thee.
hmr: Chun, în hlieuna ram chu tlânghai chen rauin i thisenin buok ka ta, Tui luongnahai chu nangmaa suksipin um an tih.

en: And when I shall extinguish thee, I will cover the heavens, and make the stars thereof dark; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the moon shall not give its light.
hmr: Nang chu ka hung sukriral zo pha che chun, Vân chu inkhum ka ta, Arasihai chu inthimtir ka tih. Nisa chu sûmin inkhum ka ta, thla khawma a varna insuo naw nih.

en: All the bright lights of heaven will I make dark over thee, and set darkness upon thy land, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Vâna thil var tlêhai po po chu i chunga chun sukthim ka ta, I ram chunga chun inthim inlêngtir ka tih Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: I will also vex the hearts of many peoples, when I shall bring thy destruction among the nations, into the countries which thou hast not known.
hmr: “Rambung i hriet ngailohai laia, hnamhai laia i bohmangna kân tlung- tir pha chun, hnam tamtakhai lung- rilhai chu suklungsen ka tih.

en: Yea, I will make many peoples amazed at thee, and their kings shall be horribly afraid for thee, when I shall brandish my sword before them; and they shall tremble at every moment, every man for his own life, in the day of thy fall.
hmr: Anih, hnam tamtakhai chu nangmaa chun mak intitir ka ta, nangma leiin an lalhai chu nasatakin ṭîng an tih, an hma ngeia ka kâwl- hnâm kân let pha chun; inthin zing an ta, i tlûk ni chun mi tin chu mâni hringna ding sengin inthin an tih.

en: For thus saith the Lord Jehovah: The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon thee.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti sih a; Babulon lal kâwlhnâm chu i chungah hung tlung a ta.

en: By the swords of the mighty will I cause thy multitude to fall; the terrible of the nations are they all: and they shall bring to nought the pride of Egypt, and all the multitude thereof shall be destroyed.
hmr: Mi thilthawthei tak kâwlhnâm- haia chun i mipuihai chu intlûktir ka tih; hnamhai ṭisimhai chu an ni vawng a; Aigupta chapona chu suksieng an ta, A mipuihai po po sukbohmang ni bawk an tih.

en: I will destroy also all the beasts thereof from beside many waters; neither shall the foot of man trouble them any more, nor the hoofs of beasts trouble them.
hmr: Tui tamtakhai kâwla ramsahai po po khawm chu sukbohmang ka ta, Mihriem ke chun anni chu sukbuoi ta ngai naw ni hai a, Ramsa ketinhai khawm chun anni chu sukbuoi ta naw bawk an tih.

en: Then will I make their waters clear, and cause their rivers to run like oil, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: “Chun, an tuihai chu hung sukvâr ka ta, An vadung tuihai chu hriek angin inluongtir ka tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: When I shall make the land of Egypt desolate and waste, a land destitute of that whereof it was full, when I shall smite all them that dwell therein, then shall they know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: Aigupta ram chu suksiet le râusan le, Ram hausa, sukruoka umah ka siem a, Chutaka umhai chu an rênga ka hrem pha chun, LALPA chu ka nih ti mi hre tâng an tih.

en: This is the lamentation wherewith they shall lament; the daughters of the nations shall lament therewith; over Egypt, and over all her multitude, shall they lament therewith, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: “Hi hi ṭap hla an isûnna ding chu a nih; chu chun hnam tin naunu- hmeihai chun sûn an ta, Aigupta le a mipuihai po po ta dingin sûn an tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: It came to pass also in the twelfth year, in the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: Kum sâwmpahnina, chu thla ni sâwm panga ni chun, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a,

en: Son of man, wail for the multitude of Egypt, and cast them down, even her, and the daughters of the famous nations, unto the nether parts of the earth, with them that go down into the pit.
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, Aigupta mipui ta ding chun ṭap inrûm la, vânsama lo fe thla tahai le chun, hnuoi khing- tieng panga chun, hnam hming in- thangtak tak naunuhmeihai le, ama leh pei thla rawh.

en: Whom dost thou pass in beauty? go down, and be thou laid with the uncircumcised.
hmr: Mawinaa hin tu am i khêl a? Fe thla la, sertan lohai laia chun zâl rawh.

en: They shall fall in the midst of them that are slain by the sword: she is delivered to the sword; draw her away and all her multitudes.
hmr: Kâwlhnâma thata umhai laia chun tlu vêng an ta, kâwlhnâm kuom- a chun pêk a ni tah a, ama le a mipui- hai po po le chun hnûk hmang rawh.

en: The strong among the mighty shall speak to him out of the midst of Sheol with them that help him: they are gone down, they lie still, even the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.
hmr: Mi hrât khawkhêng laia mi hrât chun hremhmuna inthawk chun, ama ṭhangpuituhai le chun lo bieng an ta; an fe thla tah a, an zâl zing a; chuong sertanlo, kâwlhnâma thata lo um tahai chu.

en: Asshur is there and all her company; her graves are round about her; all of them slain, fallen by the sword;
hmr: Assuria chu a pâwlhai leh chutaka chun a um a; a thlânhai chu ama vêlahai po po chun a um a; an rêng chun kâwlhnâma lo tlu tah, thata lo um tah an nih;

en: whose graves are set in the uttermost parts of the pit, and her company is round about her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who caused terror in the land of the living.
hmr: chuonghai thlânhai chu vânsam kilkhâwrtakahai chun siein a um a, an rêng chun kâwlhnâma lo tlu tah, thata lo um tah, mi hringhai rama ṭitumna lo inumtirtuhai chu an nih.

en: There is Elam and all her multitude round about her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who are gone down uncircumcised into the nether parts of the earth, who caused their terror in the land of the living, and have borne their shame with them that go down to the pit.
hmr: Elam khawm chu a mipuihai po po leh a thlân sîrvêlahai chun an um a; an rêng chun kâwlhnâma lo tlu tah, thata lo um tahai, hnuoi khingtieng panga sertan loa lo fe thla tah a, mi hring rama chun an ṭitumna chu lo inumtir tah a, vânsama fe tahai le an inzakna chu lo phur tahai chu an nih.

en: They have set her a bed in the midst of the slain with all her multitude; her graves are round about her; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for their terror was caused in the land of the living, and they have borne their shame with them that go down to the pit: he is put in the midst of them that are slain.
hmr: A pâwlhai po po leh thata lo um tahai laia chun a khum chu an lo daw tah a; an thlânhai chu ama sîrvêlahai chun a um a; an rêng el chun sertanlo, kâwlhnâma lo tlu tahai an nih; an ṭitumna chu mi hring rama chun inumtirin a lo um tah a, vânsama lo fe tahai le chun an inzakna chu an phur a; thata lo um tahai laia chun ama chu sie a lo ni tah a.

en: There is Meshech, Tubal, and all their multitude; their graves are round about them; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for they caused their terror in the land of the living.
hmr: Mesek le Tubal le an mipuihai po po leh an um a, an thlânhai chu a sîrvêlahai chun a um a, an rêng el chun sertanlo, kâwlhnâma lo tlu tah an na, mi hring rama chun an ṭitum- na chu an lo inumtir tah a.

en: And they shall not lie with the mighty that are fallen of the uncircumcised, that are gone down to Sheol with their weapons of war, and have laid their swords under their heads, and their iniquities are upon their bones; for they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
hmr: Anni chu mi thilthawtheihai, sertanloa lo tlu taha, an indona hriemhreihai le hremhmuna lo fe thla taha, an luhai hnuoia an kâwlhnâm- hai lo siea, an suolnahai chu an ru- haia umhai laia chun anni chu zâl ve naw ni hai a; mi hring rama chun mi hrâthai ṭisimhai chu an lo ni ta sih a.

en: But thou shalt be broken in the midst of the uncircumcised, and shalt lie with them that are slain by the sword.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nang chu ser- tanlohai laia chun suknawi nîng i ta, kâwlhnâma thata lo um tahai laia chun zâl vêng i tih.

en: There is Edom, her kings and all her princes, who in their might are laid with them that are slain by the sword: they shall lie with the uncircumcised, and with them that go down to the pit.
hmr: Edom chu a um a, a lalhai le a rorêltuhai po po chu an thilthaw- theinain kâwlhnâma lo tlu tahai laia chun inzâltirin an um a; anni chu sertanlohai laia chun zâl an ta, vânsama lo fe tahai laia chun.

en: There are the princes of the north, all of them, and all the Sidonians, who are gone down with the slain; in the terror which they caused by their might they are put to shame; and they lie uncircumcised with them that are slain by the sword, and bear their shame with them that go down to the pit.
hmr: Hmârtienga rorêltuhai an rêngin, Zidon mihai po po leh, thata umhai laia lo fe thla tahai chu an um a; an thilthawtheinaa ṭitumnahai an lo inumtirhai po poa chun an inzak a; kâwlhnâma thata lo um tahai le chun sertan loin an zâl tah a, chun, vân- sama lo fe tahai le chun an inzakna chu an phur a.

en: Pharaoh shall see them, and shall be comforted over all his multitude, even Pharaoh and all his army, slain by the sword, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Pharao chun anni chu hmûng a ta, a mipuihai po po chunga chun ama chu thlamuong a tih; Pharao le a sipai pâwl kâwlhnâma thata lo um tahai po po ngei kha, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: For I have put his terror in the land of the living; and he shall be laid in the midst of the uncircumcised, with them that are slain by the sword, even Pharaoh and all his multitude, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Mi hring rama chun a ṭitumna chu ka sie ta sih a; kâwlhnâma thata lo um tahai laia chun, sertan lohai kuoma chun inzâltirin um a tih; Pharao le a mipuihai po po ngei chu, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: And the word of Jehovah came unto me, saying,
hmr: LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a:

en: Son of man, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them, When I bring the sword upon a land, and the people of the land take a man from among them, and set him for their watchman;
hmr: “Mihriem naupa, i chipui thlahai kuoma chun thu hril la, an kuomah hieng hin ti rawh: ‘Ram chunga chun kâwlhnâm ka hung intlungtir pha, rama mihai chun anni laia mi an lâk a, an ta dinga vêngtu anga an sie chun;

en: if, when he seeth the sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;
hmr: ram chunga chun kâwlhnâm chu a hung tlung phaa a lo hmu chun tawtawrâwt mût sienla, mipuihai chu vaulâwk raw se;

en: then whosoever heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not warning, if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
hmr: tukhawma tawtawrâwt ri chu hrea, vaulâwkna pawisa lo chu, kâwl- hnâm chu a hung tlung a, ama chu lâk hmang a ni chun, a thisen chu ama lu chunga ngei chun um a tih.

en: He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his blood shall be upon him; whereas if he had taken warning, he would have delivered his soul.
hmr: Tawtawrâwt ri chu a hriet a, nisienlakhawm, vaulâwkna chu a pawisa nawh a; a thisen chu ama chunga chun um a tih, vaulâwkna chu lo pawisa ni sien chu a nun chu a sanhim ding a nih.

en: But if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet, and the people be not warned, and the sword come, and take any person from among them; he is taken away in his iniquity, but his blood will I require at the watchman’s hand.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, vêngtu chun kâwlhnâm hung tlung chu a hmuh a, tawtawrâwt a mût nawh a, mipuihai chu vaulâwk an ni nawh a, kâwlhnâm chu a hung tlung a, anni laia mi tukhawm chu a lâk hmang chun; a suolnaa chu lâk hmang a na; amiruokchu, a thisen maw chu vêngtu kuta chun phût ka tih,’ tiin.

en: So thou, son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore hear the word at my mouth, and give them warning from me.
hmr: Chuongchun, nang mihriem naupa, Israel sûngkuo ta ding chun vêngtuah ka sie ta che a nih; chuleiin, ka baua thu chu hre la, anni chu keimaa inthawka vaulâwkna chu pe rawh.

en: When I say unto the wicked, O wicked man, thou shalt surely die, and thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from his way; that wicked man shall die in his iniquity, but his blood will I require at thy hand.
hmr: Mi rilo kuoma chun, ‘Aw mi rilo, i thi ngei ding a nih,’ ka tih a, mi rilo chu a um dân bânsan dinga vau- lâwkna thu i hril si naw chun mi rilo chu ama suolnaa chun thîng a ta, amiruokchu, a thisen maw chu nangmaa chun ka phût ding a nih.

en: Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of his way to turn from it, and he turn not from his way; he shall die in his iniquity, but thou hast delivered thy soul.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi rilo chu a um dân bânsan dinga i vaulâwk a, a um dân a bânsan si naw chun, ama chu ama suolnaa chun thîng a ta, nang chun i nun i sanhim nîng a tih.

en: And thou, son of man, say unto the house of Israel: Thus ye speak, saying, Our transgressions and our sins are upon us, and we pine away in them; how then can we live?
hmr: “Chun, nang mihriem naupa, Israel sûngkuo kuoma chun hieng hin hril rawh, ‘Hieng ang hin in tih a; Ei bâwsietnahai le ei suolnahai chu ei chungah a um a, annia chun ei riral hmang a ni hi, iengtin am hring ei ta?’ tiin.

en: Say unto them, As I live, saith the Lord Jehovah, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?
hmr: An kuoma chun, ‘Ka hring zing angin, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; mi rilo thinaa chun lâwmna ka nei nawh a; mi rilo chu a um dân a bânsan a, a hring ruok chun lâwmna ka nei a; hung kîr ro, in lampui suola inthawk chun hung kîr ro; aw Israel sûngkuo, iengdingin am thîng in ta?’ ti rawh.

en: And thou, son of man, say unto the children of thy people, The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him in the day of his transgression; and as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall thereby in the day that he turneth from his wickedness; neither shall he that is righteous be able to live thereby in the day that he sinneth.
hmr: Chun, nang mihriem naupa, i chipuihai thlahai kuoma chun hieng hin hril rawh; mi fel felna chun ama chu a bâwsietna nia chun sanhim naw nih a; mi rilo rîtlona thua chun, a rîtlonaa inthawka a hung kîr nia chun a rîtlonaa chun tlu naw nih; chun, mi fel chu a suksuolna nia chun a felnain hring bawk naw nih.
