en: And the arches thereof were toward the outer court; and palm-trees were upon the posts thereof: and the ascent to it had eight steps.
hmr: Chun, a tuolpûkhai chun huon sûng tuollai puo lem tieng a nghaa, a kawtkhâr bienghai chunga chun in- tûm thinghai an um a; a hang kainaa chun kailâwn pariet a um a.

en: And he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures;
hmr: Chun, saktieng panga huon sûng tuollai sûngril lema chun a mi ṭhuoi a, chun, hieng inkhina ang pei hin dâi kawtkhâr chu ân khi a,

en: and the lodges thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, according to these measures: and there were windows therein and in the arches thereof round about; it was fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
hmr: a vêngna pindanhai, a kawt- khâr bienghai, a tuolpûkhai chu hieng inkhina dân ang hin ân khi a; chun, a tuolpûkhaia leh a vêlin tuk- verhai an um a, tawng sâwmngaa sei, tawng sâwmhni pangaa lien a nih.

en: And the arches thereof were toward the outer court; and palm-trees were upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the ascent to it had eight steps.
hmr: A tuolpûkhai chun huon sûng tuollai puo lem tieng a ngha a, a kawtkhâr bienghaia chun, hi tieng le khing tienga khawm intûm thinghai an um a, chun a hang kaina chu sirbi pariet a nih.

en: And he brought me to the north gate: and he measured it according to these measures;
hmr: Chun, hmâr tieng dâi kawt- khâra chun a mi ṭhuoi a; ama chun hieng inkhina dân ang hin ân khi a;

en: the lodges thereof, the posts thereof, and the arches thereof: and there were windows therein round about; the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
hmr: a vêngna pindanhai, a kawt- khâr bienghai, a tuolpûkhai chu; chun, chutaka chun a vêlin tukverhai a um a, a dung tieng chu tawng sâwmnga, a khang tieng chu tawng sâwmhni panga a nih.

en: And the posts thereof were toward the outer court; and palm-trees were upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the ascent to it had eight steps.
hmr: Chun, kawtkhâr bienghai chu huon sûng tuollai puo lem tienga chun a na, chun, chutaka kawtkhâr bienghaia chun, hi tieng sîra le khing tieng sîra khawm chun intûm thing- hai an um a; a hang fe kaina chu sirbi pariet a nih:

en: And a chamber with the door thereof was by the posts at the gates; there they washed the burnt-offering.
hmr: Chun, dâi kawtkhârhaia kawt- khâr bienghai sîra chun pindan le kawtkhârhai an um a; chutaka chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai chu an sâwp hlak.

en: And in the porch of the gate were two tables on this side, and two tables on that side, to slay thereon the burnt-offering and the sin-offering and the trespass-offering.
hmr: Chun, dâi kawtkhâr tuolpûk lûtnaa chun, hi tieng sîrah dawkân pahni, khing tieng sîrah dawkân pahni bawk, pumrawhmang thilin- hlân dâm, suol thilinhlân dâm, baw- sietna thilinhlân dâm thatna dingin a um a.

en: And on the one side without, as one goeth up to the entry of the gate toward the north, were two tables; and on the other side, which belonged to the porch of the gate, were two tables.
hmr: Chun, hmârtieng dâi kawt- khâra lûtnaa hang feh a, sîr khat a puotienga chun, dawkân pahni a um a; chun, a sîr khata chun, dâi kawt- khâra tuolpûka ṭhangsaa chun dawkân pahni bawk a um a.

en: Four tables were on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, whereupon they slew the sacrifices.
hmr: Hi tieng sîrah dawkân pali, khingtieng sirah dawkân pali bawk; dâi kawtkhâr sîra chun an um a; chuong dawkân pariethai chunga chun inthâwinahai chu an that hlak.

en: And there were four tables for the burnt-offering, of hewn stone, a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half broad, and one cubit high; whereupon they laid the instruments wherewith they slew the burnt-offering and the sacrifice.
hmr: Chun, pumrawhmang thilin- hlânna dingin lung a saka sak, tawng khat le a chenvea sei, tawng khat le a chenvea lien, tawng khata insâng dawkân pali an um a; chuong chunga chun inthawina le pumrawhmang thilinhlân ding an thatna ding hriemhreihai chu an sie a.

en: And the hooks, a handbreadth long, were fastened within round about: and upon the tables was the flesh of the oblation.
hmr: Chun, in sûnga chun a vêlin kuoikimhai kutpha bawka lienhai chu inbûk an na; chun, dawkânhai chunga chun inthâwina sa chu a um a.

en: And without the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate; and their prospect was toward the south; one at the side of the east gate having the prospect toward the north.
hmr: Chun, dâi kawtkhâr sûngril lem puoa chun a mi ṭhuoi lût a; Ngai ta, pindan pahni huon sûng tuollai sûngril lema chun an um a; hmar- tieng kawtkhâr bula chu a nghat dân chu sim sawng a na, simtieng dâi kawtkhâr sîra pakhat chu a nghat dân hmâr sawng a nih.

en: And he said unto me, This chamber, whose prospect is toward the south, is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house;
hmr: Chun, ka kuoma chun, “Hi pindan, a nghat dân sim sawng hi in enkawl sin kawltu thiempuhai ta ding a nih.

en: and the chamber whose prospect is toward the north is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar: these are the sons of Zadok, who from among the sons of Levi come near to Jehovah to minister unto him.
hmr: Pindan a nghat dân hmar sawng hi thiempuhai, mâichâmhai sin enkawlna kawltuhai ta ding chu a nih; chuonghai chu Zadok naupasal- hai, chuonghai chu Levi naupasalhai laia ama rawng bâwl dinga LALPA kuom hnaia hunghai chu an nih.

en: And he measured the court, a hundred cubits long, and a hundred cubits broad, foursquare; and the altar was before the house.
hmr: Chun, huon sûng tuollai chu ân khih a, tawng zaa sei, tawng zaa lien, kil li inchen a nih; chun, mâichâm chu in tuola chun a um a.

en: Then he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured each post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side: and the breadth of the gate was three cubits on this side, and three cubits on that side.
hmr: Chun, in tuolpûka chun a mi ṭhuoi a, tuolpûk kawtkhâr bienghai chu ân khih a, hi tieng sîrah tawng nga, khing tieng sîrah tawng nga bawk; chun, kawtkhâr khingtieng chu hi tieng sîrah tawng thum, khing tieng sîrah tawng thum bawk a nih.

en: The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits; even by the steps whereby they went up to it: and there were pillars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side.
hmr: Chun, tuolpûk seizie chu tawng sâwmhni a na, a lien tieng chu tawng sâwmpahni a nih; chun, an hang kainaa chun sirbi sâwm a um a; chun, kawtkhâr bieng sîrhaia chun sût- puihai a um a, hi tieng sîrah pakhat, khing tieng sîrah pakhat bawk.

en: And he brought me to the temple, and measured the posts, six cubits broad on the one side, and six cubits broad on the other side, which was the breadth of the tabernacle.
hmr: Chun, ama chun Pathien biek ina chun a mi ṭhuoi a, chun, kawtkhâr bieng chu ân khi a, hi tieng sîrah tawng ruka lien a na, khing tieng sîra khawm tawng ruka lien bawk a nih; chu chu biekbûk khang tieng ruol a nih.

en: And the breadth of the entrance was ten cubits; and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length thereof, forty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits.
hmr: A lûtna khang tieng chu tawng sâwm a na; lûtna sîr chu sîr khatah tawng nga a na, sîr danga khawm tawng nga bawk a nih; chun, chu dung tieng chu tawng sâwmliin ân khi a, a khang tieng chu tawng sâwmhniin.

en: Then went he inward, and measured each post of the entrance, two cubits; and the entrance, six cubits; and the breadth of the entrance, seven cubits.
hmr: Chun, a sûngah a lût a, lûtna kawtkhâr bieng chu tawng hniin ân khi a; a lûtna chu tawng rukin; a lûtna khang tieng chu tawng sariin.

en: And he measured the length thereof, twenty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits, before the temple: and he said unto me, This is the most holy place.
hmr: Chun, pindan chu ân khi a, a dung tieng chu tawng sâwmhniin ân khi a, a khang tieng khawm tawng sâwmhni bawkin; chun, ka kuoma chun, “Hi hi hmun inthiengtak chu a nih,” a ta.

en: Then he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of every side-chamber, four cubits, round about the house on every side.
hmr: Chun, in bang chu ân khi a, tawng ruk a na, sîr tinah a in vêl chun, pindan kêmhai khang tieng chu tawng li pei a na.

en: And the side-chambers were in three stories, one over another, and thirty in order; and they entered into the wall which belonged to the house for the side-chambers round about, that they might have hold therein, and not have hold in the wall of the house.
hmr: A sîr pindanhai chu pathum a na, pakhat chungah a dang, chuong ang peia sâwmthum chena indawt peiin; Inpui banga chun inbûkna nei loa, chutaka chun inbûkna an nei thei lemna dingin, a vêla pindan kêmhai ta ding hrima ruot inpui banga filawrhaia chun an vân bûk a.

en: And the side-chambers were broader as they encompassed the house higher and higher; for the encompassing of the house went higher and higher round about the house: therefore the breadth of the house continued upward; and so one went up from the lowest chamber to the highest by the middle chamber.
hmr: Pindan kêmhai chun in chu an vêl sâng deu deu chun an lien deu deu a; in sîr vêl chun a pindan inzâwnpui ang peiin a lien tung pei a; chuong- chun, in vêlin a sûngpui chu a chin deu deu pei a, in sîra chun leilâk a fe tung pei a; chuongchun, mi chun pindan hnuoihnung taka inthawka a chunghnung taka chun pindan lai- lung hraw tlangin a fe a nih.

en: I saw also that the house had a raised basement round about: the foundations of the side-chambers were a full reed of six great cubits.
hmr: Chun, in chun a vêlin a rei sukkho a nei ka hmu bawk a; chun, pindan kêmhai lungphûmhai chu luonghmawl tling tawng ruk a nih.

en: The thickness of the wall, which was for the side-chambers, on the outside, was five cubits: and that which was left was the place of the side-chambers that belonged to the house.
hmr: Chun, pindan kêmhai bang sazie chu a puotiengah tawng nga a nih; chun, chutaka la mahla chu pindan kêmhai a sûnga umhai sîr thlâk chu a la nih.

en: And between the chambers was a breadth of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.
hmr: Chun, inpui lungrem le pindan kêmhai inkâr chu sîr tinah a in vêl suokin, tawng sâwmhnia lien a um a.

en: And the doors of the side-chambers were toward the place that was left, one door toward the north, and another door toward the south: and the breadth of the place that was left was five cubits round about.
hmr: Chun, pindan kêmhai kawt- khârhai chu chu hmun la âwl tieng- haia chun hawng a na, kawtkhâr pakhat chu hmârtiengah, kawtkhâr dang chu simtiengah; chun, chu hmun la chuonga ngai khang tieng chu tawng nga a nih a vêlin.

en: And the building that was before the separate place at the side toward the west was seventy cubits broad; and the wall of the building was five cubits thick round about, and the length thereof ninety cubits.
hmr: Chun, in thlangtieng panga hmun âwl hmaa in chu tawng sâwm- saria lien a na; chun, chu in chu a bang sazie chu a vêlin tawng ngaa sa a nih, a dung tieng chu tawng sâwm- kuo a nih.

en: So he measured the house, a hundred cubits long; and the separate place, and the building, with the walls thereof, a hundred cubits long;
hmr: Chun, in chu tawng zaa seiin ân khi a; chun, hmun daidana um le a in le, chutaka banghai le chun tawng za chu a nih;

en: also the breadth of the face of the house, and of the separate place toward the east, a hundred cubits.
hmr: chun, in hmai khang tieng saktieng panga hmun âwla um chu tawng za a nih.

en: And he measured the length of the building before the separate place which was at the back thereof, and the galleries thereof on the one side and on the other side, a hundred cubits; and the inner temple, and the porches of the court;
hmr: Chun, chu hnungtienga um hmun âwla in seizie chu ân khi a; chutaka a dawdanhai le, sîr khat le sîr khingtienga dawdanhai le chun tawng za a nih; chun, biekin sûngril lem, huon sûng tuollaia tuolpûkhai, a kawtkhâr bienghai, thingphêka in- thuo a na;

en: the thresholds, and the closed windows, and the galleries round about on their three stories, over against the threshold, ceiled with wood round about, and from the ground up to the windows (now the windows were covered),
hmr: a tukver inkhâr zinghai, a sâwng thuma a dawdanhai a vêlin a um a; a inpui kawt lûtnaa inthawk, a vêla thingphêka remin ṭuonga in- thawka tukver chen rem a nih;

en: to the space above the door, even unto the inner house, and without, and by all the wall round about within and without, by measure.
hmr: chuongchun, tukverhai chu in- thuo an na; kawtkhâr lu chung hmun, in sûngril lem le puo lem, a vêlin a puo le sûngah banghai chun, inkhi thlapa inkhum a nih.

en: And it was made with cherubim and palm-trees; and a palm-tree was between cherub and cherub, and every cherub had two faces;
hmr: Chun, cherubhai le intûm thinghaia chei a na; intûm thing chu cherub le cherub inkâra chun a um a, chun, cherubhai chun hmai pahni seng an nei a;

en: so that there was the face of a man toward the palm-tree on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm-tree on the other side. Thus was it made through all the house round about:
hmr: chuongchun, sîr khata chun in- tûm thing tieng chun mihriem hmai chu a nghah a, chun, sîr khingtienga chun intûm thing tieng ngha ma chun sakeibaknei tuoi hmai chu a ngha a; in chu a vêlin chuong ang taka siem suok vawng chu a nih.

en: from the ground unto above the door were cherubim and palm-trees made; thus was the wall of the temple.
hmr: Hnuoia inthawka kawtkhâr lu chung chen chun cherubhai le intûm thinghaia siem a na; biekin bang chu chuong ang chu a nih.

en: As for the temple, the door-posts were squared; and as for the face of the sanctuary, the appearance thereof was as the appearance of the temple.
hmr: Biekin thua chun, a kawtkhâr bienghai chu kil li nei an na; chun, hmun inthieng tak hmaa chun, thinga siem mâichâm ang a um a.

en: The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and the length thereof two cubits; and the corners thereof, and the length thereof, and the walls thereof, were of wood: and he said unto me, This is the table that is before Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, mâichâm chu thing a na, ân sâng tieng chu tawng thum a na, a sei tieng chu tawng hni a nih; a kihai le, a mawnghai le a banghai chu thing ruok a nih; chun, ama chun ka kuom- ah, “Hi hi LALPA hmaa dawkân chu a nih,” a tih a.

en: And the temple and the sanctuary had two doors.
hmr: Chun, biekin le hmun inthieng tak chun kawtkhâr pahni a nei a.

en: And the doors had two leaves apiece, two turning leaves: two leaves for the one door, and two leaves for the other.
hmr: Kawtkhârhai chun, phêk hran pahni, phêk hni inthlep a nei a, kawtkhâr pakhat ta dingin, phêk hni, kawtkhâr dang ta dingin phêk hni bawk.

en: And there were made on them, on the doors of the temple, cherubim and palm-trees, like as were made upon the walls; and there was a threshold of wood upon the face of the porch without.
hmr: Chun, an chunga chun, biekin sûtpui kawtkhârhaia chun cherubhai le intûm thinghai lim siem an na, bang chunghaia siem ang bawk khan; chun, tuolpûk puotieng hmaa chun thingpum lientak tak a um a.

en: And there were closed windows and palm-trees on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch: thus were the side-chambers of the house, and the thresholds.
hmr: Chun, tukver inkhârhai le, tuol- pûka chun sîr khata le sîr khing- tienga khawm chun intûm thinghai chu an um a; pindan kêmhai le thing- phêk satakhai chu chuong ang chu a nih.

en: Then he brought me forth into the outer court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that was over against the separate place, and which was over against the building toward the north.
hmr: Chun, hmârtieng lampuia, huon sûng tuollai puo lema chun a mi ṭhuoi suok a; hmârtieng panga in zâwna um, hmun daidan epa pindan kêma chun a mi ṭhuoi lût a.

en: Before the length of a hundred cubits was the north door, and the breadth was fifty cubits.
hmr: Hmartieng panga pindan chu a sei tieng tawng za khat a na; a khang tieng chu tawng sâwmnga a nih.

en: Over against the twenty cubits which belonged to the inner court, and over against the pavement which belonged to the outer court, was gallery against gallery in the third story.
hmr: Huon sûng tuollai sûngril lema ṭhang tawng sâwmhni zâwna le, huon sûng tuollai puo lem epa lungpha zâwna chun dawdan inep ṭhieuin sâwng thumin a um a.

en: And before the chambers was a walk of ten cubits’ breadth inward, a way of one cubit; and their doors were toward the north.
hmr: Chun, pindanhai hmaa chun, sûnglûtin inlawnna tawng sâwma lien, tawng za khata sei a um a; chun, an kawtkhârhai chu hmar sawng an nih.

en: Now the upper chambers were shorter; for the galleries took away from these, more than from the lower and the middlemost, in the building.
hmr: Chun, pindan chunghnung lem- hai chu an tawi lem a; dawdanhai chun a hnuoihnung le a laitak nêkin ina chun hmun an aw lien lem sih a.

en: For they were in three stories, and they had not pillars as the pillars of the courts: therefore the uppermost was straitened more than the lowest and the middlemost from the ground.
hmr: Sâwng thum an ni sih a; huon sûng tuollaia sûtpuihai ang kha sûtpui an nei ve nawh a; chuleiin, a chunghnung tak chu a hnuoia nêkin ân têp a, a hnuoihnung tak nêkin a lailung chu ân têp lem a.

en: And the wall that was without by the side of the chambers, toward the outer court before the chambers, the length thereof was fifty cubits.
hmr: Pindan kêmhai zâwn pei puoah, tuollai puo lem tiengah pindanhai epa ân huonna chu tawng sâwmngaa sei a nih.

en: For the length of the chambers that were in the outer court was fifty cubits: and, lo, before the temple were a hundred cubits.
hmr: Huon sûng tuollai puo lema pin- dan chu a dung tieng tawng sâwmnga an ni sih a; chun, ngai ta, biekin tuola chun tawng za khat a nih.

en: And from under these chambers was the entry on the east side, as one goeth into them from the outer court.
hmr: Hieng pindanhai hnuoia hin saktieng pangah lûtna a um a, huon sûng tuollai puo lema inthawka lûtna chu.

en: In the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, before the separate place, and before the building, there were chambers.
hmr: Chutaka chun puo tieng bang ân ṭan a. Simtienga khawm huon sûng tuollai le inepa chun pindanhai an um bawk a.

en: And the way before them was like the appearance of the way of the chambers which were toward the north; according to their length so was their breadth: and all their egresses were both according to their fashions, and according to their doors.
hmr: An hmaa lampui chu hmâr- tienga pindanhai lampui ang bawk kha a na; an seizie le a khang tieng khawm ân ang; a suokna lampuihai le an rem dân dâm, a kawtkhârhai chenin ân ang vawng a nih.

en: And according to the doors of the chambers that were toward the south was a door at the head of the way, even the way directly before the wall toward the east, as one entereth into them.
hmr: Simtieng panga pindanhai hnuoia chun saktieng pangah lûtna a um a, chu chu fe thlengna lampui chu a nih. Chuonghai epa chun pindanna bang a um a.

en: Then said he unto me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they are the holy chambers, where the priests that are near unto Jehovah shall eat the most holy things: there shall they lay the most holy things, and the meal-offering, and the sin-offering, and the trespass-offering; for the place is holy.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, “Hmârtienga pindanhai le simtienga pindanhai, hmun âwl hmaa umhai hi, pindan inthieng, thiempu LALPA hnaituhaiin thil inthiengtakhai an fâkna ding a nih; chutaka chun thil inthiengtakhai chau chu sieng an tih, bu thilinhlân dâm, suol thilinhlân dâm, bawsietna thilinhlân dâm chu; chu hmun chu ân thieng sih a.

en: When the priests enter in, then shall they not go out of the holy place into the outer court, but there they shall lay their garments wherein they minister; for they are holy: and they shall put on other garments, and shall approach to that which pertaineth to the people.
hmr: Thiempuhai chu an lût pha chun, huon sûng tuollai puo lema chun hmun inthienga inthawk chun an fe suok ding a ni nawh a, ami- ruokchu, chutaka chun, an rawng- bâwlnaa chun an silfênhai sieng an ta; an inthieng sih a; silfên dangin inbel an ta, chun, mipui tieng chu an hung hnai chau ding a nih,” a ta.

en: Now when he had made an end of measuring the inner house, he brought me forth by the way of the gate whose prospect is toward the east, and measured it round about.
hmr: Chun, in sûngril lem chu inkhi zo hnung chun, dâi kawtkhâr, sak- tieng nghaa chun a mi ṭhuoi suok a, chun, a vêl chun ân khi tah a.

en: He measured on the east side with the measuring reed five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
hmr: Inkhina luonghmawl chun sak- tieng chu ân khi a, inkhina luong- hmawl chun a vêlin tawng za nga a nih.

en: He measured on the north side five hundred reeds with the measuring reed round about.
hmr: Chun, hmârtienga khawm chun a vêlin, inkhina luonghmawl chun tawng za ngain ân khi bawk a.

en: He measured on the south side five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
hmr: Inkhina luonghmawl chun, sim- tieng pang khawm chu tawng za ngain ân khi a.

en: He turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
hmr: Chun, thlang tieng chu ân khi nâwk a, inkhina luonghmawl chun tawng za ngain ân khi a.

en: He measured it on the four sides: it had a wall round about, the length five hundred, and the breadth five hundred, to make a separation between that which was holy and that which was common.
hmr: A sîr lia chun ân khi tah a, a sei tieng chu za nga, a khang tieng khawm za nga bawk, a vêlin bang a nei a, hmun narân le hmun inthieng chu ṭhena dingin.

en: Afterward he brought me to the gate, even the gate that looketh toward the east.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun dâi kawt- khâr, saktieng ngha dâi kawt- khâra chun a mi ṭhuoi tah a;

en: And, behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east: and his voice was like the sound of many waters; and the earth shined with his glory.
hmr: chun, ngai ta, saktienga inthawk chun Israel Pathien ropuina chu a hung tlung tah a; chun, a râwl khawm chu tui tamtak ri ang a nih; chuongchun, a ropuina chun hnuoi chu a var tah a.

en: And it was according to the appearance of the vision which I saw, even according to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the city; and the visions were like the vision that I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell upon my face.
hmr: Chun, thilhmulâwk ka ihmu tah, khawpui chu sukse dinga a hung laia thilhmulâwk ka hmu ang tak, chu thil hmulâwk chu Kebar vadung panga thilhmulâwk ka hmu ang kha a nih; chuongchun, ka hmaiin hnuoi ka sik tah a.

en: And the glory of Jehovah came into the house by the way of the gate whose prospect is toward the east.
hmr: Chun, dâi kawtkhâr, saktieng nghaa inthawk chun LALPA ropuina chu ina chun a hung lût a;

en: And the Spirit took me up, and brought me into the inner court; and, behold, the glory of Jehovah filled the house.
hmr: Thlarau chun a mi dawm kâng a, huon sûng tuollai sungril lema chun a mi ṭhuoi tah a; chun, ngai ta, LALPA ropuina chun in chu a suksip tah a.

en: And I heard one speaking unto me out of the house; and a man stood by me.
hmr: Mi pakhat ka sîra a ngîr zing lai chun, ina inthawk chun mi pakhat hin ka kuomah thu hrilin ka hriet a;

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, this is the place of my throne, and the place of the soles of my feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel for ever. And the house of Israel shall no more defile my holy name, neither they, nor their kings, by their whoredom, and by the dead bodies of their kings in their high places;
hmr: ka kuoma chun, “Mihriem naupa, hi hi ka lalṭhungpha hmun le ka kehai innghatna hmun, Israel thla- hai kuoma chatuona ka chêngna ding chu a ni hi. Israel sûngkuo chun ka hming inthieng chu sukpawrche ta naw ni hai a, anni khawmin, an lalhai khawm, an hurnain amani, an bâwlhmunhaia an lalhai ruonghai khawmin amanih sukpawrche naw ni hai,

en: in their setting of their threshold by my threshold, and their door-post beside my door-post, and there was but the wall between me and them; and they have defiled my holy name by their abominations which they have committed: wherefore I have consumed them in mine anger.
hmr: an tuolpûk chu ka tuolpûk kâwla siein, an kawtkhâr bieng chu ka kawtkhâr bieng sîrah, anni le keia kâra chun bang chau a uma chu; an tirdakumna an lo thaw tahai chun ka hming inthieng chu an lo sukpawrche tah a; chuleiin, ka lunginsenna chun anni chu ka kâng hmang tah a.

en: Now let them put away their whoredom, and the dead bodies of their kings, far from me; and I will dwell in the midst of them for ever.
hmr: Tuhin an hurna le an lalhai ruonghai chu keimaa inthawka hla- takah sie hmang hai sienla, anni lai chun chatuonin chêng tâng ka tih.

en: Thou, son of man, show the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities; and let them measure the pattern.
hmr: “Nang mihriem naupa, Israel sûngkaw kuoma chun in kha inentir rawh, an suolhai leia an inzak theina dingin; chuongchun, a riruong kha inkhitir rawh.

en: And if they be ashamed of all that they have done, make known unto them the form of the house, and the fashion thereof, and the egresses thereof, and the entrances thereof, and all the forms thereof, and all the ordinances thereof, and all the forms thereof, and all the laws thereof; and write it in their sight; that they may keep the whole form thereof, and all the ordinances thereof, and do them.
hmr: Chun, an thil lo thaw tahai po po kha an inzâpui a ni chun in riruong, a hmêlput dân, a fe suokna, a lûtna, a hmêl umziehai po po le chutaka dânhai po po leh inhriettir la, an mithmu ngeia chun ziek la, chu chu hmêl put dân po po chu an vawng zinga, dânhai po po khawm chu an kawla an zâwm theina dingin.

en: This is the law of the house: upon the top of the mountain the whole limit thereof round about shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.
hmr: Hi hi in dân chu nîng a tih; tlâng sîp chunga a huop chin chin chu hmun inthiengtak nîng a ta; Ngai ta, hi hi in dân chu nîng a tih.

en: And these are the measures of the altar by cubits (the cubit is a cubit and a handbreadth): the bottom shall be a cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and the border thereof by the edge thereof round about a span; and this shall be the base of the altar.
hmr: “Chun, hieng hi tawnga inkhia mâichâm lienzie chu a nih; (tawng chu tawng le kutpha bawk a nih) a mawng chu tawng khat nîng a ta, a khang tieng khawm tawng khat bawk; a rei sira a tlâng chu a vêlin khâp khat nîng a ta, hi hi mâichâm mawng chu nîng a tih.

en: And from the bottom upon the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser ledge to the greater ledge shall be four cubits, and the breadth a cubit.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi ân ṭhutnaa in- thawk chun a rei hnuoihnung lem chen chun tawng hni nîng a ta, a khang tieng chu tawng khat; chun, a rei chîn lema inthawka a rei lien lem chen chu tawng li nîng a tih, chun, a khang tieng chu tawng khat.

en: And the upper altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar hearth and upward there shall be four horns.
hmr: Mâichâm chunghnung lem chu tawng li nîng a ta; mâichâm thuk le a chung tienga chun kihai pali um a ta.

en: And the altar hearth shall be twelve cubits long by twelve broad, square in the four sides thereof.
hmr: Mâichâm thuk chu tawng sawmpahnia sei, tawng sâwmpahni maa lien nîng a tih, a sîr palia chun intiet seng nîng a tih.

en: And the ledge shall be fourteen cubits long by fourteen broad in the four sides thereof; and the border about it shall be half a cubit; and the bottom thereof shall be a cubit round about; and the steps thereof shall look toward the east.
hmr: A sîrhai pali chun a rei chu tawng sâwmpalia sei a, tawng sâwm- pali maa lien nîng a tih; a tlâng chu a vêlin tawng chenve nîng a ta; chu mawng chu tawng khat lai ni bawk a ta; a sirbihai chu saktieng nghâng a tih.

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, thus saith the Lord Jehovah: These are the ordinances of the altar in the day when they shall make it, to offer burnt-offerings thereon, and to sprinkle blood thereon.
hmr: Chun, ka kuomah a hril a, “Mi- hriem naupa, Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: A chunga pum- rawhmang thilinhlân an inhlân a, thisen a chunga an the ni chun, hieng hi mâichâm thuthlunghai chu nîng a tih.

en: Thou shalt give to the priests the Levites that are of the seed of Zadok, who are near unto me, to minister unto me, saith the Lord Jehovah, a young bullock for a sin-offering.
hmr: Levi mi thiempuhai, Zadok thlaa mi ngei chu, keia rawngbâwl dinga kei a mi hnaihai kuoma chun suol thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pêng i tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: And thou shalt take of the blood thereof, and put it on the four horns of it, and on the four corners of the ledge, and upon the border round about: thus shalt thou cleanse it and make atonement for it.
hmr: Chun, chu thisen chu lâng i ta, a kihai pali chun nâl i ta, a rei ki lia le, a tlâng a sîrvêl poa hai le chun; chuongchun, sukthieng i ta, ama ta ding chun intlanna siem i tih.

en: Thou shalt also take the bullock of the sin-offering, and it shall be burnt in the appointed place of the house, without the sanctuary.
hmr: Suol thilinhlân dinga bâwng- chal khawm chu lâng i ta, chu ina hmun ruot hmun inthieng tuola chun râwng i tih.

en: And on the second day thou shalt offer a he-goat without blemish for a sin-offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they did cleanse it with the bullock.
hmr: Chun, a ni hni nia chun suol thilinhlân ding chun kêlchal dem- kailo inhlân i tih; bawngchal hmanga mâichâm sukthieng a ni ang bawk khan, mâichâm chu sukthieng nîng a tih.

en: When thou hast made an end of cleansing it, thou shalt offer a young bullock without blemish, and a ram out of the flock without blemish.
hmr: Chun, sukthiengna thil chu i thaw zo pha chun bâwngchal tuoi demkailo le, a ruol laia berâmchal demkailo chu inhlân i tih.

en: And thou shalt bring them near before Jehovah, and the priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt-offering unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, nang chun LALPA kuom- ah hung ṭhuoi i ta, thiempuhai chun an chunga chun chi lo thêng an ta, chuongchun, LALPA kuomah pum- rawhmang thilinhlân dingin inhlân an tih.

en: Seven days shalt thou prepare every day a goat for a sin-offering: they shall also prepare a young bullock, and a ram out of the flock, without blemish.
hmr: Ni sari sûng chu ni tin, suol thilinhlân dingin kêl buotsai i ta; chun, bâwngchal tuoi le berâmchal a ruol laia mi demkailo i buotsai bawk ding a nih.

en: Seven days shall they make atonement for the altar and purify it; so shall they consecrate it.
hmr: Ni sari sûng chu mâichâm ta ding chun intlanna siempêk an ta, sukthieng an tih, chuongchun, hlân- thieng an tih.

en: And when they have accomplished the days, it shall be that upon the eighth day, and forward, the priests shall make your burnt-offerings upon the altar, and your peace-offerings; and I will accept you, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, nihai chu an hmang zo pha, ni rietnaa inthawk chu, thiem- puhai chun in pumrawhmang thilin- hlânhai chu mâichâma chun thâwng an ta, in inremna thilinhlânhai le chun; chuongchun, lo pawm ka ti cheu, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih,” tiin.

en: Then he brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary, which looketh toward the east; and it was shut.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthieng dâi kawtkhâr tuol hnai lema, sak- tieng nghaa chun a mi ṭhuoi kîr nâwk a, a lo inkhâr zing a.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, neither shall any man enter in by it; for Jehovah, the God of Israel, hath entered in by it; therefore it shall be shut.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah, “Hi dâi kawtkhâr hi in khâr zing ding a na, hawng ding a ni nawh; mi tukhawm ahin lût bawk naw ni hai, LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu a lo lût ta sih a; chuleiin, khâr a ni zing ding a nih.

en: As for the prince, he shall sit therein as prince to eat bread before Jehovah; he shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate, and shall go out by the way of the same.
hmr: Chun, lal chungthua chun, LALPA hmaa bei fa dingin lal angin chutaka chun ṭhung a ta, dâi kawt- khâr tuolpûk lampuia khan lût a ta, chu bawka chun a suok nâwk ding a nih,” a ta.

en: Then he brought me by the way of the north gate before the house; and I looked, and, behold, the glory of Jehovah filled the house of Jehovah: and I fell upon my face.
hmr: Chun, in hmaia hmâr tieng dâi kawtkhâra chun a mi ṭhuoi a; chun, ka hei en a, ngai ta, LALPA ropuina chun LALPA in chu a sip a; chuong- chun, bawkkhupin ka tlu tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto me, Son of man, mark well, and behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears all that I say unto thee concerning all the ordinances of the house of Jehovah, and all the laws thereof; and mark well the entrance of the house, with every egress of the sanctuary.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun ka kuomah a hril a, “Mihriem naupa, inchikṭha la, i mithai khan en rawh, LALPA Ina thupêkhai po po chungthu le, chutaka dânhai po po chungthua ka thuhril chu i nahai khan lo ngai bawk la; chun, ina va lûtna le, hmun inthienga inthawka suokna tinhai chu inchik ṭha bawk rawh.

en: And thou shalt say to the rebellious, even to the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: O ye house of Israel, let it suffice you of all your abominations,
hmr: Chun, mi helhai, Israel sûngkuo kuoma chun hieng hin hril la: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Aw nangni Israel sungkuo, in tirdakum- na chu huntâwk ta raw se;

en: in that ye have brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in my sanctuary, to profane it, even my house, when ye offer my bread, the fat and the blood, and they have broken my covenant, to add unto all your abominations.
hmr: lungrila sertan lo le tisa khawma sertan lo, hmêlmakhai ka hmun in- thienga um ding le, sukpawrche dinga ka in ngeia in hung lâklût leia in tirdakumna hi huntâwk ta raw se; Bei dâm, sathâu dâm, thisen dâm chu in inhlân lai chun, ka thuthlunghai chu in bawsiet a, in tirdakumnahai chu belsa ding chauin.

en: And ye have not kept the charge of my holy things; but ye have set keepers of my charge in my sanctuary for yourselves.
hmr: Chun, ka thil inthienghai vêng ṭhatna sin chu in kawl nawh a, amiruokchu, chu ka hmun inthienga chun in aia ka sinhai kawltu dinghai in ruot lem a.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah, No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any foreigners that are among the children of Israel.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a ti a nih: Mi hmêlmak, lungrila ser- tan lo, tisa khawma sertan lo mi hmêlmak ieng ang khawm Israel thlahai laia lo um ta khawm chu, ka hmun inthienga chun a lût ding a ni nawh a.

en: But the Levites that went far from me, when Israel went astray, that went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israelhai, an milimhai hnawta an invâk hmang laia keimaa inthawka hlataka fe tahai Levi mihai chun anni suolna chu phur an tih.

en: Yet they shall be ministers in my sanctuary, having oversight at the gates of the house, and ministering in the house: they shall slay the burnt-offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister unto them.
hmr: Ina chun rawngbâwlin, in dâi kawtkhârhaia chun enkawlin, ka hmun inthienghaia chun rawngbâwl- tu nîng an tih; mipuihai ta dinga inthawina le pumrawhmang thilin- hlâna ding chu that an ta, anni rawngbâwlpêk dingin an hmaa chun ngîr an tih.

en: Because they ministered unto them before their idols, and became a stumblingblock of iniquity unto the house of Israel; therefore have I lifted up my hand against them, saith the Lord Jehovah, and they shall bear their iniquity.
hmr: An milimhai hmaa chun an rawng an lo bâwlpêk ta leiin Israel sûngkuo ta ding chun suolnaa tlûkna lung an lo ni tah a; chuleiin, an chunga chun ka kut kân let a, an suolna chu anni ngeiin phur an tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: And they shall not come near unto me, to execute the office of priest unto me, nor to come near to any of my holy things, unto the things that are most holy; but they shall bear their shame, and their abominations which they have committed.
hmr: Keia ta dingin thiempu sin chu thaw dingin, keima hnaia chun an hung ding a ni nawh a; ka thil in- thieng a ieng khawm, le thil inthiengtakhai chu an hung hnai ding a ni nawh; amiruokchu, an lo thaw tah, an tirdakumnahai le an inzakna chu anni ngeiin phur an tih.

en: Yet will I make them keepers of the charge of the house, for all the service thereof, and for all that shall be done therein.
hmr: Amiruokchu, anni chu in sin- haia enkawltuhaiah siem ka ta, chu- taka rawngbâwlnahai po poa ding le, chutaka thaw dinghai po poa chun.

en: But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok, that kept the charge of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, they shall come near to me to minister unto me; and they shall stand before me to offer unto me the fat and the blood, saith the Lord Jehovah:
hmr: “Amiruokchu, thiempu Levi mihai, Zadok naupasalhai, keimaa inthawka Israelhai an invâk hmang lai khawma ka hmun inthieng enkawlna sin kawltuhai chu, ka ta dinga rawngbâwl dingin keia hnaiah hung an ta; sathâu le thisen chu inhlân dingin ka hmaa chun ngîr an tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih;

en: they shall enter into my sanctuary, and they shall come near to my table, to minister unto me, and they shall keep my charge.
hmr: ka hmun inthienga chun lût an ta, ka rawng mi bâwlpêk dingin ka dawkân hnaia chun hung an ta, ka sin chu kawl an tih.

en: And it shall be that, when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and no wool shall come upon them, while they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.
hmr: Chun, huon sûng tuollai sûngril lema dâi kawtkhâra an lût pha chun hieng hin nîng a ta, puon zai inhmi puonin an inthuom ding a nih; huon sûng tuollai sûngril lem le, dâi kawtkhâra a sûnga rawng an bâwl lai chun, an chungah sahmul puon an inbel ding a ni nawh a.

en: They shall have linen tires upon their heads, and shall have linen breeches upon their loins; they shall not gird themselves with anything that causeth sweat.
hmr: An luhaia chun puon zai inhmi lukâwmhai kâwm an ta, an kâwnga chun puon zai inhmi kekawrhai bun bawk an ta. Thlan suksa thei chi hrim hrimin an inhrên ding a ni nawh.

en: And when they go forth into the outer court, even into the outer court to the people, they shall put off their garments wherein they minister, and lay them in the holy chambers; and they shall put on other garments, that they sanctify not the people with their garments.
hmr: Chun, huon sûng tuollai puo lem, mipuihai umna huon sûng tuol- lai puo lema chun an hung suok pha chun, an rawngbâwlna an silfênhai kha an hlîp ding a na, chuong chu pindan inthienga chun sieng an ta, silfên dangin an inbel ding a nih, chuongchun, mipuihai chu an silfên hmanga an sukthieng naw nawna dingin.

en: Neither shall they shave their heads, nor suffer their locks to grow long; they shall only cut off the hair of their heads.
hmr: “An luhai chu an vâw kawl ding a ni nawh a, an sam chu inṭhang seitir chu an phal bawk ding a ni nawh a; an lu chu a ṭhawlin an ṭhawl chau ding a nih.

en: Neither shall any of the priests drink wine, when they enter into the inner court.
hmr: Huon sûng tuollai sûngril lema an lût laiin thiempu tukhawma uoin a dâwn ding a ni nawh.

en: Neither shall they take for their wives a widow, nor her that is put away; but they shall take virgins of the seed of the house of Israel, or a widow that is the widow of a priest.
hmr: Nuhmei ding khawma hmeithai amanih, mâka um amani chu an nei ding a ni nawh a; amiruokchu, Israel sûngkuo chia mi nunghâk hnakhat- hai an lâk ding a nih; annawleh, hmeithai, thiempu nuhmei thisan.

en: And they shall teach my people the difference between the holy and the common, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.
hmr: Ka mihai chu thil inthieng le thil narânhai inkâra danglamnahai chun inchûktir an ta, thil thieng le thieng naw chu an inhriet ṭhentir ding a nih.

en: And in a controversy they shall stand to judge; according to mine ordinances shall they judge it: and they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all my appointed feasts; and they shall hallow my sabbaths.
hmr: Thubuoia chun rorêltuin an ngîr ding a na; keia rorêl dân dungzui peiin ro an rêl ding a nih; ka ruoiṭhe hunbi neihaia chun ka thuruothai, ka dânhai chu an zâwm ding a nih; chun, ka châwlni khawm chu an inser bawk ding a nih.

en: And they shall go in to no dead person to defile themselves; but for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister that hath had no husband, they may defile themselves.
hmr: Chun, mi thi kâwla chun anni le anni insukpawrche dingin an hung ding a ni nawh a, amiruokchu, pa ta dingin amanih, nu ta dingin amanih, naupa ta dingin amanih, naunu ta dingin amanih,unaupa ta dingin amanih, farnu pasal la nei lo ta dingin amanih chun anni chu insukpawrche thei an tih.

en: And after he is cleansed, they shall reckon unto him seven days.
hmr: Chun, sukthieng a ni hnunga chun ama chu ni sari tiempêk an tih.

en: And in the day that he goeth into the sanctuary, into the inner court, to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin-offering, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthienga, huon sûng tuollai sûngril lema, hmun in- thienga rawngbâwl dinga a fe ni chun, a suol thilinhlân chu ân hlân ding a nih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: And they shall have an inheritance: I am their inheritance; and ye shall give them no possession in Israel; I am their possession.
hmr: Chun, rochan nei nâwng an ta; kei hi an rochan chu ka nih; Israela chun ro pe naw ti nih a, kei hi an thilnei chu ka nih.

en: They shall eat the meal-offering, and the sin-offering, and the trespass-offering; and every devoted thing in Israel shall be theirs.
hmr: Bu thilinhlân dâm, suol thilin- hlân dâm, bawsietna thilinhlân dâm chu fâng an ta; Israel laia thilhlân tinrênghai chu an ta nîng a tih.

en: And the first of all the first-fruits of every thing, and every oblation of everything, of all your oblations, shall be for the priest: ye shall also give unto the priests the first of your dough, to cause a blessing to rest on thy house.
hmr: Chun, thil tinrêng rahmasahai hmasatak le, thil tinrêng thêna in- hlânhai chu, in thilinhlânhai po po chu thiempuhai chan nîng a ta, chun, thiempu kuoma chun in beihmet hmasatak chu in in sûnga malsâwm- na a um theina dingin in pêk bawk ding a nih.

en: The priests shall not eat of anything that dieth of itself, or is torn, whether it be bird or beast.
hmr: Thiempuhai chun thilhring amaa thi amanih, keinawia um amanih, ramsa khawm ni sien, vate khawm ni sien an fâk ding a ni nawh.

en: Moreover, when ye shall divide by lot the land for inheritance, ye shall offer an oblation unto Jehovah, a holy portion of the land; the length shall be the length of five and twenty thousand reeds, and the breadth shall be ten thousand: it shall be holy in all the border thereof round about.
hmr: “Chu nawa khawm chun, rochan dinga aisâna ram chu i sem pha chun, LALPA kuoma chun thilhlân în hlân ding a nih, ram ân thiengna hmun tak, a dung chu tawng sîng hni le sâng nga nîng a ta, a khang chu sîng hni nîng a tih: A sîr vêlin a ramri huopsûng po poa chun ân thieng ding a nih.

en: Of this there shall be for the holy place five hundred in length by five hundred in breadth, square round about; and fifty cubits for the suburbs thereof round about.
hmr: Hi sûnga hin hmun inthieng a dung tawng za nga, a khang tawng za nga bawk a um ding a nih; a vêla inchenin; chun, a sîr a vêlin hmun ruok tawng sâwmnga um bawk a tih.

en: And of this measure shalt thou measure a length of five and twenty thousand, and a breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be the sanctuary, which is most holy.
hmr: Chun, hi hi tiet hi inkhîng i ta, a dung tawng sîng hni sâng nga, a khang sîng khat; chu sûnga chun hmun inthieng, ân thieng tak chu a um ding a nih.

en: It is a holy portion of the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, that come near to minister unto Jehovah; and it shall be a place for their houses, and a holy place for the sanctuary.
hmr: Ram hmun inthieng chu a na, thiempuhai hmun inthienga rawng- bâwltuhai, LALPA hmaa rawngbâwl dinga hung hnaihai ta ding chu nîng a tih; an inhai hmun ding le, hmun inthieng ta dinga hmun inthieng chu nîng a tih.

en: And five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth, shall be unto the Levites, the ministers of the house, for a possession unto themselves, for twenty chambers.
hmr: Chun, a dung tawng sîng hni sâng nga le a khang tawng sîng khat chu Levi mihai, chu ina rawngbâwl- tuhai, chêngna khawpui dingin, an chan ding chu nîng a ta.

en: And ye shall appoint the possession of the city five thousand broad, and five and twenty thousand long, side by side with the oblation of the holy portion: it shall be for the whole house of Israel.
hmr: Chun, khawpui iṭhut ding hmun tawng sâng ngaa lien, tawng sîng hni sâng ngaa sei, chan inthieng in- hlânna epa khan ruot i ta, chu chu Israel sûngkuo pumpui ta ding nîng a ta.

en: And whatsoever is for the prince shall be on the one side and on the other side of the holy oblation and of the possession of the city, in front of the holy oblation and in front of the possession of the city, on the west side westward, and on the east side eastward; and in length answerable unto one of the portions, from the west border unto the east border.
hmr: Chun, lal ta dinga hmun chu sîr khata chun nîng a ta, a sîr khing tienga chun hmun inthieng thil in- hlânna, khawpui sûng ṭhut le, hmun inthieng inhlânna hmatieng chu nîng a ta, saktienga chun khi saktiengah, thlangtienga inthawk chun khu thlangtiengah, chun, a dung tieng chu, thlangtieng ramria inthawka saktieng ramri chenin hmun pakhat ep chu nîng a tih.

en: In the land it shall be to him for a possession in Israel: and my princes shall no more oppress my people; but they shall give the land to the house of Israel according to their tribes.
hmr: Chu ram chu Israelhai laia ama ta dinga a chan chu nîng a ta; ka lalhai chun ka mihai chu nêksâwr ta ngai naw ni hai a; amiruokchu, Israel sûngkuo laia chun an hnam ang peiin ram chu pe lem tâng an tih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: Let it suffice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute justice and righteousness; take away your exactions from my people, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih; Aw Israel lalhai, inhuntâwktir ta ro; pâwngnêkna le suksietna chu sie hmang unla, indikna le rorêl fel chîng ta unla; ka mihai hnawt suok hi ma ta ro; Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: Ye shall have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath.
hmr: Bûkna indiktakhai chu nei in ta, epha indik le, bath indik le chun.

en: The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain the tenth part of a homer, and the ephah the tenth part of a homer: the measure thereof shall be after the homer.
hmr: Epha le bath chu inkhina ang- khat nîng an ta, bath chun homer hmun sâwma ṭhea hmun khat keng a ta, epha khawm chun homer hmun sâwma ṭhea hmun khat bawk, chu inkhina chu homer dungzui pei a ni ding a nih.

en: And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh.
hmr: Shekel chu gera sâwmhni nîng a ta; chun, in mina chu shekel sâwm- ruk nîng a tih.

en: This is the oblation that ye shall offer: the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of wheat; and ye shall give the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of barley;
hmr: “Hi hi thilinhlân in inhlân ding- hai chu nîng a tih; bupui homer khata chun epha hmun ruka ṭhea hmun khat; buṭei homer khata chun epha hmun ruka ṭhea a hmun khat pêng in ta;

en: and the set portion of oil, of the bath of oil, the tenth part of a bath out of the cor, which is ten baths, even a homer (for ten baths are a homer);
hmr: chun, hriek chan ruot thua chun, kor tinah bath hmun sâwma ṭhea hmun khat nîng a tih; chu chu bath sâwm tluk a na, homer khat a nih.

en: and one lamb of the flock, out of two hundred, from the well-watered pastures of Israel;—for a meal-offering, and for a burnt-offering, and for peace-offerings, to make atonement for them, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: chun, berâm ruol za hni peiah berâm pakhat, Israel ram hlopetna hmun ṭhataka inthawkin, bu thilin- hlâna ding le, pumrawhmang thilin- hlâna ding le, inremna thilinhlâna dinga an ta dinga intlanna siempêk dingin pêk nîng a tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: All the people of the land shall give unto this oblation for the prince in Israel.
hmr: Rama mipuihai po po chun hi thilinhlân ang hi Israel rama lal ta ding chun an pêk ding a nih.

en: And it shall be the prince’s part to give the burnt-offerings, and the meal-offerings, and the drink-offerings, in the feasts, and on the new moons, and on the sabbaths, in all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel: he shall prepare the sin-offering, and the meal-offering, and the burnt-offering, and the peace-offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.
hmr: Chun, ruoiṭhenahaia le, thla tharhaia le, châwlnihaia le, Israel sûngkuo ruoiṭhena hunbi neihaia chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai, bu thilinhlânhai, dâwnmi thilinhlân- hai inhlân chu lal chan chu ni ve thung a tih; Israel sûngkuo ta dinga intlanna siemna dingin, suol thilin- hlânhai, bu thilinhlânhai, pumraw- hmang thilinhlânhai, inremna thilin- hlânhai chu a buotsai ding a nih.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: In the first month, in the first day of the month, thou shalt take a young bullock without blemish; and thou shalt cleanse the sanctuary.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Thla hmasatak, chu thla ni khat ni chun, bâwngchal tuoi dem- kâilo lâng i ta; hmun inthieng chu sukthieng i tih;

en: And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin-offering, and put it upon the door-posts of the house, and upon the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and upon the posts of the gate of the inner court.
hmr: thiempu chun suol thilinhlâna thisen chu lâng a ta, chu in kawtkhâr bienghaia le, mâichâm rei kil lia le, huon sûng tuollai sûngril lem dâi kawtkhâr biengahai chun nâl a ta.

en: And so thou shalt do on the seventh day of the month for every one that erreth, and for him that is simple: so shall ye make atonement for the house.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu thla ni sari ni chun mi thil lo suksuol ta tinhai ta ding le, mi lo thawpalhai ta dingin thâwng i ta; chuongchun, in ta ding chun intlanna chu siem in tih.

en: In the first month, in the fourteenth day of the month, ye shall have the passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
hmr: Thla hmasatak, chu thla ni sâwm pali ni chun, fekân ruoiṭhe chu nei in tih, ni sari sûng ruoiṭhe chu; chun, chawl ṭhanglo bei chu fâk nîng a tih.

en: And upon that day shall the prince prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bullock for a sin-offering.
hmr: Chu ni chun lal chun ama ta ding le, chu rama mipuihai ta ding chun suol thilinhlâna dingin bâwng- chal buotsai a tih.

en: And the seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt-offering to Jehovah, seven bullocks and seven rams without blemish daily the seven days; and a he-goat daily for a sin-offering.
hmr: Chun, ruoiṭhe ni sari sûnga ding chun LALPA kuoma pumraw- hmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal pasari le berâmchal pasari, demkailo, ni sari sûnga ni tina pakhat pei; chun, kêlchal ni tina pakhat pei, suol thilinhlâna dingin buotsai bawk a tih.

en: And he shall prepare a meal-offering, an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
hmr: Chun, bu thilinhlân, bâwngchal pakhatah epha khat, berâmchal pa- khatah epha khat, ephaa chun hriek hin khat pei leh buotsai bawk a tih.

en: In the seventh month, in the fifteenth day of the month, in the feast, shall he do the like the seven days; according to the sin-offering, according to the burnt-offering, and according to the meal-offering, and according to the oil.
hmr: Thla sarinaa chun, chu thla ni sâwmpangana chun, ruoiṭhenaa ni sari sûng chu angkhat vawngin thâwng a tih; suol thil inhlân ang pei le, pumrawhmang thilinhlân ang pei le, bu thilinhlân ang pei le, hriek thilinhlân ang peiin.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: The gate of the inner court that looketh toward the east shall be shut the six working days; but on the sabbath day it shall be opened, and on the day of the new moon it shall be opened.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: huon sûng tuollai sûngril lem dâi kawtkhâr saktieng sawng saw ni ruk sinthaw sûng po inkhâr a ta; amiruokchu, châwlni chun inhawng a ta, thla thar nia khawm chun inhawng bawk a tih.

en: And the prince shall enter by the way of the porch of the gate without, and shall stand by the post of the gate; and the priests shall prepare his burnt-offering and his peace-offerings, and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate: then he shall go forth; but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
hmr: Dâi kawtkhâr tuolpûk lampuia chun lal chu lût a ta; dâi kawtkhâr bieng sîra chun ngîr a ta, chun, thiempu chun a pumrawhmang thil- inhlân ding le, a inremna thilinhlân dinghai chu buotsai a ta; dâi kawt- khâr tuolpûka chun chibai bûk a ta; chun, fe suok nâwk a ta, amiruokchu, zântieng chen chun dâi kawtkhâr chu khâr ni naw nih.

en: And the people of the land shall worship at the door of that gate before Jehovah on the sabbaths and on the new moons.
hmr: Chun, châwlnihaia le thla thar- haia chun chu ram mipuihai chun LALPA hmaah dâi kawtkhâr lûtnaa chun chibai bûk an tih.

en: And the burnt-offering that the prince shall offer unto Jehovah shall be on the sabbath day six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish;
hmr: Chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlân lalin LALPA kuoma ân hlân ding chu châwlnia ding chu berâmte paruk demkailo, berâmchal demkailo pa- khat leh nîng a ta,

en: and the meal-offering shall be an ephah for the ram, and the meal-offering for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
hmr: chun, bu thilinhlâna ding chun berâmchal pakhatah epha khat; chun, berâmtehai pakhatah bu thilin- hlân ding chu a pêk thei ang ang nîng a ta, chun, epha peia hriek hin khat leh.

en: And on the day of the new moon it shall be a young bullock without blemish, and six lambs, and a ram; they shall be without blemish:
hmr: Chun, thla thar nia ding bâwng- chal tuoi demkailo pakhat nîng a ta; berâmte paruk le berâmchal leh; an rêngin demkailo an ni ding a nih;

en: and he shall prepare a meal-offering, an ephah for the bullock, and an ephah for the ram, and for the lambs according as he is able, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
hmr: bu thilinhlân ding chu buotsai a ta, bâwngchal ding chun epha khat, berâmchal ding chun epha khat bawk; chun, berâmtehai ta ding chun ân hlân thei ang tâwk tâwk nîng a ta; chun, ephaa chun hriek hin khat a ṭhang pei ding a nih.

en: And when the prince shall enter, he shall go in by the way of the porch of the gate, and he shall go forth by the way thereof.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a va lût pha chun dâi kawtkhâr tuolpûk lampuia khan a fe ding a na; chutaka bawk chun a suok nâwk ding a nih.

en: But when the people of the land shall come before Jehovah in the appointed feasts, he that entereth by the way of the north gate to worship shall go forth by the way of the south gate; and he that entereth by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate whereby he came in, but shall go forth straight before him.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, chu rama mi- hai ruoiṭhe hunbi neia LALPA hmaa an hung chun chibai bûk dinga hmârtieng dâi kawtkhâr lampuia lût chu simtieng dâi kawtkhâr lampuia khan a suok ding a nih; chun, simtieng dâi kawtkhâr lampuia lût chu hmârtieng dâi kawtkhâr lampuia khan a suok ding a nih; a hung lûtna dâi kawtkhâr lampuia ma khan a kîr nâwk ding a ni nawh a, amiruokchu, a hmaa khan a fe thleng nghâl lem ding a nih.

en: And the prince, when they go in, shall go in in the midst of them; and when they go forth, they shall go forth together.
hmr: An lût pha chun, lal chu anni le chun a lût ding a na, chun, an suok pha khawma, anni ruolin a suok ding a nih.

en: And in the feasts and in the solemnities the meal-offering shall be an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
hmr: Ruoiṭhenahaia le, ruoiṭhe hunbi neihaia chun bu thilinhlân chu bâwngchal pakhatah epha khat nîng a ta, berâmchal dingin epha khat bawk, chun, berâmtehai ta ding chun a pêk thei zât zât le, epha khata chun hriek hin khat pei leh.

en: And when the prince shall prepare a freewill-offering, a burnt-offering or peace-offerings as a freewill-offering unto Jehovah, one shall open for him the gate that looketh toward the east; and he shall prepare his burnt-offering and his peace-offerings, as he doth on the sabbath day: then he shall go forth; and after his going forth one shall shut the gate.
hmr: Chun, lal chun mâni nuomthua thilinhlân, pumrawhmang thilinhlân amanih, inremna thilinhlân amanih, mâni nuomthua LALPA kuoma thil- inhlân anga a buotsai pha chun, sak- tieng pang ngha dâi kawtkhâr chu mi pakhatin hawngpêk a ta; a pumraw- hmang thilinhlân le, a inremna thil- inhlânhai chu châwlnihaia thaw ang bawk khan buotsai a tih; chun, suok a ta, a suok hnung chun mi pakhatin dâi kawtkhâr chu khâr a tih.

en: And thou shalt prepare a lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt-offering unto Jehovah daily: morning by morning shalt thou prepare it.
hmr: Ni tin LALPA ta dingin pum- rawhmang thilinhlâna dingin berâm- te kum khat mi demkailo buotsai i ta; zîngkâr tina dingin i buotsai ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt prepare a meal-offering with it morning by morning, the sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of a hin of oil, to moisten the fine flour; a meal-offering unto Jehovah continually by a perpetual ordinance.
hmr: Chun, zîng tin tin chun chu le chun bu thilinhlân khawm buotsai i ta, epha hmun ruka ṭhea hmun khat le, hriek hin hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat, chu beiphit inditak chu suk- tlawr dingin; chun, dân um zing angin, LALPA kuoma bu thilinhlân chu a ni zing zing ding a nih.

en: Thus shall they prepare the lamb, and the meal-offering, and the oil, morning by morning, for a continual burnt-offering.
hmr: Chuong ang chun berâmte chu buotsai an ta, bu thilinhlân le, hriek leh, zîng tin tina pumrawhmang thilinhlân zing zing ni ding chun.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: If the prince give a gift unto any of his sons, it is his inheritance, it shall belong to his sons; it is their possession by inheritance.
hmr: “Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: Lalin a naupasal a tu kuom- a khawm thilpêk pe ta ang sienla, ama rochan a na, a naupasalhai ta chu a ni hrim ding a nih; rohluo tieng kawnga an thil chan chu a nih.

en: But if he give of his inheritance a gift to one of his servants, it shall be his to the year of liberty; then it shall return to the prince; but as for his inheritance, it shall be for his sons.
hmr: Amiruokchu, a suok pakhat kuoma chun a rochan chu thilpêk anga a pêk chun; ama chu insuo a ni kum chen chun a ta nîng a ta; chu zoa chun lal kuoma ma chun inkîr nâwk nîng a tih; ama rochan hrim kha chu a naupasalhai ta ding nîng a tih.

en: Moreover the prince shall not take of the people’s inheritance, to thrust them out of their possession; he shall give inheritance to his sons out of his own possession, that my people be not scattered every man from his possession.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun, lal chun an thil neihaia anni nêksâwr dingin mihai rochan chu a lâkpêk ding a ni nawh a; an in le loa inthawk a hnawt suok ding a ni nawh, ama thil neia inthawk ngeiin a naupa- salhai chu rochan a pêk lem ding a na, chuongchun, ka mihai chu mâni thil neia inthawka mi tin chu an indar nawna dingin,” tiin.

en: Then he brought me through the entry, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers for the priests, which looked toward the north: and, behold, there was a place on the hinder part westward.
hmr: Chun, dâi kawtkhâr sîra um lûtna chu a mi fethlengpui a, thiem- puhai pindan inthieng sim sawng- haia chun a mi ṭhuoi tah a; chun, ngai ta, a saktieng pang hnungtienga chun hmun hi a um a.

en: And he said unto me, This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass-offering and the sin-offering, and where they shall bake the meal-offering; that they bring them not forth into the outer court, to sanctify the people.
hmr: Chun, ka kuoma chun, “Hi hi a nih thiempu haiin bawsietna thilin- hlân chu an suongna ding le, suol thilinhlân an suongna ding hmun chu; bu thilinhlân khawm hitaka hin em bawk an tih; chuongchun, mipui chu hlânthieng dingin huon sûng tuollai puo lema chun an hung chawisuok ding a ni nawh,” a ta.

en: Then he brought me forth into the outer court, and caused me to pass by the four corners of the court; and, behold, in every corner of the court there was a court.
hmr: Chun, huon sûng tuollai puo lema chun a mi ṭhuoi a, chuongchun, huon kil lia chun a mîn fethlengtir a; chun, ngai ta, chu huon ki tina chun tuollai hi a um a.

en: In the four corners of the court there were courts inclosed, forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four in the corners were of one measure.
hmr: Huon sûng tuollai kihai pali chun tuollai inhuonkhum, tawng sâwmlia sei, tawng sâwmthuma lien hi a um a; hieng a kihai pali hi intiet seng an nih.

en: And there was a wall round about in them, round about the four, and boiling-places were made under the walls round about.
hmr: An sûnga hmun li sûnga a vêl el chun lung an rem tlar a, chun, a vêl el chun chu tlarhai hnuoia chun suong- na thukhai siem a na.

en: Then said he unto me, These are the boiling-houses, where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifice of the people.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, “Hieng hi thil suongna in, hi in rawngbâwltuhaiin mihai inthâwi- nahai an suongna ding chu a nih,” a tih a.

en: And he brought me back unto the door of the house; and, behold, waters issued out from under the threshold of the house eastward (for the forefront of the house was toward the east); and the waters came down from under, from the right side of the house, on the south of the altar.
hmr: Chun, in kawtkhâra chun a mi ṭhuoi kîr nâwk a; chun, ngai ta, in tuolpûk saktieng panga chun tui hi a suok a, (chu in hmai chu saktieng ngha a ni sih a); chun, tui chu a hnuoia inthawk chun, in changtieng pangah, mâichâm simtieng panga inthawk chun a hung luong thla a.

en: Then he brought me out by the way of the gate northward, and led me round by the way without unto the outer gate, by the way of the gate that looketh toward the east; and, behold, there ran out waters on the right side.
hmr: Chun, hmârtienga dâi kawtkhâr lampuia chun a mi ṭhuoi suok tah a; dâi kawtkhâr saktieng ngha lam- puiah, dâi kawtkhâr puo lem lampuia chun a mi ṭhuoi vêl a; chun, ngai ta, chu changtieng panga chun tui chu a hung luong suok a.

en: When the man went forth eastward with the line in his hand, he measured a thousand cubits, and he caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the ankles.
hmr: Mi a kuta thil tluon chawia sak- tienga fe peia inkhiin, tawng sâng khat ân khi a, kemit chen tlum tui chu a mîn fekaitir a.

en: Again he measured a thousand, and caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the knees. Again he measured a thousand, and caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the loins.
hmr: Chun, tawng sâng ân khi nâwk a, tui khûp tlumah, tui chu a mîn fe- kaitir nâwk a. Chun, sâng ma ân khi nâwk a, tui kâwng tlumah, tui chu a mîn fekaitir nâwk a.

en: Afterward he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass through; for the waters were risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be passed through.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun sâng ân khi nâwk a, vadungpui a hung ni tah a, ka fethleng thei ta nawh a; tui chu a hung insâng a, vadungpui kai thei- lo hiel, inhlieuna khawp a hung ni tah a.

en: And he said unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the bank of the river.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, “Mihriem naupa, hi hi i hmu am?” a tih a. Chun, a mi ṭhuoi a, vadungpui kamah a mîn kîrtir nâwk tah a.

en: Now when I had returned, behold, upon the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
hmr: Chun, chuonga ka kîr lai chun, ngai ta, vadungpui kama chun hi tieng sîr le khing tieng sîra khawm chun thing tamtak an um a.

en: Then said he unto me, These waters issue forth toward the eastern region, and shall go down into the Arabah; and they shall go toward the sea; into the sea shall the waters go which were made to issue forth; and the waters shall be healed.
hmr: Chun, ama chun ka kuomah, “Hieng tuihai hi saktieng rama in- thawka hung suok an na, Arabaa chun fe thlâng an ta; chun, tuisuoriet tieng fe pei an ta, tuipui tui al chu tui inthiengah inchangtir an tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that every living creature which swarmeth, in every place whither the rivers come, shall live; and there shall be a very great multitude of fish; for these waters are come thither, and the waters of the sea shall be healed, and everything shall live whithersoever the river cometh.
hmr: Chun, thilhring tinrêng vadung- puihai fena tieng tienga hung in- khâwmhai chu hring an tih; chun, nga tamtak el hung um an ta; chuong- chun, vadungpui luongna phawta tuipui tuihai ân thiengna ding le thil tinrênghai an hring theina dinga hung luong an nih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that fishers shall stand by it: from En-gedi even unto En-eglaim shall be a place for the spreading of nets; their fish shall be after their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceeding many.
hmr: Chun, nga mantuhai chu a sîra chun ngîr an ta, En-gedia inthawka En-eglaim chenin lênhai dêngna hmun a ni ding a nih; an ngahai chu chi tum tum, tuisuoriet lientak nga- hai angin a tama tam nîng an tih.

en: But the miry places thereof, and the marshes thereof, shall not be healed; they shall be given up to salt.
hmr: Amiruokchu, chutaka dûm hmunhai le dieldâwk hmunhai chu sukthieng ni naw ni hai a, chi dinga mâksan ni lem an tih.

en: And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow every tree for food, whose leaf shall not wither, neither shall the fruit thereof fail: it shall bring forth new fruit every month, because the waters thereof issue out of the sanctuary; and the fruit thereof shall be for food, and the leaf thereof for healing.
hmr: Chun, vadungpui pang sîra chun hi tienga le khingtieng sîra khawm bua ring dingin thinghai ṭo an ta; an hna vuoi ngai naw ni a; an ra khawm hrût ngai bawk naw nih; thla kipin ra thar hung insuong an ta, an ta dingin tuihai hmun inthienga inthawka a hung luong zing leiin; an rahai chu bua ring ding nîng a ta, an hnahai chu sukdamna ding nîng an tih,” a ta.

en: Thus saith the Lord Jehovah: This shall be the border, whereby ye shall divide the land for inheritance according to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions.
hmr: Lalpa PATHIEN chun hieng hin a tih: “Israel hnam sâwmpahni ang peia rochan dinga ram chu i semna ding, ramri chu hi hi nîng a tih: Josef khawma chan hni a nei ding a nih.

en: And ye shall inherit it, one as well as another; for I sware to give it unto your fathers: and this land shall fall unto you for inheritance.
hmr: Chun, hluong in ta, inang seng- in; chu dinga in thlatuhai kuoma pe dinga ka bân ka lo phar tah, hi ram hi in ta dinga rochan dingin a tlu ding a nih.

en: And this shall be the border of the land: On the north side, from the great sea, by the way of Hethlon, unto the entrance of Zedad;
hmr: Hi hi hmârtienga ramri chu nîng a tih; tuisuoriet liena inthawka Hethlon lampui zuiin, Zedad lûtna chenin;

en: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazer-hatticon, which is by the border of Hauran.
hmr: Hamath le, Berotha dâm, Si- braim dâm, chu chu Damaska ramri le Hamath ramri inkâra chun a um a; Hazer-hattikon chu Hauran ramri sîra chun a um bawk a.

en: And the border from the sea, shall be Hazar-enon at the border of Damascus; and on the north northward is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.
hmr: Chun, tuisuorieta inthawka ramri chu Damaska ramria Hazar- enon ramri kha ning a ta; chun hmârtieng chun hmâr khawin Hemath ramri chu a um. Hi hi hmârtieng pang a nih.

en: And the east side, between Hauran and Damascus and Gilead, and the land of Israel, shall be the Jordan; from the north border, unto the east sea shall ye measure. This is the east side.
hmr: Saktieng panga chun, Hauran le Damaska le Gilead le Israel ram inkâra chun, Jordan chu um a ta; hmârtieng ramria inthawk chun saktieng tuisuoriet chen chu inkhi ding a nih. Hi hi saktieng chu nîng a tih.

en: And the south side southward shall be from Tamar as far as the waters of Meriboth-kadesh, to the brook of Egypt, unto the great sea. This is the south side southward.
hmr: Chun, simtienga sim khâw zâwnga chun, Tamara inthawka Meriboth-kades tuihai chen le, Aigupta vadungtê hrawin, tuisuoriet lienah. Hi hi sim tienga, sim khâw zâwng chu a nih.

en: And the west side shall be the great sea, from the south border as far as over against the entrance of Hamath. This is the west side.
hmr: Thlangtienga chun tuisuoriet lien nîng a ta, simtieng ramria in- thawka Hamath hang lûtna ep chen khan. Hi hi thlangtieng pang chu nîng a tih.

en: So shall ye divide this land unto you according to the tribes of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, ram chu Israel hnam ang peiin nangni lai chun insem in tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you and to the strangers that sojourn among you, who shall beget children among you; and they shall be unto you as the home-born among the children of Israel; they shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
hmr: Chun, in ta dinga rochan ding le, nangni laia pêm mikhuol um vehai hi hnunga thlahai la nei dinghai ta ding chun aisânin sem in ta; Israel thlahai laia chun anni chu in ina pieng ang bawk nîng an tih; Israel hnam nangni laia chun rochan chu an chang ve ding a nih.

en: And it shall come to pass, that in what tribe the stranger sojourneth, there shall ye give him his inheritance, saith the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, chu pêm chu a tu hnama khawm lo mikhuol sien, chu hnama chun ama chu a rochan chu pêk nîng a tih, Lalpa PATHIEN chun a tih.

en: Now these are the names of the tribes: From the north end, beside the way of Hethlon to the entrance of Hamath, Hazar-enan at the border of Damascus, northward beside Hamath (and they shall have their sides east and west), Dan, one portion.
hmr: Chun, hienghai hi hnamhai hminghai chu an nih: hmâr tâwpa inthawka, Hethlon lampui sîr peiah, Hamath lûtna, Hamath sîr hmârtienga, Damaska ramri Hazar- enon lûtna chenin; an sîrhai chu saktieng le thlangtienga chun nei an ta; Dan chu, chan khat a nih.

en: And by the border of Dan, from the east side unto the west side, Asher, one portion.
hmr: Dan ramri sîra chun, saktieng panga inthawka thlangtieng pang; Aser, chan khat bawk.

en: And by the border of Asher, from the east side even unto the west side, Naphtali, one portion.
hmr: Aser ramria, saktieng panga in- thawka thlangtieng pang chen; Naphtali, chan khat.

en: And by the border of Naphtali, from the east side unto the west side, Manasseh, one portion.
hmr: Naphtali ramria chun, saktieng panga inthawka thlangtieng pang chen chu, Manasse, chan khat.

en: And by the border of Manasseh, from the east side unto the west side, Ephraim, one portion.
hmr: Manasse ramria chun, saktieng panga inthawka thlangtieng pang chen chu; Ephraim, chan khat.

en: And by the border of Ephraim, from the east side even unto the west side, Reuben, one portion.
hmr: Ephraim ramria chun, saktieng panga inthawka thlangtieng pang chen chun; Reuben, chan khat.

en: And by the border of Reuben, from the east side unto the west side, Judah, one portion.
hmr: Reuben ramria chun, saktienga inthawka thlangtieng chena chun; Juda, chan khat.

en: And by the border of Judah, from the east side unto the west side, shall be the oblation which ye shall offer, five and twenty thousand reeds in breadth, and in length as one of the portions, from the east side unto the west side: and the sanctuary shall be in the midst of it.
hmr: Chun, Juda ramria chun, saktieng panga inthawka thlangtieng pang chen chu, ram thilinhlân in inhlân ding chu nîng a ta, a khang tieng tawng sîng hni sâng nga, a dung tienga chun, saktienga inthawka thlangtieng chena chan khat ang kha nîng a ta; chun, biekin chu a laia chun um a tih.

en: The oblation that ye shall offer unto Jehovah shall be five and twenty thousand reeds in length, and ten thousand in breadth.
hmr: Chun, ram thilinhlân LALPA kuoma in inhlân ding chu tawng sîng hni sâng ngaa sei, a khang tieng sîng khat nîng a ta.

en: And for these, even for the priests, shall be the holy oblation; toward the north five and twenty thousand in length, and toward the west ten thousand in breadth, and toward the east ten thousand in breadth, and toward the south five and twenty thousand in length: and the sanctuary of Jehovah shall be in the midst thereof.
hmr: Chun, hi hi ding hin, thiem- puhai ta ding ngei chun, thilinhlân inthieng chu a um ding a nih; hmârtienga chun a dung tieng tawng sîng hni sâng nga, thlangtienga chun a khang tieng sîng khat, chun, simtienga chun, a dung tieng sîng hni sâng nga, chun LALPA biekin chu chu lailung laia chun a um ding a nih.

en: It shall be for the priests that are sanctified of the sons of Zadok, that have kept my charge, that went not astray when the children of Israel went astray, as the Levites went astray.
hmr: Thiempu Zadok naupasalhai hlânthienga um, ka rawngbâwltuhai ta ding chun a ni ding a nih; Levi mihai an invâk hmang a, Israel thlahai an invâk hmang lai khawma invâk hmang ve lohai chu.

en: And it shall be unto them an oblation from the oblation of the land, a thing most holy, by the border of the Levites.
hmr: Chun, an ta ding chun ram thil- inhlân laia thilinhlân, ân thieng tak, Levi mihai ramria chun a ni ding a nih.

en: And answerable unto the border of the priests, the Levites shall have five and twenty thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth: all the length shall be five and twenty thousand, and the breadth ten thousand.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai ramri zûl pei- ah, Levi mihai chun a dung tieng sîng hni sâng nga, a khang tieng sâng khat an nei ding a nih; a dung tieng hrim hrim chu sîng hni sâng nga ni vawng a ta, a khang tieng chu sîng khat.

en: And they shall sell none of it, nor exchange it, nor shall the first-fruits of the land be alienated; for it is holy unto Jehovah.
hmr: An zawr ding a ni nawh a, in- thleng khawm inthleng bawk naw ni hai; chu ram ra hmasatakhai khawm chu mi dang chana siem ding a ni nawh; LALPA chanpuol a ni sih a.

en: And the five thousand that are left in the breadth, in front of the five and twenty thousand, shall be for common use, for the city, for dwelling and for suburbs; and the city shall be in the midst thereof.
hmr: Chun, sîng hni sâng nga hmaa, a khang tieng sâng nga mâksana la um chu, hmang narâna ding nîng a ta, khawpui ding le chêngna ding le, khawpui khawhnâwma dingin; chun, khawpui sûng chu, chu laia chun a um ding a nih.

en: And these shall be the measures thereof: the north side four thousand and five hundred, and the south side four thousand and five hundred, and on the east side four thousand and five hundred, and the west side four thousand and five hundred.
hmr: Chu lienzie chu hi hi nîng a tih; a hmârtieng pangah tawng sâng li za nga, simtieng panga chun sâng li za nga bawk, saktieng panga chun sâng li za nga, thlangtieng panga chun sang li za nga bawk nîng a tih.

en: And the city shall have suburbs: toward the north two hundred and fifty, and toward the south two hundred and fifty, and toward the east two hundred and fifty, and toward the west two hundred and fifty.
hmr: Khawpui chun khawperhai nei a ta; hmârtienga chun tawng za hni sâwmnga, simtienga chun za hni sâwmnga bawk; saktienga chun za hni sâwmnga, thlangtienga chun za hni sâwmnga bawk nei a tih.

en: And the residue in the length, answerable unto the holy oblation, shall be ten thousand eastward, and ten thousand westward; and it shall be answerable unto the holy oblation; and the increase thereof shall be for food unto them that labor in the city.
hmr: Chun, a dung tieng a la mahla, ram thilinhlân chen chie la um chu, saktienga chun sîng khat nîng a ta, thlangtienga khawm chun sîng khat bawk nîng a tih; ram thilinhlân zui peiah a ni ding a nih; chutaka rasuok chu khawpuia sinthawtuhai fâk ding nîng a tih.

en: And they that labor in the city, out of all the tribes of Israel, shall till it.
hmr: Chun, Israel hnamhai po po laia khawpuia sin thaw mihai chun inlet an tih.

en: All the oblation shall be five and twenty thousand by five and twenty thousand: ye shall offer the holy oblation foursquare, with the possession of the city.
hmr: Ram thilinhlâna siem po po chu sîng hni sâng nga le sîng hni sâng nga bawk inep nîng a tih; chun, thilinhlân inthieng chu a sîr li inangin, khawpui iṭhut sûng ding chun în hlân ding a nih.

en: And the residue shall be for the prince, on the one side and on the other of the holy oblation and of the possession of the city; in front of the five and twenty thousand of the oblation toward the east border, and westward in front of the five and twenty thousand toward the west border, answerable unto the portions, it shall be for the prince: and the holy oblation and the sanctuary of the house shall be in the midst thereof.
hmr: Chun, a la mahla chu lal ta ding nîng a ta, ram thilinhlân inthieng sîr hi tieng le khing tiengah, khawpui sûng ṭhut, thilinhlân saktieng sîra, tawng sîng hni sâng nga hma kha; chun, thlangtieng panga ramria chun, thlangtienga chun sîng hni sâng nga hma bawk kha, chanhai zui pei kha lal ta ding nîng a tih; chun, ram thilinhlân inthieng le in hmun inthieng chu, chu laia chun a um ding a nih.

en: Moreover from the possession of the Levites, and from the possession of the city, being in the midst of that which is the prince’s, between the border of Judah and the border of Benjamin, it shall be for the prince.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun, Levi mihai chana inthawk khan khawpui iṭhutnaa inthawk le khan, chu chu lailia chun lal chan chu a um a, Juda ramri le Benjamin ramri inkâra chun, chu chu lal ta ding nîng a tih.

en: And as for the rest of the tribes: from the east side unto the west side, Benjamin, one portion.
hmr: Chun, hnam danghai chung- thua chun, saktieng panga inthawka thlangtieng pang chen, Benjamin, chan khat.

en: And by the border of Benjamin, from the east side unto the west side, Simeon, one portion.
hmr: Benjamin ramria, saktienga inthawka thlangtieng pang chenah, Simeon, chan khat.
